review: 이 게임은 나에게 정말 미묘한 게임이다 처음에 호쾌하게 앞의 적을 쓸어버리는 매트로베니아 게임인줄 알았지만 진행이 퍼즐을 풀어가며 진행되는것이라 꽤 실망했었다 거기에 처음 보스가 나보다 행동이 빨라보여서 어려운적 있었고, 주인공이 호리호리함 동시에 주인공의 색상이 주변 배경들과 비슷해서 주인공이 어디에 있는지 모르는 경우도 있었고, 몇몇 퍼즐은 너무 어려웠으며, 퍼즐들을  푸는중에 억까도 꽤 있었지만 그래도 계속 하면 할수록 어려운줄 알았던 보스와의 싸움이 익숙해지면 오히려 참신하게 느껴지고, 스토리와 배경 및 캐릭터들이 참 마음에들었다. 종합적으로 다른게임들보다 호불호가 많이 갈렸지만 94% 할인받아 산걸 생각하면 추천을 준다. 그래도 2회차는 하고 싶지 않다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249329264', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1711218096}
review:
First of all this is a puzzle game, including the boss fights, so If you don't like puzzles this game is not for you.
You still need to be somewhat fast to parry, dodge and attack but the most important aspect on the boss fights is understanding what to do and when since the bosses are invulnerable to damage if you do not use the correct action at the correct time.

What this game excels at: 
- Boss fights are really fun and unique: the fist fight felt impossible to complete in the beginning but after properly understanding the mechanics they are really nice to play
- Some Puzzles are pretty challenging and are all quite enjoyable to complete and since they rely heavily on physics there are plenty of ways to complete them

Some not so great things:
- You can't skip dialogues: I get it that they had a certain vision of what they wanted the game experience to be but some of the dialogue just feels really dragged out and I would definitely prefer if there was a button to simply skip it instead of having to keep pressing space
- The movement is ok: they could definitely be better and you will be fighting the movements a bit but it's not the worst, just takes some time to get used to it
- You have to interact with interest points to save their location: this is just a small annoyance but i believe the game would be a lot more enjoyable if this was not a thing, some times I forget to interact with the beacon (fast travel point) and have to walk the long path again  or forget to interact with the locked paths long dialogues and would need to check a external map to remember their locations.

Overall, it's definitely worth buying it on the 94% sale, if i sell the card drops I can get back around half of the price I paid

author: {'steamid': '76561199335959155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1709963341}
review:
気になっていてセールだったので購入。

2体目のボスで苦戦し断念。

アクション苦手な人は買わない方がいいかも。難易度も選べないので。
アクション苦手でも死にゲー好きな人はやれんことはないかも。

ボス戦で何回か負けるとバトル中のパズル要素の説明をしてくれるが煽りでしかない。
更に何回か負けると相手の動きをよく見ろと追加で煽ってくる。
ボスの2段階目の攻撃チャンスが短く、すぐにリセットされる。
要素を理解して集めた瓦礫を攻撃前に全て無かったものにされるため非常にストレス。
アクション苦手だと同じ事を永遠とやらされる羽目になると思われる。

セールで買って正解でした。

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1705775366}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025776935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1702189291}
review:
This game is magical. It's wild nonsense through and through, a physics-based puzzle platformer and an action platformer that are somehow mixed together just jankily enough that it both works and doesn't in just the right ways.

I don't mean this as a big sh*tpost, this game unironically brings me joy. You do need a bit of patience to play it, but for the exact reason I laugh every time I do. The puzzles are both super clever and held together by spit and prayers, in such a way that you won't believe your eyes when something works as intended, and also in such a way that you can do everything correct and have the final piece of junk you need get stuck in a wall... and also somehow accidentally activate the switch on its own by doing that.

It controls a bit clunky, but the action component is actually kinda fun for how run-of-the-mill the combat is! The bosses especially were impressively seamless action puzzles to me, being centered around countering their attacks.
That said, don't expect Super Metroid from the metroidvania component. Largely it feels like the rooms are connected together to make everything feel nice and huge, but it's not really something you can sink your teeth into. Same with the frankly inexplicable skill tree, which can't offer much anything meaningful because it generally doesn't want you to get puzzle tools from it.

And for those saying the PC version is the incomplete one: it has a level editor(?! [b]how does this game have a level editor?![/b])

the story is just kind of ignorable anime nonsense, but i wanna point out [spoiler]did you know lead pollution is heavily correlated with more violent neighborhoods? just saying, the scenario presented in the game isn't that far from a systemic issue that we're already struggling with, and it'd be nice if this game didn't have us automatically resort to killing the afflicted, even if some of them aren't killed in the end. i dunno, it kinda bugs me. It's a thought i had to get out of my mind. don't take it too seriously and just appreciate the gays[/spoiler] 

(also yeah like everyone else I know this game because Game Freak made it but to be honest that's hardly a mark of prestige at this point)

author: {'steamid': '76561198108434270', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1702050710}
review:
'말년은 떨어지는 낙엽도 조심해야한다'를 몸소 보여주는 본격 돌 성형 게임

 한글화가 퀄리티는 낮지만 번역되어서 스토리는 어느정도 이해할 수 있고, 플랫포머 게임 답게 수집요소가 적당히 있어서 재밌게 즐겼지만 물리엔진이 참으로 재밌으면서 욕이나오게 만든다

 초중반은 퍼즐이 퍼즐답다 라고 느껴지면서 플레이했지만 후반부에가니 이게 퍼즐보다는 '물리엔진을 이용해서 어거지로 깨세요'가 느껴질 정도라서 난이도가 있긴해야하지만 불쾌감이 심하게 느껴져서 도중포기할뻔했으며 제일 화가나는 요소는 진짜 작은 파편하나에도 물리엔진이 다 있어서 조작 실수보단 파편으로 죽는경우가 너무 많고 이를 치울수도 없다는것이다

 분명히 괜찮은 게임인데 제일 몰입감이 있어야할 후반부에서 이러니깐 성취감보단 빨리 꺠고 치워야지만 남는 게임이였다

author: {'steamid': '76561199017329378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1695915285}
review:
I knew of this game prior but it was only recently that a friend of mine resurfaced the game in my eyes which made me curious to give it a shot, I did fear of the game being sort of mediocre considering the reception.
But since the game was on sale, I gave it a shot and my fears did not come true.
the game does have flaws considering it was the first time Gamefreak tried something like this but it has a strong potential and the game showcases it decently well.
Just don't treat it as an action game and more as a puzzle game with action elements and as that type of game, it delivers pretty well.
Truly sad that Gamefreak is forever cursed with the Pokemon IP, unable to make games like this one ever again and forced to serve under such capitalist giant it became over years and another sad reality that people slept on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171297187', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1695445034}
review:
看到这个游戏的朋友们、朋友们。啊。。不要急着购买，冷静一点，听听我这个全成就的玩家的苦水，说不定能够帮你省几小时的时间。

接下来，我简单讲两句。

这游戏本质上是一个解密游戏，但是它又加入了战斗和血条。拥有糟糕的镜头（一大块屏幕人物只占了5%，操作都不好操作）以及一个非常狗屎的物理系统。就是游戏里面有很多的石块和垃圾。你要用自己手上的工具来给这些东西塑形，构筑你过关的道路。
别看我这里记载了12个小时的游戏时长。真正流程就四五个小时，其他时间都是被这游戏系统给浪费掉的，就那个……它那个物理系统很垃圾，敌人爆出来的东西或者破坏了的场景会让你脚滑，然后你一滑就掉刺上了，然后就挂了。然后你前期做的准备都没了。这关就只有重来。又要花大量的时间去准备。。

这游戏其实后面还稍微好玩点。前面你拿着它的机制很容易就会把它认为是一个弱智游戏。不推荐给没耐心的碰友，推荐给愿意玩智力游戏，自己的心绪又跟喜马拉雅山上的积雪一样平静得碰友。

[spoiler] 以下就是我在极度愤怒的情况下写的评价了 [/spoiler]

这游戏本质上是一个赌博游戏：你得赌，赌在这神奇的物理系统下，气体会不会恰好飘到你想要的位置，岩石会不会恰好落到你想要的位置，弹球会不会恰好把你弹向你想要的位置…只有在各个不确定因素都恰好满足你所需要的条件，才能够通过障碍到达下一个关卡，这就是这游戏物理系统的[strike] 狗屎 [/strike]魅力。除了浪费玩家时间和情绪之外毫无用处:我解开了谜题。现在只需将构想化为现实。随后我为了解开机关，杀了海量的敌人、布置了许多的场景，然后最后被不知道滚到哪里去了的石块给毁了，我只得重新来过。

明明可以通过做一个步步为营的回溯系统来减少玩家在试错上浪费的时间，但是，游戏开发者显然不想让玩家这么舒服，任何一处出现失误就得从头来过，大大增加了游戏无用的事件。难受程度让我想起了自己小时候写作文。写完之后也不会去读通不通顺，直接交上去让老师难过。

你让我赌物理引擎那飘忽不定的概率的同时，是否会想到，赌桌上自己的筹码是这个游戏的好评。

所以最后我花了钱，浪费了时间在无用的流程上，还一肚子的火。而开发者收到了玩家愤懑的评价，新的玩家被评价劝退，销售额没有达到应有的高度。所以，这一切值得吗？

author: {'steamid': '76561198119807870', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1692788670}
review:
ジャンルがアクションとありますが、メトロイドヴァニア+パズルなゲームだと思います。

[h1]良かった点[/h1]
・ストーリーがとても良かった。
・歯ごたえのある難易度のパズルがあり、面白かった。
・ボスを含めすべての敵に対して明確な対策法が存在しており、対策を試行錯誤するのが楽しかった。

[h1]悪かった点[/h1]
・ゲーム起動時にゲームパッド前提と出る割にはチュートリアル等でボタンの説明がJoystick1等で表示されるため、どのボタンか全然分からなかった。
・結構精密な操作を要求するようなゲームの割にはデフォルトの移動が左スティックに割り当てられており、操作性が最悪だった。→オプションで十字キーに変更できるのでこれを見た人は最初にキーコンフィグを変更することをおすすめします。
・ゲームを勧めていくと強化が進んでいくが、自キャラが強くなりすぎてラスボスに負ける気がしなかった。
・一部ステージでなぜ突破できたのか不明だった部分がある。
・おそらく模範解答通りの動きをしたにもかかわらず再現性が低いのではないかと感じた部分がいくつかあった。

author: {'steamid': '76561197962328359', 'num_games_owned': 3572, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1691857167}
review:
This game is a physics-puzzle action-platformer, with some metroidvania elements, with heavy emphasis on physics puzzles.

You need to collect debris to perform different actions, like slicing, drilling, creating platforms and cubes. Switching room resets the collected debris, so every room has its own limited supply of debris for use in its puzzles, which is a fine idea.

Generally, the game feels a bit messy, mostly due to being a physics puzzle game. Sometimes it goes hard on both being a physics puzzle game and action platformer, where you know what you need to do, but its hard to do a certain step with the right timing, causing you to have to reset the puzzle over and over again and repeat the previous steps.

When running or jumping on physics objects they move around and it isn't unusual to lose grip when walking or landing on them. When killing an enemy they typically generate debris and inert debris, inert debris cannot be collected, but are physics objects. I can't count the number of time I've tried to jump to a platform just to step on a tiny piece of debris and bounce of the platform.

The boss fights had telegraphs and patterns that were consistent, so they were solid.

Overall, I enjoyed it even if it was really frustrating at times.

review:
I found out about this game on a post and I became curious since this game was made by a small team at Game Freak where they had the chance to make their own game.

Overall I really enjoyed playing through this game and I was shocked how small the community is for this game.
Some of the puzzles can be a bit brutal figuring out yourself, but it's not impossible.
I think the highlight of the game was the story, it's some crazy stuff which I was entertained and I liked how characters interacted eachother. The soundtrack became one of my favourites and the artstyle is gorgeous to look at. Also The bosses were fun to beat.

Overall the game was fun to complete, it has some issues but I would recommend to check it anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043880957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1690071755}
review:
I remember when I first seen this on Steam, I fell in love with the style of the game. I decided to cave in during the last summer sale and buy it. I have to say, the game is fun and engaging. The story was evenly paced, the platforming aspect needs a little bit more tuning (I found myself going straight thru platforms I felt like I was going to walk on just fine), I would had loved to have a double jump or some sort of jump compensation, as most 'trick' jumps came down to physics. 

There will be puzzles in this game that is guaranteed to get a rile out of you, I know I had plenty during the last few puzzle rooms. The boss fights in particular are intense.

If I was forced to give a rating, I'd say the game is a solid 8/10. I take 1 off for the physics of the game almost condemning you to reset strictly off of machine parts blocking off push buttons( there is no good way of clearing some spots of body parts, thus you MUST reset the level and try fighting the blocks falling again ).

 The other point being taken off comes from nitpicks that throw the game feel off. There are some things in the environment that will sound obnoxiously loud, trying to adjust this from the menu would lead you to believe it would be tolerable, it wasn't. There is also some sort of grime filter over the screen, with no way of turning this off. I would think that it is there to help with the design of the game, all this did was make some things look fine and others look strange. 

My last nitpick is 1 design choice in particular. There is a skill tree in this game for some reason, you are able to build towards a game play style you like, whether that is chucking blocks, using the blade, using the javelin or drill. One perk in particular is deceiving. I cannot remember the name of the skill, but it boils down to being able to cancel a drill mid flight with recall. This is a wasted skill, most puzzles you will be doing, that drill bit is going to outer space and you will love it doing that. Thankfully this wasn't crippling for me, as you can disable it via the same skill tree. It's a shame that there is an achievement based around getting all of the skills with only one being 'worthless' in my opinion.

If there is any advice I would give to the next person buying this, it'd be 3 things:

1. DO NOT TURN VSYNC ON, IF YOU HAVE 165HZ REFRESH LIKE I DO, THIS WILL MAKE THE GAME UNPLAYABLE, TOO FAST, MENU IS UNUSUABLE. (Unpolished, don't know why this matters at all, just don't do vsync)

2. If you play on a controller and have a nasty habit of pressing buttons on accident, you might want to rebind an ability that comes later in the game *SPOILER* [spoiler] Eventually you will be able to go back in time, this is useful for resetting a level without walking to the portal to reset it, sounds nice right? WELL YOU CAN RESET YOURSELF D U R I N G  A  B O S S F I G H T!!!! It will RESET the fight and take your stupid button mashing ass back outside and think about how you flail around your controller.[/spoiler] Don't be dumb like me, when you get it, rebind it. For those who don't want to spoil themselves,  rebind B on Xbox, or O on PS controllers. I recommend rebinding it to Right Stick Click, as the game has no use for the right stick at all, safe from 'accidents.'

3. Astra Kadru is best girl. This isn't advice, this is a fact.

Closing Comments:
While I rate the game highly, I might not come back to this title for a while. It's one of those games you will enjoy heavily and might not pick it back up. Thankfully, if you do decide to get addicted to the game, there is plenty of custom levels for you to try out. Absolutely wild that they decided to add a level editor to the game, does it help my score at all? Nope. Maybe someone will enjoy that more than me.

review:
這個應該不算是類銀河惡魔城類型的遊戲吧!害我買錯了!
整個遊戲幾乎都是解謎的要素啊。戰鬥根本是0。
好不容易碰到BOSS戰有點期待，結果打沒兩下就結束了。
獲得新武器的設計圖也是拿Skin而已。沒有其它功用。
任務提示不是很清楚，不太知道接下來要去幹麻。特別是拿到回朔能力之後的功用。
傳送點跟電梯無法啟動也沒有相對應的說明。
文本寫的不太好，劇情差。害我完全看不下去。
一下子要快點離開這，一下又說要毀滅這裡。然後又回溯時間。我已經搞不太懂在哪個平行時空了。

我只能說此款遊戲的設計者根本喪心病狂，設計的太難了啦!根本要惡搞玩家拉長遊戲時數吧?
好啦!我承認我不太擅長解謎的遊戲，但是我己經努力過了啊。在同一個地圖卡了半小時，最終不得不去找攻略。
你得必須先有天馬行空的想法才能夠通關!

阿。我已經玩快9小時了。不能退款了。嗚嗚

author: {'steamid': '76561198100859649', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1688865852}
review:
GIGA WRECKER
消費税込みで-90%程度の198円で購入し、「お勧めしない」としています。
プレイ時間は 61分で4/28 の実績を解除しました。返金処理をした上でレビューを投稿しています。
購入動機は、「お勧めしない」レビューを読んだうえで、それでもパズルなら楽しめるかも、と思って購入したためであり、結果としてやはりダメなものはダメ、でした。

ゲームとしては「横スクロール探索型の物理演算パズル（ただしリトライは少し遅い・落下死、トゲ死あり。メトロイドヴァニアと言えなくもない」です。
わたしの感想としては「パズルとしてできが悪い・リトライ性も悪い、クリアはできそうだが時間が無駄」です。

・良いと感じた点
　・物理演算を使って、構造物を壊したり、壊したガレキからギミックを作る、という考え方は面白いと思った。

・悪いと感じた点
　・物理演算を使うのはいいが、その壊れた構造物への当たり判定が有ったり無かったりして、壊れた構造物に乗っかるためにジャンプしたら当たり判定が無くて落下死、という場所があり、物理演算を入れるだけで、ゲームとして何の工夫もしていない、と感じられた。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072340231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1688022566}
review:
It tries to combine action, puzzle and metroidvania games, but kinda fails at all of them.
The fights against enemies are very limited as you either kill an enemy in one hit or don't do any damage at all. You just have to attack enemies in order and that's it. 
A lot of the controls feel a bit clunky as well. You can't make small jumps only high and a bit higher ones (almost not noticeable). The character movement has no momentum, you either stand or run. No slow walking. Jump controls feel weird as well. You have a minimum jump distance which makes platforming harder than it needs to be, as you have to steer your character back after a jump. 
the controls themselves wouldn't be a problem, if the puzzle were matched to it. At the beginning they are okay, but result to two types of puzzles basically:
-Kill all enemies in order
-Reach a certain point

The first one is pretty mundane, but the second type has some interesting ones. In the later parts of the games they get pretty annoying due to quirks of the physic engine.
You randomly can fall through a platform if it's angled to much, pieces fly all over the place when you hit them sometimes not landing where they are supposed to and gravity based puzzles randomly not work (blocks not tipping over or not turning as supposed to). The fact that doing basically the same thing results in different results for some puzzles really kills it, as it becomes a tedious resetting of the same puzzle just to get it work.

The metroidvania part basically results to travelling from room to room, but the only hidden stuff are cosmetics. Power Ups and similar are locked behind a leveling system which you can just farm in normal levels. Besides Hp it also doesn't really provide that much interesting/game altering.

The game tries to tell a story, but fails at 2 points here:
1. The story isn't that interesting and is just split in very very tiny bits
2. The text boxes are barely readable due to their high transparency and white font on glowing backgrounds. I really can't understand how this slipped past testing.

The game introduces new mechanics over time, but everything just feels similar. Bosses are just 2 or 3 counter attacks followed by a normal attack.
It is fun at first, but gets mundane over time, specially due to the glitches in puzzles.

There are better action games, puzzle games and metroidvanias out there, just try one of them instead.
The game might be okay with a huge discount, but not at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968140248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1690597894}
review:
瓦礫の重みを感じさせない挙動が多く、瓦礫を操るというコンセプトはあまり上手く表現できていないように感じます。
物理エンジン任せに無造作にばら撒く破片が邪魔をして解法を再現できなくなるケースが多く、パズルとしてもあまり成り立っていない様に思います。せめて邪魔な破片を片付ける手段があればよかったのですが…
足元の微妙な揺れまで検知して行動をキャンセルする仕様？が事故を多発させる要因となっており、アクション面でもストレスの溜まる局面が多いです。
またブロックが一定の角度を超えると判定が消えてブロックをすり抜けて下に落ちる仕様も直感的な行動を阻害する要因になっています。
全体的にアイデア先行で作り込みが足りない印象が否めず、謳い文句通りの内容を期待する方にはお勧めできません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010267943', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1687110307}
review:
Jesus. Christ. Almighty.

Was this game made by one or two people at GameFreak? Cause the budget seems to be atrociously low.

To the point of having a non-symmetrical character sprite being simply mirrored when you turn left and right.... When the character's everything, but symmetrical: her right arm is human, her left arm is robotic. Or the other way around if you just turn. I swear you can't make this sh*t up.

Ok, but nitpicking aside:
1. This game has awful graphics - art is good, but the technical side lacks polish and basic stuff like anti-aliasing so the sprites don't look like garbage.
2. The writing is typical awful "been there, seen that". The dialogues are just unbearable if you've played more than two japanese games with written dialogues.
3. Gameplay seems to be more of a proof of concept. That's not completely fair for me who only played for half an hour (and had enough), but the game feels half baked.
4. Overall, the budget shows. I can't believe this game was made by GameFreak - feels like one of those indie games usually made by a very small and amateurish studio, or even one person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190356022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1683615576}
review:
アクションゲームではなくパズルゲームとして購入してください。
アクションゲームとして購入すると肩透かしくらいますが、パズルゲームとして購入すると.....まあまあです。

物理演算を使用したパズルは楽しくもあり、ク○でもあります。
正解(に近い)行動をとってもクリアできない時もあれば、なんかクリアできたみたいなことも。

パズルゲームと書きましたが、ボス戦だけはゴリゴリのアクションで結構難易度はあります。
ボス戦のバトルは楽しいですが、ストーリー上で覚えるアクションは一切使いません。。。

エンディングはもう少し練ってほしかったですがキャラクターと雰囲気はいいので一応おすすめしときます。

review:
これはアクションバトルではなくアクションパズルがメインで、バトルはオマケです
ロックマンを想像してこれを買おうとしてる人は一度立ち止まった方がいいです
アルケー能力によって作り出すブロック、ジャベリン、ブレード、ドリルを使ってパズルを解いて扉のロックを解除するのがコンテンツのほぼ9割になります
対ボスバトルでは上述の能力は使いません

ストーリーとキャラクターは高評価で、ロボ娘が好きなら敵キャラも気に入ると思います
絶望的な世界観から始まり、手に入れた力をきっかけに徐々に反撃を始め、
謎に包まれた敵の正体が徐々に明らかになり、最後には…
といった作りは実に楽しめました。
パワーアップ面を担うスキルツリーもシンプルでしたが、ここが複雑だと正直やってられなくなったと思うので合ってたと思います

ストレスフルなのが操作性
通常の横移動や空中制御は結構いい感じなんですが、このゲームはその構造上斜めの地形に立つ事が結構あります
その際、段差から飛び降りるようなモーションを取るのですが、このゲームなぜか段差から飛び降りる最に横方向のベクトルがそこそこかかります
すると何が起きるかというと、高頻度で針山（即死床）に落とされます…
また斜めのガレキは不自然な場所で突然床抜けしたりするのでそういう場面でも落ちます
更に、敵やガレキを破壊すると吸着可能な破片以外はそのままフィールドに転がっているのですが、
なんとこのガレキ乗ることができ、かつ殴って排除できないくせにアルケーブロックなんかの当たり判定はあります
ブロックを置きたいのにガレキの破片が邪魔で置きにくいことが結構あり、落下地点にある破片に着地してそのままポーンと横に飛び出して針山へなんてことも結構ありました
幸いリトライは簡単ですが、微調整ばかり必要なパズルで解けたと思ったら死んでやり直しってのは結構イライラポイントでした

またパズルも、新能力の紹介のような簡単なパズルならともかく、
ガレキが物理演算じみた挙動をするため、終盤になるにつれて必要になってくるのは微調整に次ぐ微調整という感じで、
特にブロックを任意の場所に置けないのが結構イライラします。ブロックを投げれる機能があってもよかったのでは？
そんな感じで終始ストレスを感じっぱなしだったので、ストーリーキャラの評価を押しのけて低評価です

author: {'steamid': '76561198137803102', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1682018282}
review:
Why is this, a physics-based puzzle game, cannot replicate the same physic problem consistently??? Imagine getting the right solution but the game says 'fuck you, repeat the level another 10 times' instead because for some whatever reason the pieces won't fall into the right place despite NOTHING has changed in between tries. That one simple glaring issue is enough for me to not recommend this game because the game just doesn't work right. It feels broken, it feels wrong to play, and that's the game. Just no.

In addition to that, I'm having so much problems with the camera, as sometimes there is an enemy, or traps just off screen that you won't realize that you walk into them. The trigger for the next camera are so far in the distance making matters worse. I'm taking so much leap of faith that my already troublesome trust issues worsens. 

The combat is meh, specifically the enemy damages you despite they're in 'charging' animation. The hitbox extends beyond the attacking parts, but their whole body which seems fine? but I think it's stupid. The boss fights are quite fun, though lacking directions. Call me dumb but I was struggling to fight the first boss because I just don't know what to do. Why would you put a reflex based combat but without even a slight hint that you can counter them? And I feel like the 3rd boss mechanics works best for the first boss compared to the 1st or the 2nd one as it's easier. 

Movement sucks, it doesn't feel right to me. Taking damage bounce you around so much it's frustrating. Blocks make you slide around, and sometimes you pass through the physics blocks. I'm flinging from one place to another I don't even intend to.

Now I don't know how to proceed after my 3rd boss fight... Nice.
Get this game if you want but I'd advise not to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057890454', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1672970875}
review:
Pre-Review Notes
- This review is only for GIGA WRECKER and not GIGA WRECKER ALT. which is Switch only
- Spoiler content will be marked
- Level creator/designer was not used so it will not be mentioned in this review.
- Some personal opinions will be added, but they will be pointed out with key words such as "personally", "I", or in some other way.

[u][b][h1]Main Review[/h1][/b][/u]
[h2]1. Visuals - 8.5/10[/h2]
Unique and vibrant environments make up the background and the platforms of this game. When you reach certain areas with very large backgrounds, the camera would slowly pan out to allow you, the player, to get a full view of the background and all the little animations happening within it. The animations bring the game pieces to life, from background environments to enemies. There are visual indicators as well that work with the environment and to help the player identify which object is what. CGs and cutscenes have very endearing visuals, ranging from the boss cut-in images to CGs used in the beginning/end of the game.

[h2]2. Story - 7.5/10[/h2]
The story is fairly decent for a short game and does its job of giving the player something to engage with. It begins with Reika Rekkeiji, the main character, is imprisoned in a jail/camp. It deals with time dilation/warp as one of the main focal points of the story progression. Personally, it was used very well to ensure that no confusion occurs in the events that play out even with all the time warping that happens. Some morality is touched upon, such as good vs. evil, but the main focus of the story is Reika, the ruined Earth, and the robots. The end of the story is nothing of a bombshell, but gives hope for Reika and [spoiler]Amane[/spoiler].

[h2]3. Sounds (BGM) - 7.5/10[/h2]
The BGM is divided into a few parts; Main Theme, Cutscenes, Area, and Boss music.
The Main Theme is great, using bass and a somewhat upbeat tune seemingly to indicate the desolate land that Reika has to go through against the imposing enemies.
Cutscene BGM gives the same feeling/atmosphere as the Main Theme, albeit with the feeling of curiosity in the unknown being added on.
Each three Area tracks are distinct from one another and all three fit with the respective area boss's personality. A good example is the Mine BGM which sounds more happy or joyful while the area boss herself is a young curious girl who is cared for by the other major antagonists.
The Boss music is done very well, and seems to be the ones that was developed the most. Each Boss track is unique but all have a tinge of similarity to keep the idea that the area bosses are all related. Spoiler ahead: [spoiler]The most distinct Boss track is admittedly Amane's boss track. Amane shows to be losing her sanity towards the corruption and this is reflected in the track, with the track switching from tunes to fast-paced almost-glitchy-like sounds.[/spoiler].
There are not that many tracks in the game, but that is to be expected of a short game.

[h2]4. Characters - 8/10[/h2]
There are a few characters in this game but each have their own personality and is fairly well-built with regards to their demeanour. Reika is a bit pure-hearted and naive, but has a strong will and sticks to her beliefs. She gets character progression with regards to how she learns new information, handles the environment around her, and her interactions with the other characters. Every other character gets their own screen-time when its their turn to say something, but Reika is the main focus. Every other character is somewhat equal in importance with regards to the overarching story. A downside is that we do not learn much about the backstory or the past of any character. We learn a small snippet of how things came to be and even (major spoiler ahead) [spoiler]a short dialogue moment on how the robots were actually human that was turned into robots to stop a disease and the people responsible for it. Oddly enough, this was not talked about much after it was mentioned[/spoiler]. Overall, the characters are memorable as they all pull their own weight to be important in the story.

[h2]5. Gameplay - 8/10[/h2]
The main part of this game is its physics-based gameplay with action being a secondary genre. Reika uses a variety of objects and tools to solve the puzzles, from blades to cut platforms to drills to destroy far blocks. Physics in this game work very well and often produce both predictable and unpredictable results, all of which are satisfying to see. An example is using a Debris Drill to cut the platform above an enemy to make blocks drop and kill them.
A skill tree exists in the game, but mainly just upgrades your health, health regeneration rate, your Debris objects, etc. Some upgrades are far more useful in exploration such as being able to use multiple javelins while some are more useful in boss fights where you can heal during downtime in the fights. Every skill in the skill tree along with achievements are unlockable in one playthrough.
Reika also uses the main feature of the game, which is Debris that you collect to increase your attack range and power or transform into various objects such as cubes and javelins. The Debris is also the only way to defeat the bosses in the game.
With regards to bosses, each boss is very unique and have their own set of attacks and patterns. It is extremely satisfying to learn the pattern and successfully counter their attacks. (Spoiler ahead) [spoiler]The final boss is unique in how she uses some attacks from all three bosses but in a powered-up way[/spoiler]. The gameplay works well when it does, but when the physics does not go how you hoped it went, it gets very frustrating.
A bad part of the gameplay is the actual physics. When it works, it works great but when it doesn't, it becomes a 15-minute stage-reset-fest to redo the puzzle because a block didn't fall exactly where it had to be. A couple puzzles have been extremely frustrating due to objects not working as expected or just some enemies being tedious to deal with such as homing missiles that turn really sharp or a homing bomb that'll fly to you. The constant stage reset that was necessary was very tedious and felt like time-wasters as the failure point of the puzzle could be as far as the end of the puzzle but the restart goes back all the way to the beginning.
Overall, the gameplay has ups and downs. The ups make the game very satisfying to play while the downs simply frustrate and wastes time.
Side note: Achievements are sort of odd. They seem to be cumulative despite the description saying otherwise. An example is the achievement "Watch your head". You have to destroy an enemy with the Debris Lock (debris cube) dropped from more than 10 meters above it, but it will unlock anyways if you drop it above an enemy enough times that the distance it fell from added up to 10 meters.

[h2]Overall: 7.9/10[/h2]
Great physics-based platformer with relatively simple but well-executed and satisfying action combat. The soundtrack is great and does its job well. Characters feel distinct from one another, but mostly lack backstory or a biography of each.
GIGA WRECKER is a great game that is somewhat short, taking me just under 12 hours to finish with all achievements. Base price is a bit high so personally, I would suggest to get this game on a sale, as it gets a large discount of -75% fairly often and will make your money feel more worth it.

Thanks for reading! Feel free to leave a comment if you have any thoughts or if there's something in the review that's missing!

review: Not a bad little game. It's a combination of puzzle-platformer with light metroidvania. The controls are pretty bad - for example, you press the B button to undo everything you've done so far, I can't tell you how many times I've accidentally done that. The puzzles are a bit clunky as well, but pretty unique. A lot of them depend on destructable environments, but they don't always "destruct" the same way. For example, if you need to knock over a wall to create a bridge, the wall doesn't always fall the same way. Perhaps the most frustrating part is the unusable debris. It gets everywhere, and when you are trying to land on a platform only to have some debris fly out from under you, it's quite annoying. But overall, I did enjoy the game, faults and all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260862544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1669482626}
review:
[b]ヘドが出るほどクソつまらない、メトロイドヴァニアのようななにか[/b]。
ガレキを集めて、質量武器にしたり、足場のオブジェクトにできる。

そう聞くと「きっと工夫や閃きがモノをいうアクションパズルゲームなんだろうな」と、[b]善良な夢見る人間なら思う[/b]だろう。
そんな[b]甘さと希望が重なったミルフィーユ[/b]を求めるなら、今すぐケーキ屋さんにでも行くといい。
この唾棄すべきゴミはさしずめ、[b]面倒と作業の重なったミルフィーユ[/b]だ。

敵は強力になるほど防御力が増す。そんな敵に攻撃を通すには、[b]塊を大きくする必要がある[/b]。
ジャンプでは届かない足場がある。その高さまで届く足場を作れるようにするには、[b]塊を大きくする必要がある[/b]。

そう、やるべき事は、塊を大きくする事だけだ。
メトロイドヴァニアならではの、進行によって開放される、[b]追加のアクション・攻撃？そんなものはない[/b]。
ごく序盤のチュートリアルの内に、基本アクションは出揃う。

あとは[b]ずっと代わり映えのしないことを、作業的にひたすら繰り返すだけ[/b]。
アクションパズルを名乗るが、[b]パズル部分は閃きとは無縁で、ひたすら作業的。
どれも「高いところに行くにはどうしよう」だ。足場を作る、それだけに尽きる[/b]。

さらに勘がいい人は気付いたかもしれないが、本作は[b]物理パズルを名乗っている。
狙ったところに足場を置けない。
荒ぶってかっ飛んでいく足場と主人公。
そんなストレス要素ももちろん完備している[/b]。

[b]このゲームに必要なのは、繰り返し作業に耐える忍耐力のみ。
工夫や閃き、知性や発見は、一切必要ない[/b]。
実に画期的なことだ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198044335765', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1669434138}
review:
Finally got around to playing this and I gotta say, Game Freak should really stick to Pokemon games. The physics engine is super wonky, you can do the same action the same way, but your results may vary. The boss fights are honestly very good, but get worse leading up to the final boss fight that, for the life of me, I could not figure out how to dodge most of the moves. I had to use the regen upgrades just to keep myself alive.

The Puzzles start out decent enough and really spark that "Eureka" moment, which always feels nice, but as the same with the bosses, it gets worse over time. In fact, because there are so many puzzles, it gets pretty bad pretty fast. I'm not one to complain about difficulty very often (I enjoy many difficult games such as the Souls series) but the puzzles become so brutal that you really have to wonder about some decisions being made for various puzzle levels, like, do I really need to cross this gap to get the scrap EVERY time the physics decides to fail, when i know I'm doing the right actions? Why are there spikes EVERYWHERE? Isn't it enough that I can absolutely destroy the entire puzzle (in a bad way) and have to start over, but I also can instantly die and have to start over as well?

Another point about the physics, the debris left behind from breakable environments and enemies can be interacted with, but not easily pushed out of the way... unless you are running or landing on it. Many times I had to fall onto a platform, only for the debris in the way to slide me off, or shoot me into an undesirable location, such as a spike pit.

Next, the English translation of the game. Game Freak, if you are reading this, please get 
in contact with me. I will fix all of the dialog, for free. Why? Because its so awful I feel second-hand embarrassment from reading it sometimes. Also, while a bit of a nitpick, why are dialog boxes only 2 lines, before it scrolls up? There is so much wasted space, it feels like they wanted you to see as little of the dialog as possible.

Talking about nitpicks, the art of the main character is all over the place. The in-game sprite looks like she has robot legs and of course her arm, and while the legs could just be armor, it looks nothing like that in the artwork used for cutscenes. Her eye color in artwork is mostly orange with a bit of blue near the pupil, but in her dialog box, its the opposite! Its like they had 3 different people making different parts of the artwork needed, and they all only had a text reference on what the character should look like.

One last thing, lets talk about a bit of the game-play, but in a more overall way. If you are good at puzzles, you will easily clear most puzzles in a single try, maybe until the last few rooms. If you are bad, of course, you'll probably have to keep resetting the room until you get it right. Now I'm not gonna say if you are good at puzzles you'll suck at the bosses, or vice versa. But inside normal enemies and some destructible environments are blue crystals which are used to gain skill points, which in turn, make you slightly stronger when you allocate that point into your skill tree. Resetting a room, DOES NOT remove the EXP you gained, nor does it remove it from the room, meaning you will end up grinding EXP without even realizing it, which sounds nice right? The problem is, if you suck at puzzles you will be better off when you fight the bosses, than if you complete them effortlessly! Shouldn't that be the other way around? If you are clearing the puzzles as intended or within the first few tries you should be rewarded with more skill points/EXP, not less! And likewise, you may feel the need to grind EXP if you are stuck on a difficult boss encounter, which halts the pacing of the game.

Was/is Giga Wrecker a bad game? 
No, not necessarily. If you love physics based puzzles in a anime-ish 2D environment, I think you'd find fun in it. 
So, is it a good game?
Not a chance in hell. If I had to give a metaphor for what this game is like, it would be; 

[u]Playing Giga Wrecker is like going onto the website "CoolMathGames" and playing a physics-based puzzle game when you were/are in school during a computer lab. If you could've played something else during school, you would've, but every website is blocked and you have no other options. [/u]


If I had to give some advice to Game Freak, wholeheartedly, and not cynically at all. Keep the puzzles either tidy without so much destructible stuff, or have stuff you cannot lift over your head just fall out of bounds through the ground, because the game got so much worse with the more stuff you piled into each screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084546349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1663002710}
review: Simply put, this game is badly designed, there's no other way to put it or dance around that, it's the truth. The camera goes way too far back for a side scroller to the point I can't see what I am doing when the devs expect me to solve boring and generally unfun platform puzzles that do not hold the attention of the player at all. Simply put, the overall gameplay is boring beyond just the puzzle elements; A good example of this would be the gimmicky nature of the weird robot arm our lead protagonist has that collects junk, that's too much of a nintendo thing, those impractical gimmicks are something nintendo needs to really stop doing, because it's annoying and not fun. The psysics for movement are jerky and it seems that this handicap is used against the player to create an "artifical difficulty." Take note, devs, increased difficulty due to poor design choices does not equate to a legitamate challenge, what it does equate to is bad game design and shows a lack of discipline on the devs part. This isn't the 1980's anymore, and things like "hindered movement in video games" are no longer excusable in this day in age because we got the tech and prior knowledge to negate this. Lastly, I'll point out that it feels like a lot of what was done here by gamefreak was influenced by bad business decsions nintendo has made in the past, perhaps gamefreak should "disregard" their handlers bad habits if they want to make games outside the realm of pokemon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045708557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1660902159}
review:
재밌음. 야숨 퍼즐에 봐온 물리엔진 퍼즐이 잔뜩 나오는데,

 후반에는 갑자기 가시 점프 플랫폼 요소 많아서 당황하긴 했음.

플탐은 10시간 나왔는데, 퍼즐게임이라 그런지 체감 20시간은 넘게 한거같음. 

도전과제도 어려운 거 없어서 노려볼만함. 

다만 조작이 좀 짜증 남. 제일 큰 문제가 캐릭터가 조금이라도 높이가 있는 곳에서 

지상으로 내려오면 살짝 딜레이가 있는데. 

이게 점프 입력을 씹어버려서 개같은 바위 쪼가리 밟고 점프 씹혀서 그대로 낙하해서 뒤지는 각 많이 나옴.

마찬가지로 덜컹거리는 상자 (데브리 락만들면 관성으로 좌우 덜컹거림)을 

발판으로 쓸 때도 좌우 갸우뚱할 때 미끄러져서 점프 안돼서 뒤지고 시발

또 잔해 흡수 지속시간이 왜이리 필요이상으로 짧은지 모르겠음.  너무 짧아서 멀리 있는 잔해가 날라오다 

흡수 타이밍 끝나서 관성으로 뒤로 날아가고 낭떠러지로 빠져서 소실해 버릴 때도 있는데 

잔해 꼬박꼬박 다 수집해야 열리는 퍼즐도 있어서,  에라이

review:
It's a platformer. Not really much else to say. There's some attack functions and destructible environment too, and a level editor.
There's some pretty art related to the story cut scenes.
I appreciated having the ability to skip lengthy dialog by pressing the Start button.
Personally, I think platformers are boring. I got this game as part of a bundle last October and hadn't claimed it.
 If you like platformers, go ahead and get this. It's definitely a platformer. If you like story driven games, this game does have a story (something about a potential future, two rivals being interrupted by an alien threat, and the protagonist being augmented after a fatal injury).
 I'm rating this as a no, because it's just another platformer, and I don't care about story driven games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327885667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1658647230}
review:
买了好久，今天通关了
这游戏总的来说的堆箱子搭桥之类的解密游戏，但是有的解密部分有运气的要求，运气不好石块掉落能让你想摔手柄。
有战斗但是战斗很不爽快，有时候主角攻击动作出来了但是攻击块就是不动。
平台跳跃上，你平地上看主角急停急转很灵活，脚底摩擦力充足，一跳到到平台边缘就会莫名其妙脚底打滑直接滑到谷底去了。
剧情是更是一坨，当初买是因为这游戏是GF做的，那时候想着好歹是做了口袋妖怪的公司应该没问题，结果从手感到游戏性再到剧情全面拉跨。
不建议除了做吐槽视频的人入手

author: {'steamid': '76561199141040297', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1654604912}
review: 恶心人的游戏，小怪简单到一碰就死，但设计那个敌方炮台，放在那么高的位置。每次我要上去打掉它都得先合成方块踮脚跳跃，跳跃的途中炮台就发射炮弹，自动追踪，速度又飞快，碰一下我就被击退掉下去。我想要在跳跃的空中用技能砍炮弹，就又要把合成的方块分解掉按L，根本来不及，结果就是在这种没意义的地方重复的浪费时间。炮台的伤害很低，不会打死人，但就是要让人不断重复跳跃，直到打死那个炮台为止。这种没有一点乐趣的游戏设计，你说高解密吧，一点解密元素也没有，高难度吧，小怪其实很弱，就是纯粹设计出来恶心人的。剧情又是无聊的一比，根本不知道这个游戏有什么好玩的，完全是被画风骗了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198441986732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1651694582}
review:
13个小时通关，打的心力憔悴，不会再开第二次了

画风和配乐都还不错，角色设计很好看，剧情推荐不带脑子看
四种特殊能力和地形破坏要素想法很好，实现起来小问题较多

大问题在于游戏倾向过于平均，战斗和解密占据的要素几乎持平，造成了你想要解密时会有敌人干扰你，你想要战斗时谜题在阻碍你，让整体的游玩体验并不好，整体流程就像是在需要精准操作的平台跳跃游戏中加入海量敌人，你不光要跳的准，时机把握的对，还得提防敌人守株待兔给你一拳把你打到触之即死的尖刺上或深坑里，搞心态还是有一手的啊不愧是你，与这点相比中规中矩的流程BOSS战反而更像令人放松的调剂了

地形破坏想法很好，但在游玩体验中不可控性过大，我无法准确判断我的攻击是否能够达到我需要的效果，就算达到我需要的效果，我也无法准确判断这之后被我破坏的地形会受到什么样的影响，起点和终点都一定程度上不可控，让我的解密体验如同开盲盒一样惊险刺激，过了可能是我操作得当，也可能是我运气爆棚

BOSS战很标准，每个BOSS都有数种攻击模式，生命值降至一定程度后强化全部攻击，每种攻击模式都有破解的方式，但跑图搞心态的持续影响下，我在BOSS战中是以一种焦躁的心态游玩的，多少会让我的BOSS战感觉变差，在这里点名批评最终BOSS的虫洞攻击，其他都是技巧到这里就变成了底力，我得快速连按RB同时躲剑雨，每次重打都能让我的食指疼半天，如果让RB变成按住持续吸取会舒服得多

总之，游戏体感就那样，有优秀的潜质可惜游玩体验拉了跨，建议策划给美术磕个头，不推荐大众游玩，除非你特别喜欢银河城游戏可以考虑入一下

author: {'steamid': '76561198054302464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1648386087}
review:
パズルゲームなのだがパズルの解法が非常にあいまい。適当に試してみて運よく正解を引くのを待つしかないパズルが多く、パズルを解くという楽しみはない。とにかく作りが雑である。

アクションゲームとしてはカメラワークが異常に悪く、プレイヤーがフレームアウトしたり、引きすぎて敵が視認できなくなったり落とし穴と順路の違いが判らなかったりと酷い有様。３Ｄならともかく２Ｄでここまでカメラが駄目なゲームは初めてだ。

スキルツリーがあるがバトル用のスキルしかなく、ほぼ無意味。なぜならこのゲームの９割はパズルを解くことであり、バトルの機会自体が少ないからだ。ちなみにボスバトルだけは変な物理演算もなく普通に遊べる。ただし最初のボスが一番強く、後はどんどん尻すぼみになっていく謎調整である。

きちんと調整していけば面白くなりそうな気がするが現状ではパズル好きにもメトロイドヴァニ好きにもお勧めできない残念なゲーム。

author: {'steamid': '76561198152835283', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1647824514}
review:
[h1]You may not want to buy this game on steam![/h1]
Why? This game is absolutely awesome?
Because there is a newer Version of it: "Giga Wrecker Alt.", which is [u]CONSOLE EXCLUSIVE[/u] and will [u]NEVER COME TO PC[/u]. That version can be found on various consoles (like the Switch), so if you like the extra content (more rooms, more lore and an alternative ending), go buy it there!

Aside from that, as mentioned before, the game is [i]awesome[/i] (even without the extra content).
It features:
- [b]Completely unique mechanics![/b]
- Smooth controls.
- Really cool abilities, you can use creatively even outside of telegraphed situations.
- Interesting enemy types that are different from each other.
- Challenging and interesting puzzles.
- Secrets and unlockables!
- Insanely cool and quite challenging bossfights against well desinged bosses.
- A crazy and quite mature story.
- Really good art and sound design.
And - most importantly, of course - [i]cute girls![/i]

The game is mostly a puzzle game, where you whack your way through a series of environmental hazards, that you need to use to your advantage. By utilising the various tools at your disposal, you shape the mostly destructible environment to help you in the current situation.
It has quite a lot of (even optional) content and uses it's completely unique mechanics really well.
Sometimes, you might even feel like you are in the old school game "Crazy Machines", but as a cute girl smashing robots to bits. This feeling is furthered by the fact that there is a [b]LEVEL EDITOR[/b] where you can create your own puzzles or play those of the (small) online community.
Last but not least, the bossfights are quite epic, with tricky attack patterns you need to learn and their own gimmics each you need to understand to defeat them. These bosses are actually quite hard for a game that lays its focus on puzzles, so be prepared.

There are only few things one can criticize:
-  The physics are quite whacky somtimes. Because of that, you may need to replay a few riddles to get the destructible environment to move the way you want.
However, the game conveniently offers a reset-mechanic, which makes life much easier!
- There is a skill-tree, where you can find actually impactful abilities.
However, it has a few downsides: You can make progression through grinding, which is always questionable in an "ability progression"-based game. Also, with all the upgades, you have so much passive healing, that most damage becomes irrelevant, except for the final boss maybe. Then, there is one talent pretty deep in the skill tree, that is [i]required[/i] to get a certain secret with no other way to reach it. BAD MOVE!
Again, it is not that bad, since you can [b]deactivate[/b] any talent you don't want at any given time (i wish, more games would allow this!). Also, you will probably get enough XP to unlock all talents just by finishing the game and getting most secrets, so no grinding needed.

The characters are also pretty well introduced and quite likable, even the MC is nowhere near as bland as you are used to.

Did i mention the [i]cute girls[/i]?

author: {'steamid': '76561198008969278', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1644014864}
review:
This is a physics puzzle platformer and a pretty good one. Despite the map it's not really a metroidvania type game as you never really have to go back to areas you've already cleared, the map is just a way to organize each puzzle room. Story's alright, the mechanics are pretty good, boss fights are solid, but there's a few things that made the game frustrating:

1. Since there's ways to mess up a puzzle room unsolvably, most rooms have an object that lets you reset the room by hitting 'up' while you're on it. Later in the game you can reset a room from anywhere using a gamepad button. Hitting this button by accident while solving a puzzle is incredibly frustrating.

2. Because of the physics, there's a few puzzle rooms that you have to RNG because a pixel difference one way or the other can determine whether a laser bounces to its lock or is a few off. Nothing to do except keep resetting the room to try again.

3. Related to the physics, jumping on objects that are moving (either falling or rotating) is completely random as to whether you'll land on it or fall right through it. Surfaces at specific angles can't be stood on, so if an object is tumbling in the air there's a good chance you'll just phase through it to your death

It's still a fun game and no puzzle took more than a few minutes to solve, but the nature of the physics means the game requires a bit of patience. Also, I straight up cheated one of the cog puzzles, because a block can occasionally randomly work to unlock a rotation cog.

author: {'steamid': '76561199087447834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1641847805}
review:
Best part puzzles and bosses, less so the parts where the physics gets finnicky

Well, I liked quite a few of the puzzles, and the bosses were pretty good (though I found they sometimes needed a little trial and error to find out what works). Although, it was also pretty often that the physics messed up a little or did something really annoying, like for example I can pretty much just slip on this one tiny piece of debris and fall headfirst into spikes (thus resetting the room). These are all very minor things, but even so I never really found myself associating the game with any feel like you might with most other games. I'm not sure what it was but the game just felt a bit forgettable as I was playing it, just a bunch of puzzles between some bosses and it felt like that was pretty much it. At least the backgrounds were interesting (probably most striking part of screenshots). I'd say it's a C-tier metroidvania (though it's debatable whether it should even count as one).

author: {'steamid': '76561198064616944', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1638646592}
review:
[u][b]This is a mixed review, more in the middle rather than a positive or negative review.[/b][/u]


Speaking of the good first, it has nice music, great puzzles, and some nice boss fights. It is definitely quite interesting in that regard. The art style, when you get used to it, can look nice, but it's especially great and beautiful in the art cutscene bits and overworld sprites.
I had quite a bit of fun whenever the story wasn't mentioned and I was just playing through it. Well, besides the times I got frustrated. But other than that, I did have fun.

This also does have a level editor which is pretty great to have and with it you can check the workshop and download all sorts of maps so that's good fun.

But speaking of the negatives, on the minor stuff, the translation is a bit spotty with also some typos here and there, the art style at the start can get a bit busy but as I've said, once you get used to it then it's fine and the game can get infuriating at times but with a puzzle metroidvania it's part of the style but, for the biggest negative it has to be the story, it is absolute nonsense, full of loose ends, a bit all over the place and just terrible, in biggest part because of the main character, she is quite literally amazingly dense, insane, with weird motivations if she even has some at any given point and quite possibly blind and forgetful too, she is so infuriating and the whole story being a mess as it is it doesn't help.


Saving someone whose only interaction with her was them trying to kill us, forgetting or refusing to ask the question she wanted to ask as the only motivation to save said person, being generally stupid, it goes on and on. I am glad that the three sisters are decent characters along with the scientist. Without them and the decent gameplay, this would have been much, MUCH worse to play through than it already is.

I cannot say it enough, this story is just nonsense, and no matter how decent the rest of the game is, it can't pull itself up with this massive anchor on it, and given this type of game, it needed to have a decent story imo.
It's a sinking ship, and no amount of floaters can pull it back up.


Overall, it had great potential, and it does have decent gameplay and music with a unique art style and a nice level editor, but despite the good amount of fun I had, for how bad the story is, I can't recommend this, which is unfortunate because I really wanted to. If you don't care much for story then this should still be good for you.

review:
缺陷跟优点同样突出的游戏，美术风格极其出色，物理模拟可圈可点。

但是作为一个伪银河城，地图设置很迷。内容上偏少，区域也就4个，BOSS也就总共5个（其中三个加强攻击范围血量重复遍）。
物理解谜虽然很多时候很好，但也有很多时候糟糕的判定跟碰撞打散逻辑的连贯性。

类型组合上也是很尴尬，想当做ACT银河城玩的会发现主要流程其实都是解谜。当解谜玩的会发现BOSS战其实挺需要操作的结果打不过去。

review:
This game is a severely mixed bag. 

The combat is nice if basic and the physics puzzles are cool. The game seems to linear to really be deserving to be called metroidvania. And most secrets you find are just skins for your weapon and box. 

But the story and characters are complete garbage. Visually they have this weird frost filter over your screen at all times which is distracting. And then there is the elevator music. Just one track that loops indefinitely. A lot of indie games just disregard sound design and music but the people who made pokemon can't really use that excuse.

author: {'steamid': '76561199104758645', 'num_games_owned': 944, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1637849139}
review:
我当初以为是恶魔城游戏才入手的，实际上就是个解密类的2D版二次元风格的游戏，略微有些恶魔城，毕竟怪还是多的，地图略微小些。整个游戏玩法主要都是解密加手速，每个地方都离不开解密，甚至打boss也要解密，这些机制也就算了。最恶心的是你游物理引擎就离谱，过45度角的斜坡就会走着走着掉下来，跳着跳着也一样；各台子跳到边缘自带打滑！最后一点就是被击退距离长得离谱，有的图设计的已经够阴间了，这个击退距离我不知道被坑了多少次，每次看到烈华“啊”的一叫掉在悬崖下都觉得难受啊。
当然，本游戏还有优点，零碎类似三周目的时光倒流科幻剧情让我吸引，4种不同的攻击方式以及该游的创意工坊等。如果你不想被其物理引擎所坑，最好别入；如果你是真心喜欢这种科幻剧情和画风的2D解密游戏的话，我非常推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004839075', 'num_games_owned': 1986, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1635347426}
review:
In tragically typically anime fashion, the dialogue is painfully long to say the simplest of things with trite expressions of surprise to things that shouldn't be surprising. 

The physics are janky. 

The gamplay puts it between a metroidvania, and a single room puzzle games (the style where they start with 1-1, to 1-10, then you move on to 2-1 and so on). I wish there was more roam around and fighting while platforming. But this really feels like any roaming you do is just to get from one puzzle room to the next. But on the other hand, I like that it does set itself apart this way. Creates something new to try. Not something i prefer, but I woudln't want every game to just be the same. 

The art is stunning, but you can see that for yourself. The theme for your abilities is interesting, and fun. The mission are just enough to make me want to keep playing. 

This is almost enough for a thumbs up. The thing that keeps it from being an easy recommendation is the jank. The jank is very bad. It's somewhat of a physics game, so some jank is expected. But I finally am changing my barley thumb up to a barley thumb down. The puzzle that convinced me was one where you drop a rock perfectly into a slot so a lazer bounces where it need to. But when you drop that rock perfectly, it vibrates in place. The spazing out of the rock causes the lazer reflecting off it to spaz out, and the puzzle in unachievable. This hasn't stopped progress, but has stopped me from accessing whatever is behind that puzzle. Even this alone doesn't make me thumb down. But it was the final straw, and the worst scenario. I tried many times to hope for RNG against the jank. That has worked on other puzzles. But not this time. Consistent jank. This game just wasn't ready for release. The probles is so fundamental to the game I doubt it ever will be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289642327', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1634161312}
review:
Una especie de metroidvania donde cada sala del mundo es un puzle que juega con las físicas. La idea suena interesante, aunque en mi opinión ciertas salas presentan retos excesivamente aleatorios y que pueden frustrar a más de uno. Eso no quita que haya algunas salas con retos muy bien pensados.
El diseño artístico del juego es excelente, aunque presenta también algunos escenarios más genéricos y que en ocasiones se pueden hacer monótonos. La banda sonora acompaña muy bien, aunque se agradecería algún tema adicional, ya que tras pasar una hora en la misma zona del juego se puede hacer repetitiva. Sin embargo, los temas que acompañan a las batallas contra jefes son especialmente buenos.
El árbol de habilidades en el que se invierten los puntos de experiencia conseguidos me ha parecido demasiado confuso, y con una navegación demasiado complicada para un árbol tan grande. A veces, el tener que mover el cursor hasta la habilidad que quería desbloquear me ha hecho esperar a acumular más experiencia para tener que navegar por ese menú lo menos posible.
En definitiva, es un juego al que, personalmente, le encuentro muchas luces y sombras, pero creo que su propuesta es lo suficientemente interesante como para darle una oportunidad. Si te atrae el concepto y te entra por los ojos (ya que el apartado artístico fue lo primero que me llamó la atención), entonces creo que merece la pena. Cuenta además con un editor de niveles y campañas hechas por la comunidad que todavía no he probado, pero que pueden aportarle un extra de duración y originalidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289966040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1632699888}
review:
[h1]インディーゲームなら許される完成度[/h1]

総合評価：50点。

クリア済。実績は9割解除。
これを開発したのは「ポケモン」で有名なゲームフリークである。
正直、めちゃくちゃ期待外れだった。ポケモンのヒットが偶然だったと言われても納得する。

バラバラのガレキを集めて大きい塊にして、どーんと破壊！という本作のコンセプトは理解する。
ただ、非常に完成度が低い。いろんな要素をくっつけてキメラ化し、どれもこれも半端になってしまった悲しき実験体が本作だ。奇しくもそのコンセプトと同じく、勢いで世に出したはいいものの、「核」となるテーマを見失ったガレキは空中分解となった。
ひとつひとつの要素は面白そうなのに、それぞれがいい具合に殺し合いをしてくれている。

もしこれからプレイするのであれば
[b]「ジャベリンはかなり重い」[/b]
これを覚えておいてくれ。

[h1]よかったところ[/h1]
道に落ちているガレキや敵をスクラップにし、更にでかい塊を作ってぶっ壊し進む！という戦闘方法はとても好み。
好みなのだが…戦闘や破壊がメインだったらどれだけ良かったことだろうね…

キャラクターデザインは多少クセがあるが特徴的で良い。
敵キャラも含め、出てくるキャラは1名除いてみんな女の子。かわいい。男の子か？と疑うキャラもいたけど、ロボットだからどっちでもいいね？

復讐だ！オメーら全部ぶっ壊してやんよ！という主人公の行動。嫌いじゃないよ！
まあ、シナリオライターさん仮面ライダー好きなんだろうな…という感じはある。
ただこれも後半「ん？」ってなるので後述。

[h1] だめなところ[/h1]
他のレビューにもあるように、アクションとパズルの食い合わせが悪い。
この原因は、パズルをさせたいがためにアクションをかなり制限していることにある。
スキルツリーがあるのだが、いくらスキルを開放しようとも、メトロイドヴァニア系ゲームでお馴染みのダッシュ能力や空中ダッシュ、上昇攻撃や2段ジャンプその他は無い。攻撃手段が増えるわけでもなく「ライフ最大値を増やす」が大半であり、面白いアクションが追加されることはない。
なお、これについてはスキルツリーの醍醐味である「取捨選択の面白み」が全くないのもキツい。
探索で手に入る「設計図」は武器の外観が変わるだけのオマケでしかないし、ほとんどの敵は決まった手順を踏まなければ倒せない。
このせいで戦闘・破壊の爽快感といったものはほぼ無く、俺がやりたかった「ガレキで敵をなぎ倒すぶっ壊しアクション」は全く存在しなかった。少しはあると思ったのに、マジで全くなかった。

物理演算パズルということなので多少無茶した解法が許されるかと思いきや、前述のとおり主人公の動きがかなり制限されているせいで、ほぼ制作の意図通りに動かないとクリアできず（後半のステージは特に）、かつ動きの予測できない物理演算パズルを何度も何度もやり直しさせられるので賽の河原で石を積むのが大好きなドMにお勧め。毒ガスギミックだけはマジで許されないと思う。
かと思えばパズル部分でグリッチめいた動きをすることが正攻法だったりするので、何がしたいのか良くわからない。

また、ボスの強さに差がありすぎるうえに順番がおかしい。
最初のボスがかなり強いのだが、ほかのボスは弱すぎて初見撃破。強化ボスも初見撃破。ラスボスも回復能力のおかげで初見撃破。ラスボスは回復能力がなければ多少苦戦するかも？ってレベルで、特別に強いわけでもない。ほんとにテストプレイした？
さらに、強化ボスも攻略法は変わらず、動きも変わらないし、大して強くなってない。ただし前述の「最初のボス」だけは目に見えて強くなってて、攻撃を当てるまで必要な工程が一手増えている。まあ動きは変わらんけど。

さらに、ストーリーに関しても前半はいいが後半になるにつれて[spoiler]主人公の動機から「復讐」がいつの間にか消え失せ、敵と和解できるかも！みたいなことを言い出す。それ自体はいいんだけどあまりに唐突すぎてついていけない。どういう過程でその考えに変わったの？[/spoiler]
あとラスボスは[spoiler]未来の主人公なんだろうけど、せっかくの美味そうな設定をまったく活かせていない。「ご想像にお任せしまーす」とばかりにぶん投げて終わった。「その後は想像してねエンド」は嫌いではないが、これはただぶった切って放棄しただけだろう。未来人のアマネももう少し掘り下げて良いキャラにできただろうに、特になし。設定を説明してくれるだけの存在であった。[/spoiler]
うーん…やっぱり開発の締め切りまで時間なかったんじゃないのこのゲーム？

[h1]総論[/h1]
パズルゲーだとは聞いていたがここまで完成度の低い面白くないパズルをやらされるとは思っていなかった。
戦闘要素ももう少しくらいはあるだろうと思っていたけど、ほとんどない。戦闘はボスとの戦いだけで、それも大して面白さにはつながっていなかった。
ガレキを使うコンセプト、ギミックアクションパズル、スキルツリーでの主人公の成長。それぞれの要素は好みなだけに、どれかひとつでも完成度が高かったらもっと評価できたと思うのだが、申し訳ない。人に勧められるようなゲームではなかった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097991126', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1669437294}
review:
CRIMINALLY underrated game. I get that it's more of an experimental game that ventures into some very new territory when it comes to 2D physics, but man, there is so much good about this game and I have no clue why no one knows about it. Like, seriously? If you go to any image board there is next to ZERO fanart for this game. I haven't heard of anyone talk about this game whatsoever. The OST has sub-10K views on YouTube. There are literally 2 people who speedrun this game. It's made by GAME FREAK. What is going on???

Game tl;dr in case you consider buying it: Puzzle platformer where you manipulate terrain in a lot of unique ways.

The gameplay is quite well-done. While some mechanics could have been explored further and the overall level/boss design could have been more complex, they took a concept and absolutely ran away with it. I don't know of any real game-breaking glitches but the way that they handled the physics was very clean and I absolutely enjoyed every inch of it. Skill tree system was the only thing that I found kind of clunky, especially since you could just farm XP and level your whole tree pretty easily and it's not like any of the abilities were really that useful.

As for why there isn't any fanart, it's probably because the game already looks so uniquely beautiful in and of itself. I was wondering why it looked familiar - the art in this game is done by none other than Asagiri (asgr). If you haven't heard of them, just go look them up on an image board. Where I come from I see their art a lot. It's beautiful, with such great use of sharp polygonal imagery with hugely vibrant and contrasting colours - so calculated yet expressive. It's not quite sci-fi because it doesn't even feel remotely like our world.

Music is god tier. I think this kind of electronic music is just so under-represented in video games because it's not mainstream. But it just fits so well here. They didn't water down shit, they went all-out and that is what matters.

The story was something I had seen a lot of times, and I can tell they might have had further plans to go with it, but probably didn't have the space to, or just planned it for a possible sequel. It was still well-executed for the scope it covered. Spoiler: it's about Buddhism. Follow the eightfold path and free yourself from the cycle of death and rebirth. Didn't go as far as I wanted with it, but I'm used to a lot more so it's probably still very adequate.

Either way, my only substantial complaint is that there's not more of this. This is the exact artstyle I like, with the exact music style I like, with the exact kind of puzzle I like. Only 10 hours or so to 100% the game, but what a trip the entire way through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143527640', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1618496766}
review:
[h1] 不只画面炫酷的半机械美少女解密游戏 [/h1] 
     首先不得不承认这游戏第一眼吸引我的地方是独特的美术风格，色彩极其鲜艳，夸张的风格加上半机械大刀，钻头与美少女的组合，浪漫！
     游戏不只美术风格出众，游戏性也值得一提，本游戏是以物理引擎为主的解密游戏，游戏的核心是女主破坏地图场景，敌人，利用叠方块当垫脚石，光线折射，利用浮力，重力，弹力，惯性等解密。虽然是解密游戏，但敌人破坏在其中占比很重，加上大刀大机械块的破坏快感，经常让我忘记这是解密游戏。
     在画面和游戏性兼具的情况下，没想到本作的剧情仍然给了我一定惊喜，虽然我的期望放得不高，但剧情还是在游戏过程中给了我不少的良好体验，让我很期待接下来故事会有何进展。
     
PS:有些解密关卡仍然脑死，这时候可以试试换个思路，因为自由的物理引擎，不少关卡完全可以不利用作者给的机关和思路，用邪道方法通过，这也是游戏一大乐趣。     打折史低应该是27，因为这游戏在我愿望单躺了4年左右，终于等到个机会打折力度很大才入）

author: {'steamid': '76561198096606031', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1617278441}
review:
10小时通关。强烈不推荐。被美术风格吸引话的劝你不要入。

首先说说操作，我是用DS4玩的全程，只能说操作的设定无法理解。
1是按↑键互动。判定宽松的离谱，但凡你摇杆稍微拉上一点角度，就会触发游戏中的进门、存档、时间回溯等等，严重破坏游戏流畅性。而且很多时候是在你对谜题做了一系列的设计准备解密的时候，就因为稍微拉了一点向上的方向路过时间回溯点，所有努力全部木大。。
2是三种特殊攻击，剑、标枪、电钻。剑还好，是绑定的△键，然而标枪和电钻一个是↑+△一个是↓+△。其实这也不算离谱，但是这个事情离谱就离谱在，R2键和L2键本身是没有任何默认绑定的。整个游戏流程完全用不上R2和L2。更离谱的是如果你想把这两个特殊攻击手动绑定到R2和L2，你会发现设定里根本没有针对这两种攻击方式的按键绑定设置方式。很多关卡是需要跳跃的同时做这两个动作，不能绑定单独按键只能说非常的不舒服。

然后说一下游戏的物理碰撞系统。如果说操作的不人性化我看在美术风格逆天的情面上还是会给好评，那么本游戏的物理碰撞系统完完全全的把我给好评的想法打消。分几个方面说。
1敌人的尸体。游戏的设定敌人被打败后尸体会有一部分视觉上涂了黄色涂料的部分可以吸引起来做武器或者结块，这也是游戏的核心玩法。然而每个敌人被打败后不止有涂了涂料的尸体还有和它本身颜色一样的一部分会残留在场景中，这一部分尸体有物理碰撞体积，但是玩家的各种攻击方式又不能触发碰撞。这导致什么呢？玩家如果踩上去，因为它的形状是不规则的，如果系统判定它因为受到玩家重力在滚动，那么玩家就被判定为浮空，这会导致你按跳跃键没有反馈。。天知道我被这种情况坑死多少次。再就是很多时候敌人死亡位置刚好是你需要放结块来垫脚的位置，因为玩家的攻击没法触发尸体的碰撞，但是结块又可以。。就导致了你的结块总也放不到想要的位置。。
2各种可破坏的平台。这种平台离谱的只有一点，就是很多时候解密途中做出一个很平的平台，但是你信心满满的跳上去就是踩不到，直接穿过去坠亡。。

最后说说剧情（可能涉及剧透慎读）。

剧情只能说中等偏下，各种时髦的设定最后讲了个莫名其妙的故事。不过由于游戏体验太差，剧情甚至可以说是本游戏的闪亮点？

剧情前期没什么大问题，抛出各种悬念，引入各种设定可以说吊足胃口。但是后期急转直下。首先是三个boss的结局没有说明，中期开始剧情表现一直引导玩家考虑的是人类和机器人（也就是敌人忘记游戏里叫什么名字了）互相理解。但是最后三个boss并没有被女主消灭，甚至帮了女主一把，可结局中并不能看到三个boss在最终boss被消灭后怎么样了，反而博士说了一句剩下的小股敌人不是人类的对手早晚会被消灭。中间铺垫了那么久的互相理解结果全部喂狗？？
然后就是后期加的设定，未来人类会得一种绝症，也没有给出解决方式。不过也许是为了第二部留悬念吧，就当是这样吧。

总结的总结：游戏体验极差，手柄差点给摔了。剧情没什么亮点。美术虽然给力但是瑜不掩瑕。

review:
ゲームフリークといえばポケモンばかり有名だが、それ以外でもスパイスのきいたゲームを出している。このゲームもその中の一つかと期待して購入。

ジャンルとしては2Dパズルアクション。道中は道を壊したり瓦礫をまとめて足場にしたりで目的地を目指すことになる。瓦礫は概ね物理演算に従うのだが、これが曲者で、なかなか思ったとおりに崩れてくれず何度もやり直す羽目になる。反面、ボス戦はゴリゴリのアクションでそれまでとのギャップがかなりでかいが楽しい。

プレイ前はもっとアクションよりだと思っていただけに、内容は完全に期待はずれ。アクションとしてはもの足りず、パズルとしても大して面白くない。アクションならアクション、パズルならパズルできちんとまとめて欲しかったが、こういういい意味でも悪い意味でも若々しいところがゲームフリークの魅力ではあるとは思う。

review:
"I am the trash maam! I come out, I throw trash all over the level! And then I pick up the trash cube, and I bash the guy on the head"
-Reika Rekkeiji

It has waifus and phisics based puzzles, if you weren't deterred by this you can keep reading.
Even tho it's a game made by a VERY famous company it feels unpolished, from how character and backgrouds lack depth, to how it meshes together in an ungodly blur of overdetailed trash. 
But that's where my complaints end, levels may look uninspired but each has its own solution, character design is good on their own, a story is there, and while generic it has really heartwarming undertones about family and companionship. 
The puzzle themselves are set up in a way where you have to think with your toolbox of powers and how gravity and weight affects the contraption that you either found or set up in the level. 

It's really hard to reccomand but I still enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055006994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1610320918}
review:
[b]>Recommended at full price [/b]

[h1]Cut the rope in a robot apocalypse[/h1]
Beautiful 2D physics puzzle platformer with an interesting story and really cool ideas. It does have some infuriating moments but I greatly enjoyed it nonetheless. here are the things you need to know before purchasing:

-[u]It´s surprisingly linear [/u] : This is, surprisingly, a story-focused game, even if it has some metroidvania elements in it, the exploration is greatly tied to the story progression, most maps are blocked by barriers that only go away after a certain plot point has been reached, you always have a marker telling you where you should head to and you cannot ever find upgrades outside of those markers, so all exploration rewards are relegated to cosmetic items only. On the flipside, the story is very interesting, involving some fun [spoiler]time travelling shenanigans[/spoiler] and likeable anime characters.

-[u]It´s quite beautiful[/u]: I love the aesthetics the game went for, looking at screenshots you can see that the visual look is quite striking and memorable. But as far as the cutscenes go they are quite simplistic, most of them presented in a simplistic visual novel style, and the more important of them having an unique drawing to go along the dialogue depicting the events. Whether you like it or not will depend greatly on your tastes but I found it more than serviceable. Also the sountrack is cool.

-[u]It´s, at it´s hearth, a physics based puzzler platformer[/u]: There are boss fights, an upgrade system, different "weapons" like swords and javellins... but at the end of the day it´s a puzzle game, those "weapons" will most of the time be used to solve puzzlers and destroy terrain rather than to fight, boss fights are also puzzle-based, and the entire game can be completed without getting even a single upgrade (also there are a LOT of "blank" and "filler" nodes on that skill tree), not to mention there is no combo system and most of the "fights" also have an intended solution based on the wrecking mechanics (like enemies that can only be damaged if you already gathered enough rubble to have a bigger ball to attack with). This s not a bad thing at all in my book, every new door lead to a new and exciting physics based puzzle to enjoy... or hate, the puzzles are all physics based so there is a lot of trial & error, and even if you figured out a correct solution (or found an... alternative one) executing it sometimes depends more on luck.

-[u]It has a lovely level editor[/u]: The game as a whole packs more than enough content for it´s asking price imo (8hs-12hs depending on achievement completion rate, difficulty and physics shenanigans) but severely lacks replayability die to it´s linearity. however it also packs a very functional level editor with steam workshop integration. This is a lovely feature that allows you to try some amazing levels made by other players while also letting you flex your creative muscles. It is also worth mentioning that an "updated" version of the game (GIGA WRECKER Alt) is soon coming to consoles, with an extra harder difficulty, 20 more puzzle levels and a "hint" system integrated into the story (in the form of a new companion), but without the level editor, these new features don´t seem to be coming to PC in any foreseeable future but I believe the level editor alone is worth the tradeoff, but you might disagree in which case I´d recommend the Alt version instead.

[b]TL;DR:[/b] Overall, I greatly enjoyed my time with this game, some puzzle and/or physics mechanic really infuriated me for a while but I always enjoyed solving them (even if, sometimes, it was in a purely accidental "I can´t believe I made that thing fly and land on that exact spot instead of solving the puzzle" kind of solution). I also enjoyed the limited exploration, as it meant more puzzles to solve, and the story (while not amazing) was quite a nice surprise and left me quite satisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112191533', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1609483003}
review:
It's a fun game, it has a nice story, and it is well made, but the fact that spikes kill you instantly for no reason completely ruins the experience. Feels like they should have had two versions of spike because instant death is really out of place in some puzzles.

The real reason for the fact I don't recommend the game however is the price to playtime ratio. It's about twelve hours if you do all the content. You could double that if you aim for perfection with the Boss Rush mode or try your hand at community content, but even then, that just puts you slightly above a one to one ration with the $20 price tag. I got the game on a 50% discount, so if you are interested, get it during a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561199096708853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1608304484}
review:
キャラデザとゲーフリ開発に惹かれて購入しました。

[h1]よかったところ[/h1]
[list]
    [*]主人公も仲間も、敵のロボ美少女も、みんなかわいい。

    [*]物理パズルを解きながら、マップ探索
　集めたガレキを足場や武器に変換して、パズルを解いていきます。
ガレキは細かい破片まで物理演算されているので、正攻法じゃなくても突破できることも。
この仕様は賛否あると思いますが、たまにゴリ押しできる感じが、私は好きです。

    [*]爽快感と緊張感のある、ボス戦
　回復アイテムが無いので、ダメージを受けない立ち回りが基本です。ボス戦は敵の攻撃パターンを見切って躱す、ガチガチのアクションゲームとなります。
[/list]
　　
[h1]残念なところ[/h1]
[list]
    [*]パズル部分ではカメラが遠ざかり、キャラがとても小さく映る。
    [*]武器のスキンを変更しても性能が変わらないため、集めるモチベーションが湧かない。
    [*]回収できないガレキが隙間に入って、ギミックが作動しないことがある。
[/list]

[h1]その他[/h1]
[list]
    [*]モニターの垂直同期をONにすると、主人公の移動速度が異常に上がってしまいました。
[/list]

review:
最初から最期まで理不尽と不条理との闘い。

アクションパズルって通常は
「１０×１０」の解を求めよ、的な考え方が一般なのだが、
このゲームは
「解が１００になる数式」を導き出せ的な考え方で、もちろんそれもアリなのだが。
困ったことにその「解」が「近似値」でも構わないってところがミソで、
それが上手くアクションとパズルとギミックにハマってればいいのだが、
ひたすらトライ＆エラー＆イライラを繰り返すばかりで、マジでハゲそうになる。

攻略サイト見てなるほどなぁ、こういう風に解けばいいのか、とか思うんだが、
間違いなく一発で上手くハマらず、攻略サイトの意義ってなんだろう？となる。
特に最終セクションである要塞の各区画は。

元々は細江愼二氏の音楽が聴きたくて買ったのだが、メインテーマのみということらしい。
が、そのメインテーマってどれよ？となった。
けど、全体的な音楽はどれも素敵だったから、これはまあこれで良いと思う。

散々イライラさせられてなんど放り出そうかと思ったけど、
クリアしてラストシーン迎えると、やはり名残惜しい。
それくらいの魅力は間違いなくあった。

色々と改善した続編を期待してのサムズアップ。
頼むよ、ジャパゲー。

author: {'steamid': '76561198034127729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1594604118}
review:
A pleasant puzzle platformer done by the POKEMON company on STEAM, with art style like HUKE of Black Rock Shooter fame. Its like a fevered dream of "i want this".

Story kinda abnormal. You get dark moods and wish "things should of gone better" vibes.
Sound track has kickers or up-tune vibes, some "ear worms" too.

Puzzles consider of how well you understand physics and centre-of-mass puzzles, use sliced moving objects to go forwards or kill hard mobs. Bosses need you to understand attacks and timing with skill.

Down side is re-solving puzzles is kinda inconsistent, your own momentum and position at weird timing will toss objects randomly or you randomly, just remember your character's motion is part of the puzzle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155000976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1598838259}
review:
This is a fun physics-based puzzle platformer with an amazing art style and a great soundtrack.
The combat itself isn't really the focus of the gameplay, rather you'll be defeating enemies as part of the puzzles. Boss battles are about learning to dodge and counter their attacks.
One issue I had with the gameplay was random debris sometimes messing up my platforming or getting in the way of weight switches. Though just as often I was able to exploit it to help clear puzzles.
The story is decent but I wish characters were developed more, especially with this small cast.
The translation is subpar; you can understand what's going on, but a lot seems to be directly translated rather than reworded in ways that read more naturally to a native English speaker.
