author: {'steamid': '76561197980848609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1595106719}
review:
I must make this clear now as it needs stating directly; if you want the game in it's MOST COMPLETE form, DO NOT BUY ON STEAM. The developer has made clear statements that it WILL NOT ADD CONSOLE CONTENT to this version of the game. Hopefully in the future they will change this decision, but as of this writing, it remains true. I might recommend this as a later purchase as it has a different ending and some changed plot, but not at full price.

That said, this is a really good game, with some caveats, from a developer you might not necessarily know, but are very possibly a large fan of. They made this little game series called POKEMON. Now, on to the merits of the game itself, which for everything it does well, there is a bit of a downside to it.

The art style of the game is gorgeous and unique. The painted backgrounds really pop and set the mood, if only that really, as the terrain you actually interact with is more or less the same throughout. The character designs fit the world, being both oddly angular and rounded at the same time.

The story is a bit of a mixed bag. It starts out simple enough, invading aliens take over the planet and humanity on it's last legs, you get randomly shot by a stranger and become a cyborg, but are still terribly confused as to why someone wanted to shoot you. It becomes an intriguing mix of several famous sci-fi movie plots, but its ending is unmistakably anime in follow-through. I'd give specifics, but it would spoil the unfolding of the story's high points.

This metroidvania focuses less on combat and more on physics-heavy puzzles. All the abilities you gain enable you to change how you interact with the destructible and non-destructible environments, absorbing some to enhance your options, and learning what you need to do requires some trial and error, which you get the ability to reset. Sometimes though you might find what the game asks you to do to solve the puzzle dodgy as it does rely on all the physics of your actions proceeding as it hopes, or that all the debris made does not interfere with the solution, as you might slip on some loose rocks and miss a jump, or get stuck in the environs at an inopportune moment. All this can become very frustrating and I would understand that it can turn you off the game.

Boss fights are different enough that I believe i need to list how they function separately. The proceed in the fashion of Mega Man games, with a set of repeating patterns that you figure out how to take advantage of, with the slight change of having to figure out how to get enough usable material from the boss to attack them successfully. The problem comes initially in figuring out how to do that as the game doesn't clue you in to this or what is breakable. You eventually understand the logic, but you will probably die a few times before you understand this. And another issue that comes up with the boss battles when you realize that the controls are fine for the puzzles and the simplistic enemies, but in these battles you realize the controls are less suitable for quick reactions. 

At the end of the day, I enjoyed the game, but it is very unpolished and can be a bit janky. Just keep in mind that this version is probably not the version you should purchase for anywhere near full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314622476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1594745039}
review:
[h1] 総評　物理パズルと探索が楽しめる人にオススメ [/h1]
概要　物理系アクションパズルにおまけでボス戦が付いてるゲーム
終了時点　エンディング到達（収集要素コンプ未達成）

[b]気に入った点[/b]
物理パズル故に正規回答以外でも突破出来たりして楽しい
強過ぎないボス戦と自機パワーアップのオンオフ切り替えが容易で難易度調整しやすい点
パズル、ボス戦のリトライが容易
絵柄やストーリーの雰囲気が良い
X軸移動が結構速い
他プレイヤーの作ったステージを遊べる（らしい）
収集要素が完全に趣味の範疇である点

[b]気になった点[/b]
あくまでパズルをメインに据えているせいか道中での戦闘が面白くない
自機が初速からトップスピードかつ結構速いせいか若干癖があった
[spoiler] アクションは増えていくし、強化されていくのにボス戦で使う必要ないデザインにした理由は謎[/spoiler]
というか強化要素はHP関係以外腐ってる印象

review:
I really, REALLY wanted to like this game, but I just couldn't get into it. I love the art style, and graphics of the game, and I like the soundtrack quite a bit. But the core gameplay just doesn't vibe with me. The trailer makes the game look like an action platformer with some puzzle elements, but it's more of a physics puzzle game with platforming elements. Which isn't necessarily bad, but I just thought the physics were too inconsistent to complete the puzzles. You could attempt the same solution multiple times, and get different results, and it just made the puzzle solving frustrating and unintuitive.

review:
I really wanted to like this game, but I couldn't. It felt so lacking and quite boring.

I love the idea of the game! The aesthetic and creativity with the skills they have, its great! I just wish the plot and characters were more lovable from the start.

Something about the walk animation kind of bothers me. Its a little bland and needs a little something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401475636', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1586275875}
review:
20小时通关，全地图探索+全boss
总分7/10
优点：
-核心玩法独特，赛博改造少女打怪捡机械碎片制作武器
-不吃操作，相比于其他硬核横版rpg，更考验解谜策略（玩这个游戏的同时在玩celeste，被虐得死去活来）
-技能丰富，关卡设计巧妙，含有重力、磁力、光学等，人物有平a和4个技能（[strike] 有trine系列内味了 [/strike]），前期有充分的引导关卡，后期的复杂关卡考验策略，但又不会难得过分
-剧情不是很复杂，但是整体还是挺暖心的，包括结尾credit的彩蛋
-画风和音乐不错，和末日废土百合的剧情很契合
缺点：
-跳跃判定和物块判定非常坑爹，物块倾斜一定角度就踩不上去，还有齿轮之类的更讨厌，因为这一点我不知道死了多少次了
-操作起来不流畅，不仅是人物不能边走边跳而且走得慢，而且很多连续操作无法丝滑进行，很影响体验
-boss战太枯燥，第一次打可能很懵逼，但很快就会发现boss攻击方式太少，还要打三遍（剧透警告[spoiler] 回溯时间之前打一遍，回溯时间之后打一遍进阶版，但是进阶版的也没增加boss攻击方式，只是强化了boss血量和攻击范围，通关之后要想获得最后一个隐藏成就还要完成boss rush再打一遍 [/spoiler]

最后强烈建议使用手柄进行游戏！！！和用键盘操作的手感比简直是两个游戏
并且强烈建议把开门/触发机关解绑方向↑键，不然特别容易到别的场景/触发时间回溯，浪费时间

author: {'steamid': '76561198382508417', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1572964889}
review:
Игра ОК. Но из неоспоримых плюсов только внешний вид и любопытная геймплейная задумка. Всё остальное в лучшем случае посредственное.
Во-первых, головоломки хоть и непростые, но довольно однообразные. В большинстве случаев вся загадка сводится к выбору того, что и в каком порядке сломать. У большинства инструментов очень ограниченное использование: используй куб как платформу или груз, мечом отрубай весящие конструкции, буром то же самое, но крепление широкое и возможно на большом расстоянии, копьё используй как платформу (с парой исключений).  
Враги, хоть и беспомощные, но некоторые невыносимо раздражают спамом снарядов. Снова и снова повторяешь схему "Убей врагов поменьше, затем побольше. Если не хватает размера шара из обломков, скинь что-нибудь сверху". Из раза в раз. И ведь-то они угрозы не представляют, здоровья столько, что можно станковать почти любой урон, если не упадёшь на мгновенно убивающие шипы. Но и по ним можно немного ходить, воспользовавшись периодом неуязвимости (нет, уважаемые переводчики, не невидимости).
Боссы вполне ничего и даже могут вас убить. Правда, ближе к концу игры можно будет присесть и отхилиться почти от любого урона.
Управление кривое. Постоянно слетаешь с платформы, пытаясь сделать шаг, камера отдаляется настолько, что персонаж становится милипиздрическим, обломки ограничивают передвижение дурацким образом: если поверхность вертикальная, то это стена, если горизонтальная, то платформа, а если под достаточно большим углом, то ты проваливаешься насквозь. И вот так получается, что пошатавшись, платформа заставит тебя провалится, а через объекты иногда можно пройти, зайдя в них из немного другого места. А если много кусков платформ навалены в кучу, готовьтесь к совершенно непредсказуемому результату.
Физика ведёт себя зачастую совершенно не предсказуемым образом. Ударив по предмету, готовьтесь, что он улетит в неизвестном направлении, бросок куба происходит по трудно предсказуемой траектории, из-за чего нужно по десятку раз его перекидывать. В итоге иногда нужно по пятнадцать минут пытаться добиться результата, а иногда головоломка решается сама совершенно случайно, потому что обломок прилетел куда нужно. Я как-то даже шестерёнку кубом раскрутил. И нет, этого нельзя было сделать намеренно, он для этого чётко определённым образом должен крутиться.
Сюжет вроде и пытается быть удивительным, но я в него просто не верю. Неубедительные мотивации персонажей, немотивированные изменения ("Я хотела убить всех аджитов, но теперь я им симпатизирую" и "Мы затирали про высшую расу (серьёзно), но теперь мы хорошие") и тускло написанные диалоги не позволяют им проникнуться. Я прямо вижу сценариста, сидящего над списком с чекбоксами. А концовка, что называется, anticlimatic: "Мы победили главного босса, теперь всё наверное будет хорошо. Во-о-о-от..."
И пожалуйста, прекратите лепить лейбл "метроидвания" на всё подряд. Относительно открытые локации и получение новых способностей ещё не делают игру метроидванией. Да, грёбаный Дарк Соулс — это метроидвания, естественно.
Повторюсь, игра терпимая. Некоторые вон в восторге от неё, но, по-моему, она слишком неотполированная и во многом однообразная, чтобы заслуживать славы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198421035761', 'num_games_owned': 1807, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1570810350}
review:
[quote]
[h1][spoiler]麒麟臂💪+超能力💆‍♀️，果然还是工具人最好用啊~~[/spoiler][/h1]

[h1] GIGA WRECKER [/h1]
本作是由GAME FREAK制作Rising Star Games发行的一款平台冒险游戏，玩家将扮演经过机械改装的超人少女，凭借麒麟臂在机械人横行的世界与侵略者奋力一战，开启拯救人类的冒险之旅。新奇的题材以及新颖的操作可谓是本作的亮点，优秀的画面表现以及流畅的操作让游戏锦上添花。游戏包含解谜、动作、探索收集等多种元素，内容十分丰富，喜欢平台冒险类游戏的玩家不妨一试。

[h1]👉前言👈[/h1]
支离破碎的世界与失去记忆的神秘少女；
未来世界，机械技术的研究进展迅速，但机器人的入侵让地球陷入危机。强大的机器人在未来世界大肆破坏，地球陷入了前所未有的危机。但更巧的是，逃过一难的神秘女主烈景寺丽华在博士的改造下变成了强大的超人少女。苏醒的少女在了解如今的世界之后，下定决心要凭借着自己的能力改变世界的现状。
面对的是未知的世界与敌人，拥有自己从未拥有的强大力量，这位肩负着寻找自己记忆与拯救人类使命的少女，在险象环生的冒险途中又会发现什么秘密呢… 

[h1]👉游戏体验👈[/h1]

[b]1️⃣探索&解谜[/b]
拥有神力的少女可以在探险途中通过收集蓝图来逐渐解锁各种新奇的能力，广袤的地图满足了玩家心中的探索欲。
除了最开始的攻击外，主角可以使用能力控制聚集量子碎片，手持聚集成巨大球体的碎片，主角的攻击可以更远也更加强力。除了控制量子碎片之外，主角还可以将手中的凝聚体转换成实体方块，通过将其放置在适当的位置通过难以跳跃的障碍；此外，凝聚后的量子聚集体还可以转换为手刀或是变成具有弹性的球体。逐渐增加的游戏内容让玩家的探索过程变得更为有趣。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1886452474
游戏谜题以物理为基础，需要配合玩家目前所拥有的能力。此外，游戏在解谜关卡还设置了一个时光回溯的机关，当玩家过度破坏了游戏的场景后，玩家可以启动时间回溯，回到场景初始的时候，这样一来就减少了从存档点重新打的重复流程。主角在冒险途中可以收集到类似经验值的能量流，通过收集来升级获得技能点，开启角色专属的技能树。
游戏场景中有许多形态各异的机械怪物，强力的技能也对应其致命的破绽，玩家需要打出时间差或是保持一定距离来解决面前的怪物。有些怪物甚至在身体破坏之后还能存活，因此需要注意，只有将怪物打出经验值之后才意味着完全死亡。游戏的boss战难度不高，攻击模式较为单一，但这也不意味这本作对手残党有多么友好，硬核又坑爹的物理解谜分分钟能玩崩你。
[b]宁觉得宁物理学的挺好？也不看看这个游戏是谁说了算。[/b]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1886452519
[b]2️⃣音画表现[/b]
游戏采用经典的2D平面，游戏人物以及场景十分明显的描边看起来十分舒适，炫酷的机器人与战斗特效也让游戏的战斗过程畅快淋漓。除了探索画面之外，伴随游戏剧情还有许多精致的CG不时的出现，截个屏都能当来壁纸用（百合大法好）
游戏没有配音，但bgm选取十分恰当，在玩家的探索过程中可以带来沉浸感较强的游戏体验，配合手残的操作使用更佳哦~
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1886452434
[b]Ps：主要内容以外，游戏还可以自定义战役，挑战各路大佬制作的高难度关卡！[/b]

[h1] ❤️优点❤️[/h1]

👍 新颖的游戏内容

👍 优秀的美术风格

👍 丰富的可探索内容

[h1]💔缺点💔[/h1]

👎 敌人ai较为简单，模式单一

author: {'steamid': '76561198070945092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 357, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1567075877}
review:
플랫포머를 좋아하기도 하고 게임 프리크에서 만들었다길래 기대하고 구매를 했습니다.
해보니 기대에 비해선... 적당한 플랫포머 게임에 가깝습니다. 
난이도도 적당하게 깰수 있게 만들어져 있으며, 적당한 볼륨에 적당한 스토리, 적당한 캐릭터.
생각나는 건 퍼즐입니다. 차라리 보스는 해딩을 하면 깰수 있는 타이밍이 나오지만
퍼즐들은 물리엔진이 어떻게 적용되어 있는지 조작이 미끄럽고 각 오브젝트들이 중력 및 기믹에
의해 왔다갔다 하는데 거기다 피지컬까지 요구하는 경우가 있어서 클리어 할수 있는 방법이 보이는데도
쉽게 클리어하질 못합니다. 그리고 번역이 못알아먹을 정도는 아닌데 좀 안좋습니다.
적당적당한 난이도의 플렛포머를 원하는 분들이라면 만족하리라 생각합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1564241388}
review:
A pretty good Metroidvania with a heavier focus on platforming and physics-based puzzle solving than on combat. There's a lot of rough edges, but they got the important parts right.

The combat's not bad, but it is a bit limited--there's only a dozen or so regular enemies, they all die in one hit if you fulfill the conditions to kill them, and ultimately most of them were designed more to facilitate puzzles than combat. The boss battles are proper fights though, not puzzle bosses (in fact none of them require a specific ability). The bosses are pretty good overall, though it's often difficult to tell if you have enough debris to hurt them and not knowing leads to taking extra damage.

The puzzles are quiet good. Your abilities are all put to thorough and creative use, as are each level's environmental gimmicks. This is the first game I've played where the ability to "create a block" feels fun and versatile rather than just an extra step the puzzles require. Tricky platforming is baked right into many puzzles. There's often room for multiple solutions. Unfortunately, the puzzles aren't perfect. Some require finnicky/luck based manipulation of physics objects. It's sometimes hard to tell what objects are rooted in place or what'll happen if you destroy certain blocks except by trial and error. And the collision detection doesn't always handle the moving/rotating platforms in a way that feels natural. Fortunately resetting puzzles is always quick and easy.

As for the metroidvania part, you advance between areas based more on plot progression than item progression. Each level has one new ability and a few stage gimmicks, and they feel different enough. Warp points are frequent and helpful. Solving most puzzles in an area lets you progress, solving all just unlocks a reskin of your abilities. Unfortunately, it doesn't add important things to the map until you interact with them, which partly defeats the purpose.

Story is nothing special. The translation job is just awkward enough that you won't forget it's a translation (but you can always tell what they mean). Certain parts of the UI lack polish, especially the confusing yes/no prompts. Visuals are pretty good, music is bland.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261957551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1559694817}
review:
It took only 7 minutes for me to realize just how broken this game is.

Maybe polish your game before selling it for $20.

* extremely clunky movement, gets caught on the ceiling, input lag, etc.
* physics puzzles
* stops you every 5 seconds to spam dialogue
* doesn't give you the option to skip the tutorial
* makes you select a language on startup despite the fact that this could be figured out via the user's public steam account
* the physics puzzle in the tutorial where you're supposed to walk up an improvised platform is broken because you fall through the platform instead of standing on it.

Is this seriously made by the same triple-A devs that made Pokemon? Because this is embarrassing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349405480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1559650189}
review:
Всем хай! Что скажу про игру? Игра - так себе. Да есть сюжет. Но, его мало. Очень мало. Если честно, цену надо было сбить раза так в 3-4. Но сначала всё по-порядку!
Сюжет
Удивили! Он прикольный, необычный, захватывающий. Но, его очень мало.
Сама идея сюжета, прям для многосерийного сериала или нескольких фильмов для Голивуда. Но, его вроде не полностью показали.
Да и играть по 1-2 часа что бы увидеть 20 слов сюжета тоже не очень!
Gameplay
Игра часов на 9-11 (у меня 12 из-за того что сворачивал игру на долго)
Игра была сделана на Wwise (сам не знаю что это за движок, потом гляну). Как в первый раз играл (часов так 6 подряд) всё было более-менее. Под конец лаги через 5-7 минут игры. Но там надо было игру свернуть и развернуть что бы прошло.
Играл на геймпаде XBox 360 (вроде). На клаву даже не переходил. Играть на геймпаде это... просто надо было привыкнуть. Да и вверх бить, не всегда получалось. А так нормальненько.
По началу всё было просто. Уровни были простые и загадки тоже. Но мля! Под конец вроде автора подменили. И ты вроде проходил уровень по сложности 10 , а стало вроде 50. [spoiler] Нихера не понятно. [/spoiler] Пришлось YouTube насиловать.
Выводы
Я бы не советовал покупать игру, если только вам некуда их девать. Хотя... там есть редактор для уровней. Короче! Просто подумайте хорошенько!
На этом всё
7.5 из 10 потеющих подмышек!

Сейвы занимают 120 Мб , что??

author: {'steamid': '76561197999190570', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1550328284}
review:
I wish I had read the reviews...The 'action' tag is heavily misleading, this is a physics-based puzzle platformer through and through and very little else.
When your gameplay is based on physics they are the one thing you need to nail and nail them they did not.
The so-so localisation and story does not help either.
No support for 16:10 screens or borderless windowed mode. If the black bars weren't bugged it wouldn't have been an issue but they are. Had to use the "borderless gaming" app to fix it.
Main character is overly detailed leading to heavy aliasing.
Animations are choppy.

With better expectations in advance this should be a okay game but it just bugs the heck outta me on so many levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044924051', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1645661864}
review:
He comprado el juego hace mucho tiempo, a pesar de er algo viejo, el juego es INCREÍBLE, jamas había escuchado tan buena musica en un juego de plataformas/puzzles, es relajante, o en jefes la musica puede ser incluso epica.
La plataforma en como es que te mueves es increíble igual, siempre me interesa hacer nuevas cosas en los niveles como la fabrica. Lo único malo es que es algo aburrido buscar cada habitación con tal de tener una recompenza cuando en realidad están la mayoria. El arbol de habilidades necesita una mejora también, a veces cuando intentas aumentar tu vida, no hace mas que aumentar de una cantidad exageradamente pequeña, casi no es agradable...
Los puzzles me facinan y me mantienen atento a lo que debo hacer. 
El arte visual es impresionante, me cuesta creer que la mayoria de los personajes son dibujados a mano, incluso viniendo de game freak que es famoso por juegos de pokémon, muy buen trabajo!
Es un buen juego, lo recomiendo para aquellos que buscan algo diferente, no se decepciona!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030550391', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1546282768}
review:
Прекрасная игра с головоломками, основанными на физике. Здесь можно создавать блоки из кусков поверженных врагов, ломать детали окружения и использовать их для продвижения по уровню. Большинство головоломок имеет одно или два очевидных решения, но при должном воображении и желании поэкспериментировать можно устроить хаос и пройти комнату совершенно абсурдным методом ( ‾́ ◡ ‾́ )
Обожаю подобную вариативность в играх.

Также меня очень порадовало, что здесь нет моментов, когда видишь ключ или апгрейд, но не можешь добраться до него, потому что героиня ещё не получила нужную способность. Открывая доступ к новой локации, у вас будет всё необходимое, чтобы найти в ней все секреты и больше не возвращаться.

Сюжет поначалу не особо интересен, но лишь до тех пор, пока не появляются путешествия во времени. Постепенно нам дают возможность взглянуть на этот мир с разных сторон и пересмотреть своё отношение враждующим сторонам. Враги уже не кажутся такими плохими, в каком-то смысле они лишь жертвы несчастного случая. А первоначальные намерения главной героини делают её не лучше тех, с кем она сражается. В истории имеется небольшая недосказанность, что позволяет додумать пробелы и представить себе полную картину происходящего.

Отдельное внимание заслуживают боссы, геймплейно они интересны и не особо сложны, с ними приятно сражаться даже после прохождения основного сюжета. На мой взгляд, их личности и взаимоотношения друг с другом показаны гораздо лучше, чем у главных героев. Поэтому боссы запомнились мне больше всего.

Очень надеюсь, что у игры будет продолжение.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074041475', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1520249352}
review:
Giga Wrecker is a rather interesting game developed by Game Freak, who seem to make new standalone games when they presumably get bored of creating new Pokemon titles. Despite the fact that Giga Wrecker is obviously not the main focus of the developer, the game is of high quality, and blends together action and puzzle platforming elements quite well.

(+) The debris system is simple to understand yet fun to use. Defeat enemies to get debris, and use that to defeat bigger enemies/ access new areas. It reminds me a little bit of the multiple Kirby system from Kirby Mass Attack, which was another game I quite enjoyed.
(+) The action elements are basic and the puzzle elements aren't the most challenging, but both complement each other very well to make a great experience.
(+) I didn't encounter any major bugs
(+) Physics, especially for the flying debris, are pretty realistic for a cartoony platformer
(+) Large non-linear upgrade tree, which is great for completionists like me, but isn't necessary for beating the game
(+) Many optional puzzle rooms which reward the player for completing them with extra XP, or new skins for weapons (instead of just being paid DLC, thank goodness)
(+) I absolutely LOVED this game's artstyle (I actually use the screenshots I took of this game as my laptop screensaver), but of course  whether you like it or not depends on your personal preference.
(+) Background music was nothing spectacular, but good enough that I didn't feel the need to mute it and play other songs over it

(-) Story is so-so, it didn't really make me care about any of the characters except for the protagonist
(-) Boss battles were pretty easy once you figure out the attack pattern. Only the final boss was somewhat challenging. However, this problem is partially resolved with the post-game Boss Rush mode
(-) Not a very long game. I completed the story and got all the achievements in under 17 hours.
(-) Using a controller to play is almost a necessity in my opinion. 

Overall, I really enjoyed playing this game. Definitely worth picking up if you are a fan of platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058511775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1517174876}
review: Giga Wrecker is a kinda adventure game with jump'n'run and platform elements where you also use some physical aspects to go through the game. In the game you can somehow destroy the environment and you got the ability to gather debris which you can use it to your advantage for example like forming a lock / square / dice where you can jump on it, so you can reach places that are normally too high for you. Or using the debris to form a blade to cut something or attacking enemies with increased range. These are some possiblities you can do and there are more of them. Also there is some kind of a skill-tree so you can upgrade abilities by passing some time in game when you got enough exp / materials. The riddles are pretty fun to solve some of them are easier and some of them are more difficult. But one of the most important thing is the timing because I mentioned before that you use physical elements / aspects in this game and at many points of this game you need to hit the right moment to surpass lots of the riddles. If you failed to hit the perfect timing don't worry because in every area with a riddle there is a sphere / orb which you can trigger to reset the area. And there are also some bossfights. I have to say the bossfights are in the beginning pretty challenging and rough but also pretty fun. Also the story is well made and kinda profound. All in all I think Giga Wrecker is a pretty fun game and it's worth to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049172616', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1540909493}
review:
大体１画面に収まるパズルを、そんなに楽しさを感じない多彩なアクションでクリアしていくゲーム。

パズルをクリアする過程は、一般的なゲームなら試行錯誤の繰り返しなんですけど、このゲームの場合はそれに疑心暗鬼が加わって、この解法でいいはずなんだけど、微妙に届かないのは何故？（本当は何故かわかっている）という気持ちでいっぱいになります。
できるアクションは割と多いのに、使えるところがそれぞれ限られてて結局、開発者の思惑通りなんでしょ？ハイハイ、ってやってたらなんかゴリ押しできたりする雑さも兼ね備えてはいるものの、いまひとつ面白さに貢献してない印象。

これでキャラクタと世界観がダメなら諦めも付くのに、惜しいゲームだなぁと思いながらちまちま遊んでいます。

review:
A fantastic game and overall great experience.

You may have to do trial and error with the physics engine but the physics in this game is really what sets it apart from others. The characters are nice, good soundtrack and while short the sci-fi futuristic orientanted story was good.

The downside? I wish the game was longer! Hopefully Game Freak can find the time to produce more, I'm still waiting for the new playable character update to put even more hours into GIGA WRECKER.

TL;DR: Great, solid game that proves yet again that GAME FREAK aren't just about Pokémon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027161655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1531552546}
review:
値段に対して、全体的にクオリティの高い作品です。
だた、個人的に気になる所が多々あったので…
まずアクションゲーム、というよりパズルゲームの要素が強い。
物理演算的な挙動も相まって、思い通りに行かず難易度も高い様な気がします。
いわゆるメトロイドヴァニアのイメージを持っている方は、購入されない方が良いかもしれません。
パズルでの死亡時に結構戻される所があるので、またあそこをやるのか…とゲンナリする事があります。
また、セリフの文字が小さい＆ウィンドウ背景が透過されていて、非常に読みにくいです。
ゲームとして面白い面白くないとは別の所でストレスが多く、あまり楽しめませんでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198128683415', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1487352413}
review:
第一眼看宣传视频还以为是洛克人那种类型，实际玩下来会发现这是个妥妥的物理解密游戏，非BOSS战斗大部分时间都是在解密闯关，然后boss战斗相当硬核，可以说是即时制的解谜，击破BOSS的方式藏得比较深，往往需要死好几次才能知道，即便知道后依旧保留着一定的操作难度，总体说来还是非常带感的。

而且破坏的物理机制比较宽松，好多地方都能用相当邪道的方式过去，有奇怪的爽感~总体还是很推荐入手来玩的

author: {'steamid': '76561198066202455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1528010327}
review:
[h1]도르마무! 거래를 하러왔다.[/h1]

...사실 전 게임을 살때 그 게임에 대한 정보는 최소한으로 보고 사는 타입이라 초반에 이 게임을 봤을때 들었던 느낌은 렉 안걸리는 2D에 오랜만에 잡아보는 플랫폼, 거기에 퍼즐 액션까지? 주인공이 귀여워 보이네 정도였습니다.

허나 막상 플레이를 해보니 단순 퍼즐 게임이 아닌 스토리가 점점 흥미진진해지면서 이야 이거 시간여행물이었네요.
나름 짠다고 잘짠 하지만 미묘하게 아쉬운(시간여행물이 원래 다 그런것 처럼)스토리가 저의 플레이 욕구를 돋구었습니다.

게다가 일본작품스럽게 캐릭터 개성도 잘 살려있고 나름 대화도 볼만 했습니다만 번역이 조금 구글 번역인 부분이 있습니다.

전체적으로 머리를 써야 지나갈 수 있는 퍼즐 게임이지만 우리 사회가 인성과 실력중 하나만 빼어나길 바라질 않듯이 이 곳 역시 머리와 피지컬 둘 다 뛰어나길을 바랍니다.
"아니 뭐 어떻게 하라고..."
"아니 어떻게 해야할진 알겠는데!!아씨 쫌!!!"

이런분들을 위해 준비했습니다. 바로 보스입니다!!

퍼즐의 스트레스를 풀어주기 위해 그들이 왔습니다. 아니, 우리가 갔습니다.

단순한 패턴, 정해져있는 패턴. 아 파훼법을 모르시겠다고요? [spoiler]모르면 맞으셔야죠.[/spoiler]
정말 첫번째 보스에서부터 이걸 어떻게 깨야 하나..무한한 시간의 굴레에 갇혀 해메다보니 박사님께서 정말 안쓰러워 보이셨는지 힌트를 던져 주셨고 그제서야 어렵게 깼습니다. 

그 이후 보스에서도 무한한 시간의 굴레에 갇혀있다가 다른 플레이어의 영상을 보고나서 깨달았습니다.
뭐든 패턴에는 그에 맞는 파훼법이 존재합니다. [u]즉, 한대도 안 맞고 모든 보스를 깰 수 있다는 뜻이며 이건 분명 도전과제에도 존재하겠다는 의미이며 전 진작에 포기했습니다.[/u]
음..뭐, 보스 러쉬 화이팅입니다..

저는 이제 다 좋은데 한가지 아쉬운 것이 있다면 나중에 등장하는 시간역행기술을 어떻게 사용하는지를 너무 대충이었다. 아니 설명이 없었다. 내가 못 본건가? [i]"아니! 무너진 돌무더기옆에서 기술을 쓰면 길이 뚫린다는 걸 왜 아무도 안알려줘서! 내가 유투브 영상을 몇번을 돌려 보게 만드는거지!"[/i] 그 외에도 활용도가 너무 낮았습니다. 물론 사용해야하는 부분이 있지만(진짜로 안쓰면 못꺠는 부분 있으니 참고)  거진 퍼즐 꼬였을때 빠르게 도르마무를 소환하는 용도 정도?

흠..제점수는요...
[b]원가에 사기엔 애매한 게임.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198174363235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2021, 'last_played': 1528454980}
review:
○○艳丽的美术

○丰富利用物理引擎和逻辑的大量解谜
○妥当的BOSS战难度和微解谜
○内置玩家地图编辑器
○不唯一的解谜手段

△感人的地图重复利用
△有但是存在感很低的BGM
△只有少许辅助作用的粗略地图
△存在感和普通头目差不多的最终首领战

×别扭而又不直观的科技树

××极其多余的物理碎片碰撞，在重量机关谜题中高度影响解谜通过率和游戏体验
××恶劣的磁吸系统，在墙体复杂的谜题中影响解谜通过率和游戏体验
××几乎无法用官方玩法通过的上升烟幕谜题，高度影响解谜通过率和游戏体验

【结语】
本质上是偏向于《风之克罗诺亚》之流利用敌人进行过关和解谜的游戏，但提升了解谜的难度和采用了更复杂的物理引擎。
然而也因为这个物理引擎的缘故，绝大部分时候的解谜失败完全不取决于玩家的操作，而是完全指望这个游戏的物理系统爱不爱你，尤其是后期的高难度部分其随机性更是有故意恶心人之嫌。

比较推荐是体验本游戏的前半部分，直至讨伐完前4名头目的BAD END线尚且具有相对良好的游戏体验，而后半部分的TURE END线的反复流程和难度显著提升的解谜或许会导致体验的下降。

review: Fun metroidvania game, especially if you're a fan of the anime style graphics. review:
剧情很好，解谜很有意思，boss战很难，建议使用手柄。
随着进度的推进，解谜难度会有所提高，boss战难度因为技能的成长会显得越来越简单，关键技能下蹲回血。前期boss战我能re几十次，后期甚至一次过，各种技能硬吃。boss打不过可以利用紫色回溯点刷技能点。
有一个传送带的关卡似乎很难，需要在精准的timing完成一系列高难度操作。

非常值得入手的游戏！

author: {'steamid': '76561197975973970', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1520997500}
review:
The game is broken on a wide variety of systems (particularly if you have a monitor above 1080p).   Beyond that? The devs don't really care.   Look at this thread where I reported my issues ( http://steamcommunity.com/app/454410/discussions/0/1457328819912207243/ )  

You might think at first "Oh, looks like a reasonable exchange"

No, look at the dates.   First response?  Two weeks.   I didn't notice a reply, but they were nice enough to follow-up.... a full month later. With more questions despite already having indepth system information. 

If the game runs fine, keep it.  But if you have ANY technical problems? Refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238978736', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1520398926}
review:
全成就了补个评测。
游戏总体质量还是不错的，虽然boss数量少了点一共只有五个。
解密关卡难度都还可以，有的解密容错率确实有点偏低了。
游戏优化的感觉不是很好。我电脑已经比最低配置高很多了，全低特效最小分辨率战斗还是会有偶尔的卡顿。
有些判定很迷，斜向的平台有概率会突然踩空掉下去。受创硬直感觉过大了，尤其是紫色的那个科学家boss战里，被打倒有非常明显的硬直，操作感觉很不舒服。
其他的方面都还可以，剧情我不是非常喜欢（[spoiler]世界观交代的不够详细吧，感觉很维和[/spoiler]）但是感觉该收的伏笔基本都收了也没太大硬伤。
推荐打折购买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198348586024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1610, 'last_played': 1526731526}
review:
强推的平台游戏。
这款游戏并没有那样遇上大量敌军或者需要躲避大量的弹幕，主要的成分在于解密，以及要素收集。
本人手残通关时间很长，部分地图谜题确实很不错，有的地方手速要求也比较高，总之对手残玩家并不是十分友好。
至于能推的地方
一是画风，做口袋妖怪的gamefreak。萌到。
二是解谜的要素，搭上这个很不确定的物理因素……总之还是挺烧脑的（你的手呢  我脸滚键盘啊）
三 boss战还不错对boss的二状态不是很满意，剧情的第二周目三个boss也直接是二状态，没多大变化。
最后是剧情 强行多周目 因为涉及的是时间跳跃所以很多地方剧情感到冗余。
不说了 吸垃圾打怪了

author: {'steamid': '76561198043728918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2054, 'last_played': 1518329548}
review:
Gamefreak is at their best when Nintendo allows them to stop making Pokemon games for a split second. Drill Dozer is the earliest game I can remember them making other than Pokemon; its like the employees were set loose for a bit and made something they wanted to. The game was well produced with a lot of charm and creativity in its use of its central game mechanic. Tembo the Badass Elephant was another surprise; creatively different but just as good.

With Giga Wrecker I see a pattern: Gamefreak is really good at making creative titles. As was the case with the other games, Wrecker focuses on a central game mechanic and delves deep to flesh it out for as many game possibilities as possible. 

The premise is that every piece of rubble, from enemies to walls, can be 'sucked in' to form a ball you carry around that can be used to clobber enemies and the environment. You can use all this debris to form javelins that stick to walls, rockets that chomp away at whatever is in front of them, or a cube you can use as a platform. Most of the challenge comes from using your abilities to get through rooms-this is the puzzle element of the game and the 'meat' of the title.

The terrain that you do break and enemy leftovers on the field leave debris which can be used as a platform and which moves freely on the ground. Later on wiring and a light, poisenous gas is introduced which can be torn from platforms causing them to move and lift said platforms, respectively. This forms the 'physics' aspect of the puzzles.

It's done pretty well and I've never been stuck on some BS puzzle that infuriated me or made use of the physics engine in such a way that you only get it right half the time. In a way the physics are a bit of a red herring: if you look at any walkthrough if you do what they do you will get the same results. There is no need to balance a beam on your forehead or obsessively press back and forth on your pad in order to guide a wire through a needle. Which means that with some puzzles you might 'feel' like you can get something going because you can move the platform and everything around you so much, but typically the answers are much simpler.

I believe its worth noting how amazing the translation is. And by amazing I mean its Google Translate, which admiteddly still gets the message across and isn't that bad, but damn. I feel as if some of the plot elements were lost in translation. Which is a bit of a shame since this is obviously meant to segueway into a possible sequel since they built up a world and left the ending on one of those, "we've defeated the menace but there is still work to be done" notes. The writing equivalent of "keep your hopes up but we're probably not getting a sequel". Point is they laid enough of a foundation in the writing to make more come of it in the future, but not so much to commit themselves to a sequel.

Oh, and shout outs to the man Shinji Hosoe, known for his musical compositions on the Zero Escape series. He worked on the soundtrack for this game and man is it obvious in some songs. He has a certain musical style that is uniquely his; it was good enough for me to purchase the OST seperately. 

Recommended; more unique, good games from Game Freak please. Because of that I won't complain too much about the translation. Definitely purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108552492', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1516805651}
review:
[b] レイカちゃんの魅惑のボイスに酔いしれろ！[/b]
[b] 2D物理パズルアクション　GIGA WRECKER！！[/b]

[h1] [ジャンル詐欺]	[/h1]
ゲームジャンルはSteamの表記だとアクションアドベンチャーとなっていますが、パズルを解いて次の場所に移動すると即パズル・・・うん、パズルゲームだコレ！

[h1][パズルと物理演算の素敵な出会い][/h1]
このゲームの一番の売りである物理演算ですが、パズルアクションとの相性は非常に良く楽しいです。プレイヤーのアクションに対するリアクションが豊富でゲームにライブ感があり一度解いたパズルでも気がぬけません。特に楽しいのは大きなブロックを崩して落下、倒壊させるアクションです。こちらの微妙な操作、タイミングの違いがダイレクトに結果に反映されるのですごく気持ちいいです。
物理演算の影響か本ゲームのパズル要素は緻密さではなく豪快さが目立ち、パズルを解くには論理的思考力より行動力、発想力、好奇心が重要に感じました。
[i]「ぐわー全然わからん、とりあえずこれ落としとこ。おお！？」[/i]
[i]「右上の地点に行きたいけど足場がうまく作れねー！・・・ん？実は行かなくてもこうすれば・・・」[/i]
[i]「このボールすごく弾力あるけどジャンプ以外に使えないかな～」[/i]などなど。
逆に一つの方法論に固執して発想の転換ができない状態に陥ると延々とパズルにハマる危険性もあります。

[h1][合法アクション][/h1]
繊細な操作と大胆な操作が両方求められ、アクションの難易度は高いです。しかし、ミスしてもすぐに同じエリアから再開することができるので難しさも笑って許せる範囲内です。また物理演算の豪快さと相まって難易度の高いアクションを成功させたときの高揚感スゴイです。脳汁出ます。

[h1][ボス][/h1]
ボス戦は何度も戦ってパターンを覚えないと勝てない死に覚えゲームです。アドリブで対処できないボスは嫌だ！認めない！という人もいるかと思いますが、ボス戦も一種のパズルととらえて、何度もリトライして攻略することはこのゲームにあっていると思います。何度かボスにやられると攻略ヒントをゲーム内で教えてくれるので親切です。
？？？[i]「別にヒントが出る前に倒してしまっても構わんのだろう？」[/i]

[h1][おっさん殺しレイカ][/h1]
いちばん大事なことですが主人公レイカちゃんのアクションボイスが非常に可愛らしいです。このレイカちゃんボイスにはパズルがうまく解けないときやミスしたときのイライラを70%削減する効果があります。（個人の感想です）

[h1][不満点][/h1]
・ストーリーがクライマックスに向けて盛り上がったところからラストまで間延び感があります。
・エリア内に配置されているワープポイントなどの重要オブジェクトは手前でコントローラの上を押して調べることでマップに表示されるようになる仕様ですが発見した時点でマップに登録でよかったのでは？ゲートを開くためのゲートキーの開放を後回しにすると、どこにゲートキーがあったかわからなくなります。

[h1][経験者は語りたい][/h1]
ゲームクリアまでパズル要素で４回ほど解法をカンニングしました。解法を見て思ったことは「なぜ気付かなかったんだ、悔しい！」と思う反面、自力では気付けなかったか、かなりの時間を要したかな、ということでした。それはパズルの解法が理不尽というわけではなく、物理演算パズルの弊害として間違った解法にもさまざまなリアクションがあるため、うまくやればいけそうと錯覚してしまうからです。このパズルやたら難しいなと感じた場合、間違った解法にはまり込んでいる可能性があるので素直に攻略動画を参考にしたほうがいいと思います。
自分で気づかなかった発想やゲームの特性をカンニングで一度身につければ、その後のプレイで難解なパズルを自力で解ける数が格段に増えます。一時悔しい思いをしても、リベンジする機会は豊富にあるので楽しみましょう！

review: 액션이 태그에 들어가 있지만 퍼즐적인면이 더 강한 게임임니다. 예를들어 파괴가능한 오브젝트를 무기로 쓸수도 있고  제어가 가능한 고청덩어리는 무기나 도구로 쓸수 있습니다. 이게 이 이 게임의 가장큰 장점이라고 봄니다. 다만 먼가 억지스러운 퍼즐시스템도 있긴 하지만 그건 그거대로 독특하다고 생각하니 넘어가고..일단 이게임의 불안은 게임속 배경과 오브젝트 그리고 일러스트가 서로서로 제각각이라는 게 흠이네요. 일러스트의 느낌을 그대로 게임속의 배경과 오브젝트가 조화롭게 그려졌다면 참 좋았을것인대 좀 아쉽군요. 그래도 먼가 나사가 빠진거 같지만 한글화도 되어있고 얻을수있는 무기가 무기라기보단 도구에 가깝고 보스전은 단순히 피하고 고철얻고 그걸로 때려부수고 그런식이라 좀 실망임니다. 그 스테이지에서 얻을수 있는 무기를 쓴다면 더 좋았을 탠대 말이죠. 젤다의 전설 시리즈 처럼요. 매우 아쉽습니다.그래서 긍정적인부분7 부정적인 부분 3으로 평가는 긍정적이나 먼가 시간에 쫓겨서 만들었다는 그런 느낌이 들어 아쉽긴 하네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167411066', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1516694119}
review:
[h1]内容[/h1]
　近未来的なサイケデリックな世界でのメトロイドヴァニア風味な2Dアクションパズルです。
　ステージではアクション3:パズル7といった感じですが、意外なことに死に覚えゲーです。とはいえ原因の9割くらいは自分自身で、物理演算特有の理不尽さはほぼ無いです。理不尽さを感じるところを強いて言えば斜めになった物体の着地判定くらいでしょうか。
　一方ボス戦は完全にアクションですが、行動パターンはほんの僅かなので理解さえすればクリアは容易です。ボスの種類がたった5種と少ない点は残念ですが、このゲーム内容でボスを増やしたら要素の詰め込みすぎに感じる気がするのでこれはこれで良いと思います。

　スキルツリーによるスキル制をとっていますが、進めるうちに自然と溜まるものなので所謂稼ぎプレイというものは不要です。したい人はすれば良い、くらいでしょう。スキル自体もあれば便利程度のものばかりで、所謂必須スキルはありません。

　全体的に、巻き戻しが容易なうえデスペナルティも一切なく、いちいち読み込むようなこともないためその部分ではストレスを感じることはないでしょう。非常によくできています。

[h1]容量[/h1]
　クリア・全実績解除まで要領の良い人で10時間くらいといったところです。私はちょっとオツムがアレな為パズルで手古摺り約20時間掛かっていますが…。

[h1]操作[/h1]
　個別に複雑な操作はありませんが、組み合わせて行う為そこそこ忙しいです。ステージではタイミングを要求されることはあまりありませんが、ボス戦ではリズム感が大事になってきます。

[h1]実績[/h1]
　全実績はクリアさえできるなら容易です。全スキルの「スキル・マスター」とボスラッシュ実績の「一騎当千」以外はクリアまでの道程で獲得できるでしょう。
　「スキル・マスター」はクリア時点で7～8割、私のように下手なプレイヤーなら9割は埋まっていると思うので、埋めようと思えばすぐに埋められます。（ダルシャナC-06等を周回するのが良さそうです）
　「一騎当千」はストーリークリア後要素です。強化されたりはしていないのですぐに取れるでしょう。

[h1]総評[/h1]
　トライアル＆エラーを我慢できない人にはお勧めできません。パズル好きな人はアクションでイラつきそうですし、アクション好きな人はパズルでイラつきそうです。私自身はとても楽しめたのでお勧めしておきますが、はっきり言って人を選ぶゲームです。
　とはいえ、そこらのインディーゲームとは比べ物にならないくらい丁寧に作られており完成度も高いので2000円の価値は十分あります。ハマれる人なら安いと感じるくらいでしょう。流石ポケモンの開発会社、伊達ではないです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198096498469', 'num_games_owned': 1351, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1442, 'last_played': 1516429294}
review:
[h1] 推薦: ★★★☆☆[/h1]
嚴格來說，這款遊戲算不錯玩，關卡解謎的成份多過於冒險打怪。
玩起來的感覺就很像是Trine，只是不用換角色XD，
喜歡關卡解謎的朋友可以考慮入手。

整個地圖主要分成五個區域，除了新手區跟最後的天空之城之外，
每個區域都有自己所屬的BOSS，而打通這三個區域之後，才可以傳送去打最終BOSS。

[h1] 畫面: ★★★★☆[/h1]
遊戲中的美術風格很強烈，顏色的對比很深，整體畫面的精緻度算不錯。

[h1] 系統: ★★★☆☆[/h1]
遊戲的整個核心玩法在於女主角可以利用改造後的手臂，
將含有特殊物質的碎石聚集之後轉換某種物質型態。
聚集數量的多寡，將會決定該物質的外觀(大、中、小)。
而外觀的大小也取決於對於敵人的傷害。

轉換的型態，主要分成四大類型:
1.方塊 ( 主要拿來墊腳跳高用 )
2.切刀 ( 對於某些關卡需要針對性的細部破壞所使用 )
3.標槍 ( 這可能是最重要的型態，雖然也是拿來輔助跳高用，但是使用的方式比較萬用 )
4.電鑽 ( 遠距離+持續性的破壞使用 )

遊戲中，玩家也可以藉由擊碎怪物或破壞某些藏有技能經驗點的石塊來提升女主角的技能。
是的，你沒有看錯，這遊戲有「技能天賦樹」，可以強化某些型態的能力，
但其實升級的重點是提高女主角的血量!!
有個重點，就是請優先升級標槍使用數量的技能!!!!! ( 這真的很重要!!! )

[h1] 操作: ★★★★☆[/h1]
這邊要特別提一下....這遊戲的操作難度頗高。
原因是因為當你跳躍到某個位置的時候，角色會自動的往前走一兩步，
變成當你在跳某些只有一格位置的方塊，常常摔下去.... (所以要常常手動幫角色踩煞車...)

在來就是，因為這遊戲沒有所謂的回血機制，唯一的回血途徑，就是走到紀錄點，並且輕觸它一下XD
所以BOSS戰的時候，就是傳說中的不是你死就是我...重來 (1命決勝負，你沒看錯....)

最後就是關卡解謎的部分，雖然場景設計上看起來好像有某些規則可循，
但其實大多的關卡都是要靠運氣來解，常常一卡就是幾十分鐘=_=|||

[h1] 劇情: ★★★☆☆[/h1]
故事是描述在2050年的未來，一種名為MM-88的傳染病開始蔓延，只要被感染的人，只能在漫長的痛苦中迎接死亡的到來。後來有位博士發明了一種名叫「阿基特式」的療法，主要是在病毒破壞大腦組織前，將意志與記憶電子化。

而接受這種處理方法的人，其大腦和身體會全部更換為機械....
雖然這項技術原本是出自於善意，但是以物質的角度來看，這些機械化的患者已經不能算是人類了...

隨著時間的過去，這群「改造人」也逐漸喪失了人性並且狂暴化，在某位自稱導師的領導下，大舉入侵過去，希望可以藉由找到那位博士，強迫他讓整個技術的初衷改成是武裝而非治療，進而改變未來，讓這群「改造人」的戰鬥性能大幅提升。

而這位博士就是......

author: {'steamid': '76561198177866575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1516289890}
review:
本手残在视频通关后结合自身游戏体验给了好评。
美术风格较为独特，第一眼让我有点不敢相信这是日本工作室的作品。
解谜难度挺高的，同时对操作要求也不低。这点虽然应该给好评的，但太多的复杂迷宫场景和大量鲜艳色彩初见过后就容易让人审美疲劳了。加上稍有差池便要从头来过的一些地方，那就是让人身心俱疲。。。
拜视频通关所赐，我看完了全剧情。对我个人来说这剧情算是槽点和亮点并存吧，很明显编剧是不想考虑那些时空悖论的。
[spoiler]虽然我很怀疑最终boss就是女主本人[/spoiler]
此游戏缺点还是有点明显的，而且很可能会让一些玩家抓狂到讨厌。但瑕不掩瑜，总体好评。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006005209', 'num_games_owned': 2549, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1202, 'last_played': 1515172149}
review:
This game is made from the creators of Pokémon games, Game Freak Inc., but it has nothing to do with Pokémon. The game is a [b]platformer/puzzle game[/b] with interesting mechanics of using debris from broken blocks or enemies to your advantage, by transforming it into blocks, javelins, sword, shooting it or just using it to break stuff, move stuff, made stuff work and destroy your enemies. Your enemies are a race of Ajeets, which are like robots who attacked your world, killed everyone and got control of all they could, using humans as subjects or just work force.

I think to me one of the strongest points of the game were the [b]artstyle, the story and the mechanics[/b]. The [b]artstyle[/b] seems very unique with a cyberpunk theme, and I really like how all the stages and especially characters are drawn, the main characters and the bosses look incredible. The [b]battles[/b] between you and the bosses are very enjoyable. The [b]story[/b] is very unpredictable and goes to unexpected routes, when you just think things were over or were too simple. The physics are very interesting. And the soundtrack is ok, it has nothing really special here. 

The [b]physics[/b] may give you many options on how to solve a puzzle, sometimes making it easier or a little harder,  there are enemies, lasers, moving platforms, shooting lasers, etc. They are not really random like some people mentioned in other reviews(mostly people who didn't beat the game), they depend on how the particles of broken debris are laying after you broke a block, or how much you have of it, but there is always an exact correct way of doing the puzzle, which works everytime, unlike trying different methods and expecting more positive or negative results. But it's good the game gives you an option to solve a puzzle sometimes in a  way that feels like kinda cheating, because of how you used your tools, like it was not how it was supposed to be, but this happens very rarely, or making it seem harder than it is, by doing the puzzle in a wrong way.

The game also has a [b]system of skills[/b] that you can level up to increase the effectivness of your tools and HP, making you have more effective tools, more life and life-regen. You also have an optional customization for your tools, like a different kind of block, javelin, drill or sword. You can find the designs for these all over the game in optional areas, where you need to solve the stage puzzle to unlock them, it gives more variety to the game. You also have an option to teleport between beacons you unlocked, to not having to run from one point of the map to another, and be sure to use your save.

Overall the game is not that hard, but quite challenging in it's aspects ( bosses and puzzles). After beating the game you have an option to get a [b]secret achievement[/b] by defeating all bosses, one after another, in their strongest form, without replenishing your HP between battles, and it counts the time you have spent doing it, so you can make a record. This mode is called the Astra Rush.

Also the game features [b]workshop[/b], and you can play workshop maps that other users made and solve their puzzles, or just to unlock some achievements that in main game require some luck to unlock. Or you can just create your own puzzle stages, the game has a special mode for that.

I really enjoyed playing the game, so I totally recommend this, and unlocking all achievements in normal pace takes about 15-20h, which makes it good for completionists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095938930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1514972287}
review:
Alright, the only reason I bought this game was because it was made by GameFreak. I thought that since GameFreak has gotten a bit of freedom from Nintendo(I think?), maybe they can make other great games other than Pokemon. And since this peaked my interest more than that other game they made with an elephant, I decided to try it out. 

And it's pretty ok, I think. It ain't great but not bad either. The concept of being able to destroy and manipulate debris is pretty cool, I just think it should had more options on what you can create with the debris. The physics in this game isn't perfect but it works quite well most of the time. Most of the puzzles are ok as well except the ones on the final levels. Those made me infuriated. It didn't helped that the floor is slippery as wax throughout the whole game, which one of my major problem with the game. 

As for the story of the game, it's okay, maybe even great. But that's my opinion on it. I liked light hearted stories with a sense of a dark tone in the background nad vice versa. The main character is up to the usual japanese anime protag in a post-apocalyptic world. One of the supporting characters reminds me of Aikuro Mikisugi from Kill La Kill for some reason. The bosses have great personality, I think. The artstyle is also great to look at. Music is decent enough for a GameFreak game.



Overall, I liked this game even with it's flaws. That being said though, this game is not for everyone's taste. If your like GameFreak, physic-based puzzle platformer, and have a lot of patience, you might want to give it a try. If not, then don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096608080', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1514300828}
review:
1. 그래픽 개구림. 안티앨리어싱은 엿바꿔먹은 놀라운 그래픽. 내 눈에 도트 톡톡톡 트로피카나 튀어나올 떄마다 이게 픽셀그래픽 태그가 달려있지 않는 이유가 궁금함.

2. 게임 시작시 컨트롤러 권장이라고 되어 있음. 하지만 컨트롤러 사용시 2D 횡스크롤 게임임에도 불구하고 조이스틱만 사용 가능하며 방향키 사용 불가능. 그리고 컨트롤러 권장이라는 인게임과 달리 상점 페이지에는 "컨트롤러 일부 지원"...

3. 번역 완성도가 영 꽝임. 메인 메뉴에서 "수준 편집"이라길래 난이도 조절인가 하고 봤더니 level edit = 맵 제작이었음. 그 외에 선택 = option = 옵션이라든가, 튜토리얼 시 컨트롤러 버튼들이 [조이패드 버튼 1] 같은 식으로 뜬다든가 하는 게임에 지장이 있을 법한 번역오류가 너무 많음.

4. 물리엔진이 구림. 캐릭터 점프할 때 한 번만 살펴보면 구역질이 나는 것을 확인할 수 있다. 진짜 무슨 플래시로 만든 팬게임인 줄 알았네.

5. 기타 플레이엔 지장없는 자잘한 완성도 부족. 리콜이 쿨타임이 하나도 없어서 아무리 빨리 갈겨도 주인공의 기합소리를 내가 버튼을 누를 때마다 들을 수 있으므로, 한 명이 아카펠라를 하는 것도 구경할 수 있음.

여러모로 굉장히 완성도가 낮은 게임이다. 다들 퍼즐이 재밌고 스토리가 좋다고 하는데, 그렇다고 하더라도 돈을 조금만 더 들여서 완성도를 높여서 냈으면 좋았을 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084365642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1563704317}
review:
이 게임은 액션 퍼즐게임으로서의 가치를 충분히 끌어내었다. 
암울한세계관,흥미진진한 스토리와 매력적인 주인공 소녀의 복수극을 다루고있다
갈수록 복잡해지는 퍼즐구성과 머리를쓰게 만들어주는 아르케 능력들 덕분에 질리지 않고 스토리를 진행할수있다  
보통 액션게임은 후반으로갈수록 색깔만바꾼 몬스터들이 나오는것이 일수인데,
이 게임은 몬스터마다 공략법이 전부 다르며 개성이 넘치는 여러가지 적들이 계속 등장한다 
보스들도 패턴은 몇번맞고 때려보면서 알게끔 해놓았지만 멋지고 신나는 BGM과 위압감 높은 보스덕분에 보스전을 더욱 살려내었다
이런 액션 퍼즐류 게임의 특징인 한번 퍼즐을 풀면 계속 진행하고싶게 만드는 욕구를 
액션과 여러가지 아르케 능력들로 확대시켰다
단점을 말하자면 부술수있는 벽이 밟고 점프하고 하는액션이 조금 불안정해서 가시에찔려죽거나하기 일수인것 뿐 그외의 단점은 없는것같다 한마디로 갓겜

author: {'steamid': '76561198193339938', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1514465285}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198079952697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1514300285}
review:
이 게임을 잠깐 하며 느낀점
1.대화 스킵을 까먹은것같다. 보스 대화는 1번 보고 스킵이 됬는데 이건 실수해서 되돌리기하면 그 대화를 또봐야한다! 퍼즐을 못풀수록 아주 엿같다! 무슨 지거리야
2.고전rpg하는 기분이 든다. 대신 컨트롤이 평소 해두는 것이랑 익숙치 않아서 적응이 안된다. 키세팅으로 가서 zxcv로 바꾸니까 좀 나아졌다.
3.보스보다 퀴즈가 더 어렵다. 보스는 패턴을 알면 발로해도 될 정도로 쉬운데 퍼즐은 1번 모르면 평생 못푼다. 이게 내 암을 유발할거 같다. 내일 병원에 가야할것 같다.
4.재블린 창으로 벽 오르기를 시전할수 있다.점프-모으기-창 순서대로 빠르게 연타하면 등산이 가능한데 정상에 등반에서 맨 끝으로가서 떨어지면 무한한 우주로 갈 수 있다.영원히 죽지도 않아서 나는 잠시 시간을 되돌렸다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123548365', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1513483362}
review:
I liked this game, though it's certainly not without its flaws.

The concept sounded cool, and the game definitely has a cool visual style, particularly the CG story illustrations and the boss designs -- a bit reminiscent of huke's work on Black Rock Shooter. There's also a great ambient-electronic soundtrack. The meat of the game though is the puzzles, and for the most part the game plays pretty well. The puzzles have a good amount of variation, including a few particularly good ones near the end where the solution is not at all obvious at first.

The game's biggest problem however lies in the physics. Simply put, they're not always predictable. This isn't a problem most of the time, but when you mess up the same puzzle three times in a row because something tipped over in the wrong direction, it can be a bit frustrating. Thankfully dying or resetting a puzzle only sets you back to the start of that puzzle, but it's still not ideal. Also, the English translation is awkward and stilted at best, lending even the human characters a very robotic feel. This makes scenes that seem like they're supposed to be dramatic or funny come off as simply unremarkable.

Recommended if you like puzzle platform games and can deal with a bit of frustration at the physics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050770427', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1513772490}
review:
For a physics-based puzzle platformer the physics is really wonky. I don't really recommend this game except if you are a tryhard or a masochist. 

I do think some level aren't playtested thoroughly since most of my solutions felt like i'm brute forcing my way to complete it. Where if i do it "normally" the physics engine will do something funky and throw the debris all over the screen.

4/10 would not recommend except if you really are a masochist. 

(I'm looking for fun in games. Ridiculously retrying over and over and over again because some sh*t physics won't let me do x is not fun)

author: {'steamid': '76561198153357443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1498235562}
review:
[strike]I saw that Game Freak made this game, and that was enough of a guarantee to convince me to buy it. Unlike their more popular Pokemon RPGs however, Giga Wrecker is a physics-based puzzle platformer. I played through the whole game and even challenged the boss rush mode on the day it was added, and enjoyed the experience the whole way through. I can safely say that more people need to know about this game, because as it stands it is criminally underrated. The soundtrack is one of my favorites and the gameplay had me hooked from the start. The translation job wasn't the best I've seen, but the puzzles and boss fights were more than enough to outweigh the few issues I had with the translation. Overall, I'd say that this game is well worth buying.[/strike]

Edit: I'm so glad the Pokemon community doesn't know this game exists since the people in that community currently complaining about the Gen 9 games' lack of polish would probably review-bomb it for the crime of having been made by Game Freak. After years of thinking about it and having a more favorable experience with Hollow Knight than when I wrote the original review, I have to admit the game isn't as amazing as I originally hyped it up as, certainly not as good as Hollow Knight ended up being. Still, the game itself is fine. Not amazing, but not so bad that it should be avoided. I would recommend getting the Switch version if you want to try it out, since that version of the game has a better translation and more story content.

review:
前段时间终于是花了一些时间打通了，因为中途掉档了所以把这个游戏晾了很久。总体来说游戏性不错不过到最后一关难度突然变态起来。
给想通这个游戏的人三点提醒
一、尽早把标枪存在数目点出来，否则最后一关你可能会进不了门。（我不知道是不是必须三标枪反正我没想到其他解法）。
二、游戏虽然自带存档，但是最重要的一点是如果你不在蓝色的记录点存档系统是不会保留记录的。我就是这么掉了一个小时档的
三、下蹲回血是神技，尽早点出。这技能比空闲回血好用的多

这游戏流程虽然还算比较长但是后面重复内容偏多比较无聊，基本打通第一次就没兴趣再去刷第二次了

author: {'steamid': '76561198097669126', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1512790193}
review:
这游戏太TM好玩了 18小时全武器全钥匙收集通关 如果不迷路的话应该快些。。
一开始看这英语标题我以为是万亿魔坏神。。[strike]数学问题不要吐槽了[/strike]，买了之后发现是GameFreak开发的，没错就是开发口袋妖怪的GameFreak。还自带简体中文。吃了一惊
2D平台动作游戏，但是主要内容不是战斗，大部分时候靠解谜来获得打开新地图的钥匙和武器设计图[spoiler]其实是武器皮肤[/spoiler]。这个游戏会让你想到洛克人和恶魔城那类古典的平台动作游戏，十分考验操作。
女主角可以把敌人掉的破铜烂铁聚合到一起变成各种武器，可以利用这些武器来改变地形解决谜题开辟到其他地图的道路
游戏中的破铜烂铁和结块都收物理引擎控制，所以很多谜题和机关靠物理原理解决，比如重力、浮力、反射，还会遇到齿轮传动、传送带等。
背景设定在未来世界被一群狗屎机器人占领，女主角死了爹妈，随后被一个博士大叔所救，结果手都没了就只能用机器人的零件把她改造成改造人，就这样女主角踏上了拯救世界的旅程。
从头到尾剧情并不复杂，也交代得比较清楚，不是特别套路，也不显得傻逼。
很多地方不仅需要动脑思考这些机关和地形该怎么相互影响触发，也需要在合适的时机到达特定的位置，因此[h1]既需要动脑也需要灵活操作。因此游戏本身是有一定难度的，但是会难得你爽到。[/h1]Boss战反而没有那么大难度，你只需要死一两次摸清Boss出招和可以反击的时机然后练习几次就过了，因为单从血量来说，你比Boss厉害多了。
最绝的是大部分关卡的每一坨废铁、地形的每一处突出凹陷都是设计好的，你需要掌握好废铁的量，适当地改变地形，才能达到最终目的。
游戏中的物理效果都是即时演算，这造就了游戏的亮点也暴露了缺点，由于每次破坏场景之后各种渣块碎片都是即时演算出掉落效果，很多时候那些破铜烂铁并不是掉到你想要他掉到的地方去，所以有时候你就算知道了这个房间的谜题该怎么解，你可能也会被这个物理效果急死。。[spoiler]但是另一方面你有时候也可以利用这一点进行想不到的骚操作。[/spoiler]
[list]
[*]+清新的画风 除了博士都很可爱
[*]+有难度的谜题
[*]+简洁的剧情叙述 剧情富有内涵
[/list]

[list]
[*]-没有定数的物理效果
[*]-视角拉远之后有时看不到主角在哪儿
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039529987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1487972618}
review:
For some reason i thought that this is more about beat'em'up rpg when i bought the game, but it turned out different. Well i was pleasantly surprised.

This is the most lovely crafted puzzle-platformer I've seen for a long time. Modern look on puzzles gently mixed with metroidvania-like gameplay and old school bosses. And all this is flavored with not bad at all story and characters for this kind of game. I was actually pretty interested in this small setting, despite the fact that i usually pay much less attention to story than a gameplay.

Summing up, I'd like to tell that this game feels like, you know, the game. It gives you a warm, slightly tingling feelings, like when you exited for new challenges, feel like you actually doing something. And it never upsets you even if you fail often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028210515', 'num_games_owned': 4742, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2622, 'last_played': 1561612129}
review:
Giga Wrecker é um game de ação, aventura e puzzle em plataforma 2D o qual retrata um mundo pós-apocalíptico governado por robôs que desejam exterminar a raça humana.

Você joga como Reika, uma garota aparentemente adolescente que quase morre e é salva por um cientista que a transforma em um ciborgue com um braço biônico capaz de controlar detritos por meio de um dispositivo. Utilizando seus novos poderes, Reika luta contra robôs e resolve puzzles para salvar o planeta Terra, que está em ruínas.

O segredo da mecânica do game está na habilidade da personagem de controlar e coletar detritos de escombros dos restos de seus inimigos ou do cenário. Você ataca um robô pequeno, pega os seus detritos e os utiliza para destruir um inimigo um pouco maior. Então com os restos desse inimigo, você acumula uma esfera maior de detritos e a utiliza para derrotar robôs ainda maiores. Isso sem contar que com os detritos, você pode criar cubos que servem como pesos e plataformas, criar lanças de detritos para acertar inimigos à distância ou como suportes que se fixam em paredes, e ainda pode criar uma broca perfuratriz.

As fases do game são separadas em 5 áreas que à medida que são desbloqueadas, podem ser exploradas livremente e cada área possui o seu "chefão". As batalhas não são fáceis, mas depois de várias falhas e tentativas, você aprende a mecânica do oponente e o vence sem muitas dificuldades. Para facilitar para o jogador, orbs que salvam o progresso do jogo estão convenientemente localizados em pontos críticos, como próximos aos portais dos chefões.

Giga Wrecker possui uma árvore de habilidades. Quando inimigos ou certos blocos são destruidos, eles deixam cair cristais. Para cada 100 cristais você recebe 1 ponto de habilidade para usar na árvore de habilidades (que é enorme) e aumentar a sua barra de vida ou a taxa de regeneração dela, além de vários upgrades em suas armas e poderes.

Os puzzles começam bem simples e com o decorrer do game, podem ficar muito mais desafiadores. Eles dependem bastante da "física" e algumas vezes poderão resultar em momentos de grande frustração após várias tentativas sem êxito.

A direção de arte é original e bonita. Tudo parece ter sido desenhado à mão e o design de cada personagem é autêntico e estiloso.

A trilha sonora é também muito boa e certamente ajuda a dar vida a cada momento e emoção que o jogo quer expressar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179928683', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1511107191}
review:
8小时通关撒花~~有些地方卡关卡久了点噗噗
CG爆赞，BGM赞，设定赞，剧情赞。
但是如果做成洛克人那种多好啊！！！！结果是解谜，哎，个人不太喜欢烧脑子所以不怎么喜欢解谜游戏。
BOSS战贼酷炫，最好玩的就是BOSS战了，然而BOSS数量太少。
剧情很完整了，但是感觉世界观还没完全展开（所以做成ACT多好啊。
有一种黑岩的感觉（错觉？）可能是因为改造人和人类造型上差别的缘故吧。
战斗系统说实话手感不太好，操作手感略硬。
解谜部分很有意思，但是随机性太大，说白了就是有的地方只能看脸多试。
判定好迷啊，有时候明明能踩的地方踩不到，有时候明明没碰到怪人就飞了，怪的判定是一坨么。。。。
但是总体来说还是很赞的，毕竟CG贼良心啊！大片大片的CG。BOSS战也很有趣，贼酷炫。
最关键的是，可以看美少女啊都是美少女啊！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561197985250097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1534623109}
review: From inconsistent physics to touchy controls, I can only recommend that GameFreak stick to Pokemon games. While the concept is good and the art direction is unique, the mechanics of the game suffer from the above mentioned problems. Puzzles appear to be simple in nature but the unpolished controls and RNG physics make things an unwelcomed challenge. Many puzzles that let you access multiple doors or buttons should have check points built in so if you die to one of the many spike pits, you do not have to restart the entire puzzle. I tried really hard to like the game, but find myself wishing I returned it as I get further into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283246020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1638847970}
review:
ポケットなモンスターでおなじみのゲームフリーク発アクションパズルゲーム。
特徴的なのは敵や特定の足場をガレキにして、それを集めて新たに足場を作ったり武器として利用するシステム。
また全体的に抽象画のような世界が広がることもあってなんとも独特な雰囲気を出している。

アクションの難易度的にはそこまで難しくは無い。
強化次第では被弾を上回るくらいに回復が早くなり、またボス戦でも数回やられると攻略のヒントが貰えるため配管工のゲームがクリアできるならまあまず詰まる、ということはないだろう。
パズル面に関してはやや難があり、同じような手順で謎解きをしても細かいガレキの破片の当たり方などによって同じような結果にならないなど再現性が非常に低い。酷い時にはどう見ても正攻法で攻略してるのに行き詰ってしまうことさえある。
とはいえそれを逆手に取れば帰り道に当たる部分から突破したりちょっと間違ったやり方でも数回繰り返せば偶然うまく行ったりするため、シーケンスブレイクじみたやり方ができるのも面白い点ではある。

総括すると、やや癖はあるがアクション難易度、パズル難度共に遊びやすいゲーム。
是非買うべし…と言うほどではないが、セールの時に興味が湧いたら買ってみて欲しい、と言うくらいのおすすめ度だ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198008264709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1445, 'last_played': 1499040813}
review:
Really good. It's got that satisfying kind of frustrated that makes you want to play more.

There are definitely points for improvement and it could be longer, but it's worth the money. I'd like to see more games like this. Concept would make a very interesting competitive online game (looking at you devs).

Note: it's more of a physics puzzle game than a Megaman type platformer. I was expecting the latter and got the former, but was very satisfied regardless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132564665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1295, 'last_played': 1510392179}
review:
ストーリーを完走したので、とりあえずレビュー投稿します。

■購買理由
ムービーを見てアクション、パズル、グラフィックのクオリティの高さで購入を決めました。
これに関しては期待を裏切らないものだったと感じます。

■感想
・総評
　やり終えて「悪くなかったな」というのが正直な感想です。
　アクション爽快、パズルそこそこ、ストーリーそこそこ、キャラ良しという感じです。
　良い点、悪い点は以下にまとめますが、悪い点は細かい点が多く、概ね全体的には
　コンセプト通りうまくまとまっているのかなと感じました。
　やって損はしない作品と感じます。
　私はやりこみに向けまだプレイしようと思います。
・良かった点
　①アクションのテンポが良い
　　→敵の攻略法が分かってくると、部分的に流れるように敵を制圧できます。
　　　ゲームスピードも相まって、（この手のゲームにしては）中々爽快でした。
　②パズル要素のテンポが良い
　　→アクション要素が強い為か、パズルもキャラクターを積極的に動かして解く
　　　ものが多かったよう感じます。
　　　全体のオブジェクト配置を確認して、少し考えてから即行動で色々試してみる
　　　というサイクルなので飽きずにやり続けられました。
　　　正攻法でなくともごり押しが部分的にきくため、解けなくても積みにくいよう
　　　にも感じます。
　③ストーリーが壮大で引き込まれる
　　→序盤はロボット軍団に立ち向かう少女の復讐劇というシンプルな構図に見えた為、
　　　ストーリーに重きを置いていない作品なのかなと感じていたのですが、
　　　良い意味で裏切られました。
　　　中盤以降ストーリーに深みが出てきて、この先の展開が見たいという思いで
　　　一気にゲームを進めてしまいました。ただエンディングは私の中で意味不明です。
　④キャラクターが魅力的
　　→これは他レビュアーさんが語っていますので、深くは語りませんが期待通りです。
・悪かった点
　①ガレキが邪魔
　　→オブジェクトを破壊した際に残るガレキにも当たり判定があり、場合によっては足場に
　　　なるため、トゲなどの即死オブジェクトを回避できるのですが、触れるととにかく
　　　キャラが不安定になります。繊細な操作が要求される面もあるため、足場に下手な
　　　ガレキが残った時点で即やり直しなんてこともあります。（イライラするので）
　②オブジェクトをすり抜けてしまう
　　→他レビュアーさんも語られていますが、オブジェクトを足場として利用するのに
　　　当たり判定が独特すぎる為、変にすり抜けて落ちて死ぬなんてことよくあります。
　　　ただこのすり抜けは攻略するうえでも重要ですので、逆に利用してやるつもりで
　　　プレイするのが精神衛生的にもよいかと思います。
　③カメラワークが良くない場面がある
　　→パズル要素は如何に全体を把握するのかが重要と思いますが、アクション要素のせい
　　　なのか、妙にカメラがキャラに寄る場面があり、今アクションパートのか、パズル
　　　パートなのか分からないことがちょこちょこありました。
　④ボスパートの立ち振る舞いが独特
　　→これ絶対避けられないだろ…という攻撃がたまにあります。でも大丈夫、受けた分は
　　　簡単に回復できます。（時間経過で回復というスキルがあり、一定時間回避し続ける
　　　といつの間にか全快しています）しゃがむと回復が高速化するスキルもある為、
　　　常に全快状態というのも難しくありません。
　　　攻撃を受けても問題ないという感覚になった瞬間私の中で別ゲーになりましたが、
　　　回復を意識しないでも難易度が元々高くないため苦労はしないかなと思います。
　　　救済措置のようなものかと思いますので、ご利用は計画的にということでしょうか。
　⑤キャラクターの掘り下げが足りない
　　→メインシナリオは世界観の掘り下げが強く、各キャラクターについてはあまり語られる
　　　ことがなかったのは残念でした。
　　　せっかくキャラクターが魅力的なので、もう少し絡みや生い立ちが欲しかった
　　　気はします。ただその分ゲーム全体がコンパクトにまとまっているので、仕方ないこと
　　　ではある気がしてますが。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072124799', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1509303133}
review:
Giga Wrecker was a game that I was unsure if I would like. I found it from a YouTube video, posted by Gellot, of him/her beating all the bosses without taking damage. I was intrigued by the game mechanics and bosses, so I picked up a copy. It was an amazing use of $20.

Pros
-Good and interesting story
-Responsive controls, feels good to use them
-Not too hard, but also not too easy
-Good gameplay
-Great art style
-Custom levels
-Amazing music

Cons
-Sometimes gets random lag spikes
-On occasion, the physics in puzzles needs to be extremely precise
-Some animations are weird


Overall, Giga Wrecker is a great yet horribly underrated game. It needs more love than it currently gets. The bosses are great, the story is great, this entire game is great.The sad thing is that most people expect or only know of Pokemon from Game Freak. Stuff they make on their own just don't seem to get that much attention, which is a shame. All in all, I give this game an 8.5/10. It is something that I would 100% reccomend to my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059838242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1507580288}
review:
De la compañía que solo sabe hacer juegos de Pokémon, llega un juego que no es de Pokémon. Para un editor tan grande como GF es sorprendente el discreto silencio con el que GIGA WRECKER ha pasado, ni siquiera sabría que existe si no me hubiera salido de casualidad en mi lista de descubrimientos.
El juego añade mecánicas entretenidas al clásico plataformer y posee un estilo visual muy atractivo y extravagante, especialmente para los diseños de los pocos personajes con diálogos. Los puzzles a veces si cuestan un poco de paciencia o incluso suerte (algunos solo los pude pasar por "aprovechar el bug"). Por otro lado las bossfights, aunque al principio te pegan una arrastrada, son fáciles una vez que decifras la secuencia de ataques, cosa común en el género para ser honesto. Tristemente la campaña en sí no tiene mucho valor de rejugabilidad, pero aún entonces incluye un modo de juego donde puedes crear, compartir y descargar niveles creados por la comunidad muy a la Mario Maker.

Al final le daría un 8, por $180MXN vale la pena y si lo compras en rebaja es una oferta muy buena para las casi 20 horas de juego que tendrás hasta obtener todos los logros. Además me llevé una grata sorpresa cuando varios meses después de que lo compré le añadieron un nivel más donde puedes luchar contra todos los bosses uno tras otro pero con un poco más de dificultad, es bonito y raro para nuestros tiempos que un desarrollador añada algo a su juego sin cobrar otros $5USD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339972740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1508165541}
review:
手残党的[strike]福音[/strike]噩梦，上手偏难，建议配合手柄食用。
一旦习惯了操作，这个游戏还是很上瘾的。
虽然还是有很多缺点，比如看上去很大但实际没什么东西的技能树，薄弱的故事剧情，还有略显单调的敌军阵容。但不失为一款有趣的作品。
个人最喜欢的是本作的美术风格，尤其是众敌方boss的人设，令人印象深刻，[strike]比缠流子[/strike]女主要好看。作为一个2D横板卷轴爱好者，我便是因为喜欢这个风格而果断+1的。
流程还是觉得略短，好在有自定义关卡来作为弥补。
如果再完善一下世界观，丰富一下剧情，配上剧情语音，那就太棒了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198408219544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1490, 'last_played': 1507389797}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004660544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1506933274}
review:
Generally fun game, if a bit on the simple end of things for a puzzle platformer, even with a physics puzzle bent. The vast majority of the game is straightforward enough in regards to figuring out the solutions, and there was only ever one time I became stuck.

While there's nothing overly complex about this game, it plays well, the platforming is quite solid (although perhaps a bit too reliant on the instant death spikes towards the end) and the bosses while were fun and distinct.

The story and characters are a bit on the flat side unfortunately, and there are a lot of odd localization choices for the translation, which leaves some bits reading awkwardly (but understandably). It's fun for what it is, and honestly the aesthetics of everything carry it through where the story and characters fail. Game is gorgeous, can't argue that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048184311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1504627590}
review:
パズルアクションは苦手ですが、この作品は楽しめました。
キャラクターデザインとストーリーが良かったと思います。
特別斬新さはありませんが伏線回収がよく出来ていて、
単なるロボット軍団への復讐劇と思いきや、二転三転する展開に
ついついのめり込んでしまいました。

レビューなので良かったところや不満点を色々と書きたいところですが、今のところこのゲームには全てが霞むぐらいの大問題が一つだけあります。
[b] 足場の判定が非常に悪く、すり抜けてしまう不具合があるのです。[/b]

ジャンプして着地した角度？面？が少しでも悪いとすり抜け。
ガレキの上で飛んだり跳ねたりしてるとすり抜け。
ステージにはトゲや穴が多いのですり抜けが起きれば…当然死にます
１回や２回だけでなく、頻発するのでストレスがめちゃめちゃ溜まります。

この致命的な欠陥が直らない限り、パズル部分が良質でもアクションゲームとしてはお話になりません。
これだけでユーザーにBAD評価を入れられてもしょうがないと思います。
ぜひ今後のアプデで改善してほしいです。

私はおすすめの方に入れましたが、これは敵幹部の女性型ロボットたちがとても可愛かったからです！

author: {'steamid': '76561197979881682', 'num_games_owned': 2017, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1503167774}
review:
Game is an abandonware on PC and it was state officially that PC version WILL NOT receive a console exclusive ALT. version content. Basically, scumbag devs used us, PC gamers, as guinea pigs for their experimental game and after it became a success - jumped in bed with consoles with their shitty exclusivity.

==========

Recommend but with heavy caveats.
First things first - it's a physics based puzzle platformer, not an action game. Don't be fooled by the action-esque aesthetics.
Gameplay is fun and reasonably challenging, art is fantastic when it comes to stages and NPCs, and beyond fantastic when it comes to main characters, CGs and backgrounds. Seriously, CG and protagonists/bosses sprites can put many AAA games to shame. Story is interesting but is a bit cliche (you're going to predict all beats and twists an hour before they come, let alone revealed).
The only 2 negatives: it's a physics based puzzle platformer with all problems that entails: solutions are quite wonky and imprecise, you can get screwed up by your action missing by the couple pixels or milliseconds, or by just straight up RNG. Second negative - it seems that art and music is where lion share of dev effort was put in while actual coding was done by either B-team or people who didn't make any 2D platformers before. Game has some collision detection issues, some occasional performance problems and extremely wonky physics.

Overall game is great but you might get mildly(/extremely) infuriated during some of its parts.

P.S. Someone on the team had an "ingenious" (<- notice the sarcasm) idea to map "interact" to ↑ button so if you're playing on the controller - get used to a lot accidental interactions. Oh, btw, did i mention that the "reset puzzle even if you've just solved it after spending 10+ min" objects in game do their function immediately upon interaction, without showing a confirmation prompt? Yep, have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133660957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3654, 'last_played': 1562714620}
review:
Franchement, j'ai adoré ce jeu, qui est assez prenant, sans durer trop longtemps pour lasser (une quinzaine d'heures). Le système de ce jeu de plate-forme a osé des originalités, qui constittuent la base même de son concept, et qui méritent à elles seules de l'essayer. Vous acquérirez progressivement des compétences, et celles-ci vous permettront d'utiliser les éléments de décor (les décombres du titre) comme éléments fondamentaux pour progresser. Car vous devez vous-même modifier le décor (et pas seulement le démolir) pour progresser dans les niveaux, et revenir dans le temps si vous avez raté quelque chose. Un peu comme un puzzle-game. Le concept aurait pu être davantage poussé, mais l'expériencen' en demeure pas moins intéressante.
Car à côté de son originalité de gameplay, il faut bien garder en tête que Giga Wrecker est un jeu indépendant, avec ses défauts et ses qualités.
Au rang des défauts, rapidement: des collisions avec les éléments de décors pas toujours logiques (on passe au travers de certains éléments et pas d'autres) et frustrantes, mais tempérées par la dimension "die and retry". Des écrans parfois trop austères (skill ou carte). Et certaines habiletés qui n'apportent qu'un intérêt esthétique à l'histoire (notamment les nombreuses "arche abilities", qui auraient pu par exemple apporter d'avantage de petits bonus tactiques selon les variantes).
Parce qu'au niveau de l'esthétique, on rentre vraiment dans un travail soigné, pour un petit jeu. L'univers tout entier baigne dans un design post-apo/futuriste assez original, vraiment très réussi et cohérent. Les tableaux narratifs, quoique fixes, sont vraiment des oeuvres d'art, totalement raccords avec le reste, tout en appuyant la personnalité des personnages (nous y reviendront). Les musiques, malgré des boucles parfois un peu courtes, sont vraiment très belles, et alternent toujours au bon moment les passages contemplatifs, lyriques, ou la violence des affrontement. Et les affrontements avec les boss, qui constituent l'enjeu de l'histoire, sont certes assez dirigistes, avec des patterns à comprendre pour triompher, mais bien personnalisés et précis.
Surtout, l'histoire et les personnages sont vraiment bien menés, avec une psychologie très construite, et une évolution progressive du personnage principal, qui change progressivement sa vision du monde, avec une petite nuance de "Quète initiatique" toujours très sympa. Et d'une manière générale, au fil des bulles de dialogues, la personnalité des personnages, Y COMPRIS DES BOSS (qui ne sont pas là juste pour se faire exterminer), est précisée par petites touches. Sans spoiler, l'histoire, qui commence d'une façon des plus classiques, sans être une révolution, est très bien menée, et d'une profondeur et une subtilité inattendues au départ.
Au final, si j'ai trouvé le système de jeu très sympa quoique perfectible, je suis tombé amoureux de tous les à-côté: les designs, les musiques, les personnages, l'univers. J'espère sincèrement qu'une suite sera donnée à cet opus, en en conservant le niveau d'exigence et en en améliorant les quelques défauts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138085690', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1501428709}
review:
总的来说还是比较推荐，喜欢洛克人，恶魔城，银河战士这种横版ACT里的解谜要素的可以趁着打折买个来耍耍看，部分关卡可能对手残不太友好，boss战大多只是初见杀，摸清规律可以无伤过，点出蹲下加血速度提升的技能之后可以说是随便打
优点：
1.美术风格很对电波，时髦度爆表，几个角色的造型都很酷炫，第二个boss战特别惊艳
2.玩法比较有创意，改造人少女四处捡垃圾解谜过关搞百合感觉还不错
3.百合要素
4.操作手感不坏

缺点：
1.解谜并不是特别有趣
2.战斗方式比较单调，几个技能都是解谜用的，boss战基本就是聚集垃圾球平A糊脸
3.感觉故事没讲好

author: {'steamid': '76561198148705466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1501483554}
review:
本人玩过的横板过关游戏并不多，看到本作强调的是物理解密动作而非战斗，题材新颖加上画风看对眼，以及对Game Freak的信任，入手了这个游戏。
    实际的游戏时间大概是13小时左右吧。游戏的整体制作给人一种廉价感，总是让我有一种这是拿什么的边角料做出来的感觉。实际通关发现还是有一个比较完整的世界观和动作系统的，价格定位在我来看还算合理[spoiler]也有可能是我主机玩多了[/spoiler]。随着游玩深入，谜题难度很合适地递增，剧情深度逐渐解明。虽然游戏的收集要素虽然不算丰富，同时奖励性质也不大，但是这种不需要后期获得新的能力再回来[strike]强行增加游戏时长[/strike]，而是可以随着推进顺利地全部拿到的设计我是很喜欢的。
    其中有些关卡的设计令人称赞，但是有些则让人十分难受，[spoiler]游戏的技能树中有一项是让女主可以让射出的钻头回收资源的能力，同时回收资源的动作会打断发射标枪的动作。如果你过早点出这项能力，会导致游戏中一个本就考验玩家速度与操作的关卡难上加难，因为你必须要赶在回收之前射出标枪，做到这需要不断练习。同样影响到游戏体验的还有取消射出的钻头的技能。[/spoiler]总体来说，游戏的关卡设计还是十分不错的。
    虽然没有语音是本作的一大缺憾，但是中文化做的还是十分不错的，不仅从游戏内容可以看出，从成就列表也可见一斑。总体来说十分推荐以下人群进行游玩体验：
[list]
    [*]物理解密游戏爱好者
    [*]2次元爱好者
    [*]Game Freak粉丝
[/list]
    以下内容涉及剧透：
    [spoiler]另外我想吐槽，游戏结尾反派被打败顺理成章地叛变是闹哪样？虽然确实都很可爱，死了很可惜就是了。[/spoiler]
    [spoiler]还有那个下蹲回血的技能实在bug，boss rush模拟战简直无难度了。推荐给打boss苦手的玩家。[/spoiler]
    闲来无事，第一次写评测，还请海涵。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995017516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1500673248}
review:
I really wanted to like this game, but due to some flaws I can't really reccomend it, especially at full price.

First off, this game is much more of a puzzle game than a platformer, at least the portions I was able to get through. So if you are expecting a platformer with puzzle elements (e.g. Trine) you will be dissapointed.

Pros:
Good graphics
Creative Design

Cons:
Disjointed - The different sections of the game don't really mesh well. This is particularly evident in the boss fights, when the game abruptly changes from "go your own pace" puzzles to "frantic timing"
Unpolished:
Both the translation and design seem rushed.
Some areas have no music, with no particular reason why there shouldn't be any. 
Checkpoints are not automatic, so if you forget to activate one you get sent back several screens upon death. 
Sometimes puzzles solutions don't work because a piece of debris gets stuck somewhere. This has caused me to reject correct solutions at least once, possibly twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155592702', 'num_games_owned': 1094, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1537126110}
review:
Giga Wrecker, ein sehr sehr tolles Spiel.

Seit langem nicht mehr haben mich die Spielwelt und die Charaktere eines Spiels so begeistert. Und genau darin liegt in meinen Augen auch die Stärke dieses Spiels. Es sieht unfassbar gut aus, die Charakter-, Gegner- und Boss-Designs sind ungaublich gut durchdacht ebenso wie das Design der gesamten Welt.
Man kommt zwar ca. in der Mitte des Spiels wieder in die Anfangswelt zurück und die 3 zuvor erkundete Welten, die nur zur Hälfte frei waren, werden nun auch komplett frei. Trotzdem fühlen sich die Level immernoch frisch an.

Das Gameplay macht wirklich sehr Spaß. Ein 2D-Plattformer mit vielen Puzzels. Es kommen immer wieder neue Elemente hinzu, damit die Puzzel nicht fad werde. Jedoch merkte ich bei mir, wie ich gegen Ende hin durch das viele Neustarten und Neuversuchen der Level langsam echt genervt geworden bin, da ich nicht mehr mein Gehirn benutzen wollte, sondern viel lieber den nächsten Storyhappen bekommen oder mich über den nächsten Boss freuen wollte.

Der Soundtrack ist solide, teilweise hat es mich schon etwas gecatcht, jedoch nichts atemberaubendes. Den Soundtrack DLC werde ich mir persönlich also nicht kaufen, aber ich hab mich jetzt auch nicht allzu sehr auf die Hintergrundmusik konzentriert. Vielleicht ist sie an mir auch einfach vorbei gegangen.


Alles in allem kann ich das Spiel nur aus reinstem Herzen empfehlen und Game Freak danken, dass sie ihr wunderschönes Spiel auch auf den PC gebracht haben, da ich sonst auf jeden Fall nichts davon mitbekommen hätte. Ihr habt mit Giga Wrecker einen verdienten Platz in dem Favoriten Ordner meiner Steam Bibliothek. :3

author: {'steamid': '76561197966370322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1500497838}
review:
I seriously don't see how this game can get a positive score. Yes, the graphics are certainly not bad, nor is the soundtrack but the controls are kinda wonky and it suffers from some old school game design in the form of ridiculous spiky death traps and obnoxious knockback. Still, not that much of a problem if you've suffered through the NES era.

However what well and truly kills the game and makes me want to throw my controller through the screen in rage is the physics based puzzles. For instance, in some places you need to guide a wall bouncing laser to hit a certain spot. The physics mean you have potentially hundreds of variables to take into account and in many cases it comes down to pure RNG if you get it right or not. Did your block fall in right angle? Did the destructible surroundings settle in the proper manner?

I quite frankly want my money back.
