author: {'steamid': '76561198135403043', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1499693528}
review:
[h1]類型：[/h1]
第三人稱動作角色扮演 
[h1]要素：[/h1]
半開放式地圖，技能樹，收集品，自訂關卡，工作坊(自定義關卡)，益智解謎，創造(奈米結晶隨意塑型)
[h1]中文：[/h1]
官方中文
[h1]劇情：[/h1]
一般。略微簡單的劇情架構
[h1]畫面：[/h1]
精美。前期開場動畫很有氣勢！遊戲的背景畫風呈現荒廢破壞的科幻感，有賽博朋克的風格。遊玩過程會穿插簡短動畫，帶入世界觀及女主角的想法。個人喜歡角色技能的呈現方式～有破壞力及打擊感
[h1]音樂：[/h1]
一般。音樂曲風個人喜歡。配樂種類不夠豐富～
[h1]難度：[/h1]
難。場景中的敵人或阻隔物，需攻擊部分區塊（或用技能）才能通過，有時候得靠運氣。因為阻隔物被推動後，會依物理原則移動，有時位置不對還是無法通過。有些關卡會有敵人擋路，但手上的奈米塊卻無法擊破，須善用技能，讓敵人移到不擋路的地方
[h1]操作：[/h1]
難。雖然操作不複雜，但部分關卡除了知道如何解謎過關外，還得有些操作上的運氣，另外跳躍和技能使用的時間點也很重要。還有一部分操作難度在於要小心不能被敵人摸到...
[h1]優化：[/h1]
順暢
[h1] 娛樂：[/h1]
好。遊戲的娛樂性在於有技能樹系統，關卡和頭目也設計的不錯～玩家得使用對應的技能解謎通關。說解謎不大對，應該說是益智，想辦法用技能通過場景，然後一路打敗敵對頭目，有點類似洛克人的通關方式，只是多了益智解謎！遊戲最大的困難點就在於 "怎樣用技能通過每個路障關卡"
[h1]重玩：[/h1]
一般。除了自行編輯關卡可玩外，也可遊玩其他玩家編輯的關卡～由於存檔點多！個人會重複同一個關卡刷技能^^
[h1] 入手價格：[/h1]
－５０％，NT＄２３４
[h1]總結：[/h1]
[u][h1][b]推薦，個人－５０％特價入手，值得一戰。但部分益智關卡難度稍高，卡久了會有疲乏感，若能有條件的通關提示，或許能玩得更流暢！整體來說是款 "劇情稍簡單" 的動作益智遊戲！這遊戲讓我聯想到洛克人^^還有～那個救女主角的博士也太像死神裡的浦原喜助了（笑[/b][/h1][/u]

[h1]缺點：[/h1]
１。時光回朔的粉光常設置在跳躍平台～時常一邊按上跳，然後就回朔重來了...
２。很多的存檔點！但若能改為隨時存檔就更好了，避免剛通沒存檔點～但很難的關卡，結果一過去手誤死了，全部重來
３。不太能適應這種撞到怪，大量損血的機制，尤其女主角血少的可憐，隨便被怪撞一下就少一半血...
[h1]４。導覽地圖上的指引太少，例如有走過的地方，並不會顯示遺漏的能量柱或未開啟的門。有點不夠體貼玩家，有時玩家就為了找那個漏掉的門，到處繞...繞到失去耐心[/h1]

[h1]優點：[/h1]
１。破壞的打擊感很棒！
２。如何使用能力適當的破壞，以通過每個場景～帶有益智性的解謎
３。教學關卡設計的不錯！一步步透過劇情及關卡引導玩家熟悉技能～幾乎沒有遺漏！
４。有關卡的瞬間傳送功能！
５。有技能樹系統～也可以耐心的重複刷技能點升級。唯一可惜的是技能沒有相互變化的玩法
６。"益智" 關卡設計的還不錯～都是讓你搭配著技能去通過的，不過很多關卡沒有一定的通過方式，比較隨機性

[h1]分享：[/h1]
１。要注意時光回朔的位置，若不是真要重來，切記經過時不要按到上！不然得重打
２。搖桿按上鍵～女主角會敬禮^^蠻有趣的！只是不知道讓角色敬禮的意義是？
３。阻隔物在移動或掉落瞬間是不能踩的！請等阻隔物 "就定位"
４。每個敵人要擊敗，有對應的奈米結塊大小，當可攻擊時會用藍色顯示，要觀察週遭的是否有奈米塊，要先取得！
５。沒事就按一下ＲＢ鍵，吸一下精華～不！吸一下奈米塊
[h1]６。部分關卡必須善用讓敵人彈跳去撞機關，讓敵人彈跳的方式有兩種。第一種是用彈跳球去頂他，第二種是靠近用跳投的方式向敵人丟彈跳球，"幸運的話" 敵人會剛好撞到機關[/h1]
７。有時關卡會因為鑰匙沒有，而無法到下一個場景，可以使用導覽地圖，先去其他地方探索
８。跳躍的時間點很重要！
[h1]９。若卡在同一關卡，關卡又剛好有劇情對話，可以按ＳＴＡＲＴ略過[/h1]
[h1]１０。場景中有許多紅色能量柱，一定要去點。因為連結下一個區域的門，都要開啟指定數量的能量柱才能通過。所以若門無法開！表示有遺漏的地方沒有打通，可開啟導覽地圖，在各個傳送點多繞繞[/h1]
１１。遊戲中的敵方整體架構似乎運用了佛教的術語及一些人名，例如：僧婆洛，毗娜達

review:
運用物理運算解謎的平台動作遊戲
主要內容都是運用能力與機關配置的互動通過關卡
每個小關卡都有設置還原點，可以盡情重複嘗試

因為是運用物理運算解謎的關係
有時解法不見得只有一種
但也有些關卡不會如設計者預想的那樣運作
少數幾關需要靠運氣

對操作技術有些需求和考驗反應力
會有「要在石塊被全部絞碎前跳過石塊」之類的關卡
BOSS戰則是完全考驗反應力
技能樹到後期時，有些能力可以彌補操作技術

劇情方面，不知是翻譯的問題還是原本就如此
用詞過於做作，導致筆者覺得劇情有些幼稚中二
但這部分並不影響遊戲性

author: {'steamid': '76561198138098072', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1561673455}
review:
Recomendo muito esse jogo.

- Ótima jogabilidade.
- A história é um pouco confusa, mas bem envolvente (pra mim pelo menos):
[spoiler]É uma história pós-apocaliptica onde máquinas conhecidas como Ajeets estão destruindo e escravizando a raça humana. Por possuir uma história com base em "Time Travel"(que você só descobre que é baseado em Time Travel la pro meio do jogo), ela é bem confusa e não faz muito sentido. Como a personagem principal pode lembrar das coisas que aconteceram no futuro, quando uma outra personagem volta pro passado?[/spoiler]
- Os puzzles são interessantes, as mecânicas do jogo também. Conforme você faz progresso no jogo, você libera diferentes habilidades que utilizam os detritos que você consegue controlar, e você os utiliza para resolver os quebra-cabeças do jogo, e até mesmo a enfrentar alguns inimigos.
- O jogo não é muito difícil.
- Os upgrades do jogo são pouco diversificados, a maioria são upgrades para aumentar sua energia e a regeneração de energia.
- As personagens são pouco desenvolvidas, mas para a história do jogo, faz sentido não existir um aprofundamento das personagens.
- A trilha sonora é gostosinha. Da pra ficar ouvindo por horas tranquilo.

Existem algumas poucas coisinhas que me deixam incomodado no jogo. Coisa boba. Por exemplo, o sprite das personagens (Sprite = Imagem que representa a personagem), quando você vira de um lado pro outro, é só uma imagem "flipada", invertida. Ou seja, o braço direito de uma personagem, por exemplo, quando ela vira para o outro lado, vira o braço esquerdo dela. Como já disse, é algo bobo, mas me imcomoda.

Não é perfeito, mas vale a pena jogar. Daria uns 8, ou 8.5 de 10 se fosse pra "classificar" com nota. Mas nota é só um número. É sempre bom jogar o jogo pra saber se você realmente vai gostar ou não. Ninguém melhor pra dizer se um jogo vale a pena jogar do que você mesmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075220579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1499196231}
review:
A very neat approach to a Puzzle/Platformer made by Game Freak.
The game runs flawlessly, I haven't run into any sort of lag, nor has my game crashed once.


A lot of people note that, the flaw Giga Wrecker runs into, has something to do with the physics engine being wonky and collision detection often not doing its part.
[b]I have barely come across any of this.[/b] Only 1 or 2 times have I fallen through something (lose debris), me being at fault for trying to jump on something on a very weird angle. 
The Physics Engine is very consistent and never made any problems either.

The game gives off a lack of polish due to it starting very fast, the tutorial area is rather short and you are being thrown into action rather quickly. This "lack of polish", however, is later barely noticable.


Giga Wrecker starts of rather easy, but later changes to a somewhat moderate challenge, never have I felt that something was impossible or just too hard. 

Also, Giga Wrecker is [b]BEAUTIFUL[/b].
The art style is one of a kind and pretty much made me buy this game in the first place.

I recommend this game a whole lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276785692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1499011296}
review:
很不错，很新颖的独立游戏。
刚开始玩，感觉和横版过关没什么区别（其实我是冲着白毛妹子去的，好喜欢她）（绿毛主角：你滚啊，有种不玩我啊……）
玩了几分钟后，才发现，这不是动作游戏，而是解谜游戏。游戏场景的物理互动做到这种程度让我眼前一亮。
顺带一说，过关是解谜，BOSS是格斗。
并且，玩家可以自己编辑地图，让别人挑战，也可以挑战别人的地图。

author: {'steamid': '76561198129101597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1498967702}
review:
2d解谜游戏，谜题难度较为合理，基本上所有解谜要素都在屏幕范围内，谜题解法不一定唯一，解谜可利用的元素也较为丰富，所以玩久了也不会无聊。而且游戏内置关卡编辑器，让可玩性大大增大。

虽说是横版游戏，但是没有特别变态的平台跳跃障碍，基本上没有特别靠反应的地方，大部分地方只要解谜的顺序和策略合理就能轻松应对。

游戏动作要素较少，主要体现在boss战上，5个boss各有特色，打起来也很有意思。同时除了最终boss以外其余boss血量都较少，也变相降低了一些难度。

有中文！

全成就较为简单，适合成就党。

比起上述的优点，个人感觉剧情稍微有点不足，n次的时空倒流有点用滥了的感觉。（虽说这类游戏剧情只是点缀）

综上，9/10

[spoiler]boss rush开启地点：
通关后在飞天要塞00管区传送点往左走走到尽头有一个电梯门，进入即可[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198292206212', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1499850393}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198322869332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1516895295}
review:
面白い作品なのですがバランスの悪さを感じます。
ジャンルとしてはアクションパズルRPGといったゲームとなります。
瓦礫をブロックにする力を使い足場を作って登ったり瓦礫を武器にして戦ったりとアクションパズルとしては面白いです。ただ、終盤大量に設置されている即死トゲとうっざい物理エンジンによる事故でハゲそうになるかもしれません

爽快なアクションを求めている方には少々うっとうしく感じ、逆にパズルを楽しみたい方にとってはボス戦の難易度が少々高く、イライラさせられるかと思います。
レベルを上げれば少々難易度は緩和されるのですが、レベル上げのため他へ移動するとボス前に移動装置が無いため、戻ってくるのにいちいちパズルを解く必要が出てきます。そのため妙にゲームテンポが悪く感じるかと思います。

そのためアクションをやるにはパズルが邪魔でパズルを楽しむにはアクションが難しすぎるといった「バランスの悪さ」を感じました。
ゲーム自体は独特の雰囲気と絵によって面白いです。
最後に、最初のボスとの戦闘はHPを６くらいまで上げてから挑むことをオススメします。他ボスよりあきらかに強いです（白目）

author: {'steamid': '76561198054825270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1497766356}
review:
アクションとパズルで苦労も２倍
そんな某大作RPGを思い出すようなゲームでした


このゲームはアクションとパズルがあるゲームであって
アクションパズルゲームではありません
むしろアクション要素とパズル要素が水と油のごとく反発しあい
悪い方に働いている印象です


ゲームのベースはロックマンを彷彿とさせるものですが
そこにパズル要素をぶち込むことで
ロックマンのような手強いアクションをこなしつつ
パズルを解いてく内容となっています
と言っても両方の要素が噛み合ってないので
アクションゲーと見たらパズル要素が邪魔になり
パズルゲーと見ても妨害してくる敵が鬱陶しい
誰も得をしない内容になっています



期待していただけに非常に残念でした

author: {'steamid': '76561198012992323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1496951215}
review:
Let's start with positives.  The game's art style is really fantastic, to say the least.  A nice, 'chunky' visual aesthetic.  The open-ended approach to puzzle platforming is refreshing, and very well thought-out.  Honestly, taken from a step back, the game is refreshing to play, and I wish there was more creativity like Giga Wrecker's in modern gaming mechanics.

To quickly summarize what the game lacks.. It feels very quickly pushed out.  The physics of movement feels a little lacking; sometimes you fall through what appear to be solid surfaces.  Sometimes, in the vein of classic side-scrolling action platformers, you take one hit, which causes you to bounce into a second enemy or stage hazard (most notably and egregiously in the Astra fights).  And sometimes, the physics engine just straight-up disagrees with you.  All three of the above will generally result in death, especially in the latter half of the game, with the oft usage of spikes and pitfalls. 
Because of the relatively quick loading times, it's not as much of an issue as it could be, but because of the nature of some rooms, you're forced to repeat several sections before you can get back to the segment that caused your death.. only to die to it again because of one of the above, or when you accidentally push the reset button for a fraction of a second.

The music's lacking, and the localization's even moreso.  It's exciting to see Game Freak's name on something considering how much of a mainstay it is regarding my childhood memories regarding the pokemon franchise, so that's what caused me to gravitate towards the game, and, I think, in a lot of cases, it's the same for most of the people who ended up picking Giga Wrecker up.  But genuinely, someone really need to go through these sorts of games with a fine comb before they get pushed out.  I was expecting more, especially after grasping just how intuitive and clever the game's core mechanics are.  Please, make more games like this, but treat them with kid gloves next time, okay?  This sort of result is just not acceptable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117754475', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1368, 'last_played': 1497010949}
review:
Эта игра определенно мне понравилась, изначально купил я ее потому что скриншоты показались мне очень красочными, да и тэги игры были более-менее мне по вкусу.
Сюжет тоже в итоге оказался вполне интересным и увлекающим, что не может не радовать.
Развитие в игре происходит постепенно, что есть логично, и развитие это идет в самом подходящем темпе, как я считаю.
Тут и система прокачки есть, что тоже очень приятно глазам.
Так вот, дизайн у игры и музыка мне понравились больше всего, честно. Саундтрек приятен как в простых локациях, так и в битвах с боссами особенно, которые, кстати, тоже вполне интересно сделаны. Про дизайн же я сказал в самом начале...
Сам по себе геймплей заключается в решении пазлов в перемешку с избиением роботов, что, по моему мнению, не оставляет игру казуальной. Переодически, я даже страдал в некоторых моментах и вырубал игру нафиг(не рекомендую так делать, лучше сначала сохраниться перед выходом с:). Боссфайты тоже показались мне интересными, не слишком простыми и не слишком сложными(кстати в игре даже присутствуют некоторые элементы парирования).

В итоге:
Плюсы:
+Миленькая озвучка главной героини и боссов на японском языке(серьезно, они мило орут)
+Хороший саундтрек
+Прекрасный дизайн
+Интересный геймплей, построенный на физике
+Челлендж
+Интересный сюжет
+Всякие плюхи типа достижений и карточек
+Редактор уровней(+ стим воркшоп)
Минусы:
-Если набить руку, то геймплей может стать простым, хотя, у меня такого не произошло
В принципе, этот минус я с трудом выдавил из себя, поэтому

[b]  Моя оценка - 9.5/10! [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198218105561', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1553674797}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198367914810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1496834912}
review:
优点：最初购买游戏时以为是一款偏战斗向的横版过关游戏，但是入手后却发现是一款偏解谜类的游戏。但不得不承认，这款游戏的解谜内容很有意思，没有固定的套路，一个谜题也可以有很多解法，不算烧脑，但是很有趣。
缺点：作为一款横版过关游戏，它的操作手感非常奇怪，尤其是跳跃，对于部分BOSS的攻击判定也让人感到别扭（尤其是第一关用大剑的BOSS，我在她身上耗费的时间是最终BOSS的几倍）
总结：这是一款相当好玩的解谜向横版过关游戏，新人只要适应了操作也不会太受苦

author: {'steamid': '76561198338409003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1496742820}
review:
轮回百合没有掉头却有断手，是不是有一种治愈的感觉？
首先这游戏里的画面给我的第一感觉是好像《忍者杀手》啊！不过介绍剧情的插画很带感，音乐也不错。
再来就是游戏方面，怎么说呢，这款游戏的判定很迷，有时间你不小心踩到垃圾而掉下平台死亡，有时间你以为掉到尖刺上要死却发现自己站在垃圾上，不过拜此所赐，游戏内的过关解法变的多样了，不信你对着要转的齿轮发射标枪看看。而且这游戏的前四个boss在你死了3次以后会贴心的告诉你打法，而且这些打法足够你打通这款游戏。






最后再小小吐槽一下剧终动画里的大叔怎么一点肌肉线条都没有，把胡子去掉后就完全是个少女啊！

author: {'steamid': '76561198141479869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1678003480}
review:
道中はパズル要素を盛り込んだアクションゲームで、
物理演算を利用し、部屋にあるオブジェを敵も利用し
あの手この手で動かしたりして先に進む内容です。

進み方を考えるだけでなく、アクション部分の操作による誤差や失敗、
物理演算による、多少の偶然やハプニングが結果に加味されたり、
次回の思いがけぬヒントになったりするのが楽しかったです。


ボス戦は、2Dアクションゲームが好きなら喜びそうな1対1のものですが、
プレイヤー側が攻撃を当てられない時間も、当てるための準備行動を兼ねており、
難しいゲームにありがちな、無敵時間や届かない位置を乱用して、
長々と一方的に攻撃されるだけのケースはなく、とてもテンポが良いです。

スキル取得後も、個別にON/OFFを変更できたり、
他のプレイヤーの方によるエディットステージも遊べるので、
先の偶然性と合わせ、パズル要素があるからといってガチガチではなく、
腕や遊び方に合わせ、ある程度柔軟にあれこれ選べるのが○。

キャラや全体のデザイン、話や音楽もそれぞれ魅力的で、
綺麗な音色の音楽がところどころ前衛的とも言える見た目に噛み合う不思議。
強烈な要素と柔らかい要素が衝突することのない、よく練られたゲームだと思います。


※上記の文を書いた当時、唯一の要望として、セーブスロットが３つなので
各ボスの前でセーブしておけないので、ボス戦のみを遊べるモードも
ほしいと書きましたが、ボスラッシュも実装されました。
（制作チームの皆様、ありがとうございます！）

author: {'steamid': '76561198031654661', 'num_games_owned': 3513, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1528050716}
review:
Giga Wrecker is a game I bought after someone mentioned that it was made by Game Freak. I didn't even look at the gameplay as I wanted to be surprised and I definitely was not expecting one of the best puzzle platformers i've played in some time.

The main gimmick to this game is finding debris and combining it into a large ball of debris that you carry around. You can use this to extend your attack range, make platforms and more as you get new upgrades. Each area you visit has its own mechanics for puzzles, like making your debris balls bouncy or poison gas that lifts platforms as well as a new power in each area to use which makes them all stand out. There is also a skill tree in this game which I feel can increase the replayability, as I went through the whole game without knowing about a skill that can make more platforms.

The best part in this game are the physics and how you use your abilites to affect them. There is a lot of satisfaction when you solve puzzles in this game and it's a lot of fun to see the blocks fall in the exact places you need them to. There are also multiple ways to solve certain puzzles, and in a lot of places I felt like I was breaking the game. The combat is pretty simple, but I don't think this was the focus of the game, and a lot of the time combat is about finding enough debris in the level to attack them. The boss fights are pretty great as they still use the main mechanic of the game, and learning the patterns of the boss is fun and satisfying.

The graphics are unique and look nice. The sprites themselves are very detailed, and the art used in story sequences look lovely. The story is pretty interesting but it is one of the weaker elements of the game because of the bad translation. You can understand what is being said most of the time, but a lot of it sounds strange. Finally, the music is excellent - in the main areas it's nice and relaxing for puzzle solving. It gets a bit more intense during the boss fights.

This review is kind of a mess but I hope it gets more people interested in this game, as I feel like it's a bit underrated right now. A few final notes are that my computer is not that great so the game's performance was slow at times, but the game was good enough that I kept with it. I'm also planning on getting more playtime out of it through the game's custom levels made by other people.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976326496', 'num_games_owned': 2527, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1496434270}
review:
A 5th of BitSummitに行った際に展示されていたのを見て、購入していたけど積んでいたからこの際消化するか、と罪滅ぼしに着手。Ver.表示がないためクリアVer.は不明。初周のクリア所要時間は収集も行いつつ進めて約10時間。全実績解除まで12時間。

[h1]Pros:[/h1][list]
[*]物理演算を利用した様々な解法
[*]適度に考えることを要するパズル
[*]レベルエディタ付属
[*]血湧き肉躍るボス戦
[*]リトライが高速[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1][list]
[*]物理演算による入力調整と予測の難しさ
[*]強制終了を要する進行不能バグ[/list]

[h1]アクションとパズルの偏りは感じるも楽しみ方の幅がある[/h1]

　瓦礫と聞くと「おめぇもボスになったんだろぉ、この瓦礫の山でよぉ」という台詞が脳内再生されます。そんな瓦礫を左腕の義手で収束し、加工や投擲をしつつ進んでいく2Dパズルアクション。最大の特徴は物理演算を利用していること。瞬時の反射を求められる場面もあるにはありますが、アクションと言いつつも物理演算を利用したパズル要素が占める割合の方が大きいです。各部屋ごとにパズルを解かないと先に進めないため、どんどん前に進んでいけるタイプとは異なります。

　パズルは力押しでもいける反面、ブロックと装置を接触させる隙間に瓦礫の破片が入り込んで反応しないとか、ブロックを切り倒したり設置するのに微妙な立ち位置の調整が必要など、物理演算の気まぐれによるやり直しが結構あります。但し、リトライはとても高速でストレスフリーです。物理演算を利用すると某Skateみたいに凄い速度で画面外に跳ねたり、キャラクターがルフィやダルシムみたいに伸びることが往々にしてありますが、その辺はうまく抑え込まれているのか一度も見ることはありませんでした。

　ボス戦は攻撃パターンを覚え対応していくアクションそのものでトライ＆エラーを要するため、やり応えを感じることができました。アクションが苦手な方だとパターン構築が結構キツイかもしれません。自己修復速度アップの「リペア・アップ」としゃがみ状態で自己修復速度を促進させる「ダッキング・リペア」の組み合わせは、ラスボス戦ですら攻撃の合間を縫ってしゃがみ続けると体力満タン状態を維持できる強スキルです。アクションで進行に詰まる方は優先的に取得すると良いかもしれません。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=932574066

　左腕の義手は瓦礫を塊として集め投擲する以外にも、進行に応じて4つの能力を持ちます。ロック、ジャベリン、ドリル、ブレードの解禁に応じて移動できる範囲は広がりますが、習得後にその都度あちこちのエリアを飛び回らなければならないほど探索が面倒ではない点は好印象でした。ウロウロしていると大体今移動できる範囲はここまでだなということが感じ取れるようになっています。

　キャラクターデザインは初見だと個人的にかなり癖があるなぁと思っていましたが、憎しみの怨嗟に囚われた心が少しずつ変わっていくプロットに乗じて、ゲームが終わる頃には結構好きになっていました。音楽も荒廃した世界の静けさとボス戦の一触即発をよく体現しており、センスの良さを感じます。明示はしないが暗に思わせる話の作り方にも好感を覚えました。

　やや残念なのは、実績周りと再配置および初期化周りに不具合が残っている点です。再現性の確認まではしていませんが、エディットステージでの再配置設定がおかしかったり、開始直後に入力を受け付けなくなる進行不能バグなどが残っている模様。あとレベルエディタもどこに何を配置しているのかが直感的ではないなと思いました。


　アクションとパズル両方にそれなりの適性を求められるため、どちらか片方を期待して買うと意図せぬ足止めを食うかもしれませんが、立ち止まって考えていざアクションとなった時は動ける、静と動の切り分けがしっかりできる大人な貴方にはピッタリのゲームです。ゲームをクリアした後は他のプレイヤーが作ったステージを遊んだり、自分でステージを作成してみたりと製品寿命も長めです。物理演算は微妙な調整に難儀しますが、同時に様々な解法を許容します。試行錯誤から生まれる貴方だけの遊び方を模索してみてください。

author: {'steamid': '76561198075133951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1510684324}
review:
Esse jogo me surpreendeu positivamente.
Muito divertido e desafiador, parabéns pelos criadores, é muito interessante a forma que o jogador precisa interagir com o cenário usando os poderes da personagem para resolver puzzles alguns bastante desafiadores e complexos.

A jogabilidade é muito fluida e os gráficos são bonitos.
A história não é das mais originais, mas é legal.
Só não gostei do sistema de mapas que é muito simples e resumido, e do sistema de batalhas que poderia ter sido mais bem variado, mas como o jogo não explora muito o combate então não é algo que chega a prejudicar o jogo.
É um jogo com personalidade própria, eu recomendo bastante para que curti um jogo com bastante puzzles e habilidades e jogabilidade frenética.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281201213', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1558084301}
review:
游戏整体难度适中，没有难到会导致卡关的地方。整个游戏都是以开辟道路为主，玩家需要利用自身的技能和场景里的物品来对环境进行更改，开辟出通往下一个区域区域的道路。由于游戏的主要成分是开路和跑路，所以没有复杂的战斗系统，战斗的方式类似于拼点，当你手中的石块比敌人身上的石块大时，你就能破坏对方，反之则无法破坏，这样的战斗系统无法单独制造难度，所以战斗也成了开路所必须的一个环节，当你击杀了敌人之后，可以收集敌人掉落的残骸，作为开路所需的道具和对付其他敌人的武器。
整体来说游戏比较有趣，但是某些地方的物体判定很迷，经常因为运气问题落命，这也是最大的不足，除此之外都还不错。
剧情方面，大概是讲了一个[spoiler]“人类和智械发生战争，一个改造人少女为了救一个素不相识的女孩儿而顺便拯救人类的故事（只不过这些智械也是人类罢了……）”[/spoiler]，剧情内容整体来说还是比较单调的，不用报多大期待，体验游戏内容即可。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025141755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1698, 'last_played': 1561693590}
review:
This game was a ton of fun. It's challenging enough to always stay engaging, but rarely frustrating. And the game often doesn't force you to solve the puzzles in a certain way. I know there were a few puzzles that I did not solve the intended way.
It's really also beautiful. I want to take every cutscene image set it as my wallpaper.

There were a few issues I had with it though.
-It's pretty short, and while you can get make and get custom levels from the workshop, there are only a few dozen of them, most of which aren't very interesting.
-The collision physics needs some work. It's way too easy to accidentally fall through an object you didn't mean to, right onto some instadeath spikes.
-You get several powerful abilities, but they're mostly just for platforming and puzzle solving. Even though you can buy skills to let you use them in combat, there's never really a reason to do so, especially against the bosses. Speaking of which...
-The difficulty progression is off. The first boss was a huge challenge, and I died a ton of times before I got the hang of it. But I beat the final boss on my first try, and the last few before that went pretty easily as well. I'm sure part of it was that I didn't know what I was doing as well with the first boss, but I think that more of it was that I was just too powerful by the time I got to the final boss. Against the first boss, you have to avoid pretty much every attack if you want to survive. But by the time you get to the last few bosses, you have a lot more health and you'll be able to heal damage as fast as they can deal it without even really trying.
-The story/writing isn't very engaging. Maybe it's better in Japanese, but the translation really isn't very good.
-The art during the levels always seems a bit odd since the player and the enemies are so much more detailed than everything around them.

But despite my complaints, I do think the game was a lot of fun. I might not ever pick it back up, but I don't regret the time I invested into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981620225', 'num_games_owned': 1630, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1496012101}
review:
I play a lot of 2D platformers, and this is one of the best I've played in recent years. It leans heavily on the standard Metroidvania framework, but the puzzles and abilities you acquire really make it feel like something fresh and unique. The art is great, the boss fights are satisfyingly difficult until you figure out their patterns, and the puzzles are often difficult enough to make you feel accomplished when you solve them without being so difficult or abstract that you run screaming for an FAQ. I could go on, but I think you get the point: there's a lot to like here.

Unfortunately, there are also a few things to be aware of going into it that might affect your enjoyment. First, the English translation is a mess. It's never so bad that you can't understand what they're trying to say, but it's obvious that non-native speakers translated it and the dude listed on the credits as "Translation QA" didn't actually "A" the "Q," which is especially strange given that the game came out in early access initially, so there was plenty of time to have those errors pointed out. If you're like me and grew up in the NES days, when broken English was the standard in video game translations, or if you don't care that much about these things, it's not probably a deal-breaker.

More frustrating was that sometimes--seemingly due to debris being at odd angles--I would land solidly on a platform, but I would just fall through it as if it wasn't something I could stand on or that I'd missed the platform. It didn't come up very often, but most of the times it did, the "non-platform" was over spikes or a bottomless pit. Even though it was rare, the somewhat finicky platforms are something to be aware of.

Overall, though, this was a great game, and the fact it isn't being talked about more is a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127269324', 'num_games_owned': 4893, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1495961871}
review:
战斗部分相当无聊，游戏开始的教学关设计让人无语，明明简单明了可以阐述的操作和技能非要用博士和主角的卖弄句式的对话搞得冗长而无聊。动作游戏强调的是动作而不是解密，这游戏貌似在某种程度上把这层关系搞混了。剧情？动作游戏的剧情对于其本身的好坏占多大比重？对不起，动作过关，特别是横板过关游戏完全不要剧情都没问题，只要战斗爽快酣畅就行了，相当长一段时间我都没搞清魂斗罗和快打旋风或者圆桌武士、惩罚者之类游戏的剧情（当然剧情是有的），又怎么样？完全不影响其经典动作游戏地位，其核心动作过关部分至今为人津津乐道。所以，对于动作游戏玩家来说，这个既不像解密，又不像动作的“游戏”没有丝毫值得推荐之处。
音乐：5/10（存在感较低）
画面：6/10（尚可）
动作：3/10（最大失败）
剧情：5/10（存在感较低）
其他：汉化好评
推荐度：喜欢动作游戏的朋友可以不用入手了，实在有兴趣的话推荐75%off入

author: {'steamid': '76561198153278829', 'num_games_owned': 1906, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1502901222}
review:
6時間ほどプレイしての感想。

道中は物理演算が絡むギミックのパズルステージ。
ボス戦は完全にアクションゲームですね。
ボスはそれぞれ特徴ある攻略でなかなか楽しいです。

私のように頭の固いオジサンは詰まると、全然進めません。
（簡単なギミックに３０分以上悪戦苦闘しました。。。）
また、物理演算が邪魔をしてちょっとした破片等で
正解の行動をしていても、上手く進めないことが多々ありました。
これのせいで正解行動を間違行動いと思い込み、何度もトライすることもあります。
「このパターンさっきやったじゃねーか！」と何度も愚痴りました。
でも解けた時は気持ちぃいい！　の繰り返しですね。

価格は少し高いかなぁと思うので、取り敢えずウィッシュ入れて
セールの時にでも買ったらいいと思います。

＊ボス達カワイイよ！

author: {'steamid': '76561198022989867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1495977188}
review:
ガレキを操る能力を得た少女が過去に行き来しながら敵を倒していくパズルアクションゲーム。

道中はアクション＋パズル。
敵を倒すのもさることながら、ギミックに富んだステージを自身の能力を駆使して解いていく。
ボス戦は結構ガチのアクション。
パターンを覚えるまでは、アクションが得意な人でもかなり厳しい戦闘になる。

アクション面はなかなか面白く仕上がっている。パズル要素も十二分に合って結構歯ごたえがあるものも。ただ物理エンジンとあいまって不確定な部分があり「手順どおりに進めば必ず解ける」とは限らず、ステージによってはなかなかモドカシイ部分もある。ストーリー・設定面もゲームの要素と矛盾なく溶け込んでおり面白い。

個人的にはボリュームも価格相応以上にあり、全体的に上手く仕上がったアクションゲームだと思う。
ただし、あくまでも「アクションゲームにパズル要素がついたもの」であるため、パズルゲームを求めて購入するとボス戦という壁にぶち当たってしまう可能性が高いため、購入に注意が必要だと感じる。

author: {'steamid': '76561198339756451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1574265286}

author: {'steamid': '76561198303815357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1415, 'last_played': 1526954469}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122217709', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1495539592}
review:
花了点时间打穿了游戏，忍不住来写发好评，首先，画风迷之魔性但非常吸引人，虽然女主的炸酱面。。。只能说制作组你很有想法，去学做菜吧。剧情主要是来自未来的机器人侵略人类，由于意外获得了力量的女主临危受命的故事，整体并不俗套，期间穿插着不少悬念，但不知到是表现方式还是文案的关系，剧情的代入感有些弱（不得不吐槽下游戏里关于时空回溯的设定简直如同儿戏，感觉也太随便了点= =），女主拥有收集残骸并将其化为武器的能力，本作有大量的可破坏地形，并且大部分地形具有一定的物理效果，游戏的很多时候都需要用到这一点来解谜，否则连单纯的前进都会变得非常困难，不过除了一些有点玄学的动态解密外，本作的场景谜题难度适中，稍加思索便可解决（其实很多时候你会发现你会在一个地方卡上许久纯粹是因为自己想多了= =比如对着一块奇形怪状的地面思索半天最后解出来其实就是个简单的跷跷板机关。。。），本作总共有四张风格各异的大地图，随着剧情逐渐展开，难度循序渐进（不过还是得说下最终关满屏的钉刺陷阱和悬崖。。。我真的不是在玩洛克人吗。。。），每张地图各有一个特色鲜明的关底BOSS，需要用不同的方法应对，游戏比较贴心的地方在于如果你在一个地方倒下太多次，博士会直接告诉你BOSS的弱点（虽然估计玩家都已经试出来了。。。最终BOSS则同时会使用之前三个BOSS的技能，用相应的办法对付就行），游戏流程中遇到的小怪并不算强力，不过女主受伤后的硬直比较大且无敌时间极短，还是增加了些许难度，总的来说，游戏的战斗部分中规中矩。游戏的收集物品主要是经验石碑和武器图纸两种，武器图纸仅仅改变外形对于流程没有任何帮助，而游戏的技能树能给予的帮助除了血量的提升外几乎看不出什么效果，另外游戏中击败关底BOSS也不会提供任何奖励，初次发现这一点还是比较扫兴的，这应该算是缺点了。
画面（8）：魔性画风＋清爽画质
音乐（8）：总体较为轻快，最后一关的BGM配合场景确实让人感受到了压力
操作（7）：稍显僵硬但适应后问题不大
游戏性（8）：丰富且难度适中的场景谜题+各具特色的BOSS战，开始满世界地找钥匙吧！
总评（8/10)，如果你的脑子和我一样迟钝的话，那么这个游戏足够你消磨几个下午了。
PS：最终BOSS对我使用了掉帧攻击！列景寺丽华打出了GG。
PS2:这个工作室原来是做PM的？！

author: {'steamid': '76561198101001223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1495903884}
review:
一款制作精良的游戏，鲜艳而不夸张的色调，丰富有趣的剧情，与解谜相配的舒缓BGM，游戏性对得起这个价钱，[spoiler]“还有妹子可以Prpr”[/spoiler]

警告，游戏对部分手残党和脑残党不够友好，或者说玩了这个游戏后就发现自己原来是个重度手残加重度脑残ORZ，部分关卡一卡卡半个小时以上是常有的事，这时候就需要你的耐心了，顺便一提，这游戏自带的SL系统非常方便[spoiler]“抖M福音23333”[/spoiler]

一共有8次BOSS战，可以通过这个来估计自己的游戏进度，BOSS刚刚开始打的时候难度是有的，不过所有的BOSS都是靠套路打，所以多SL就没问题了233[spoiler]“LOLI果然易推倒（雾）”[/spoiler]

技能可以全点满，不用怕放心点，如果你在进最终BOSS房前已经探索全地图的话是刚刚好能满上的，不过技能树里面最核心的是增加血量上限233，其他有不少技能都显得有点鸡肋[spoiler]“蹲下回血是神技”[/spoiler][spoiler]“求道迦蓝右下角的某一图可以无限刷技能点，20s不到、两个按键就能刷一次，刷5次就能点一个技能我会乱说？”[/spoiler]

在游戏的过程中留意各种公告牌，能获得各种剧情有关线索，随着游戏的进行敌人的身世、女二的目的等一系列谜团都会解开，这个过程让我非常的享受（这真的是个很好的故事，不骗你）

成就简单，一周目通关后基本就80%以上成就达成，剩下成就也基本能在1小时内拿到，麻麻再也不用担心我的强迫症[spoiler]“因为可以自己编辑关卡来达成成就”[/spoiler]

-------------剧透分割-----------------

[spoiler]“    外祖母悖论？不存在的。233333333
    在不远的未来，世上突然爆发了一种传染性很强的病毒，感染后人的结局就只有在痛苦中死去，这时一个善良的医生（烈景寺丽华）和一个博士（东条）发明了能将人的意识转移到机械身上的办法，这种具有人类的意识的机器人被称为阿基特，然而由于电子大脑会受到身体其他部位的电流影响，阿基特的神智会受冲击变得狂暴，因此和人类怼上了，博士和医生都成了千古罪人，战争陷入胶着。
    为了结束这场战争，阿基特决定回到过去，一方面为了率先统治全人类来改变未来，另一方面是抓住小时候的医生（丽华，女主）并洗脑，让她科技树往战争机器研究上面点；人类军则派了博士的女儿东环回去，为了将女主从阿基特手里救出来，或者说必要的时候杀掉女主来避免阿基特的出现。
------时间线回到游戏上面-----
    东环劫狱救女主，失败被抓走，女主重伤，被一个GAY里GAY气的博士（东条博士的导师）救下来并改造，拥有了对抗阿基特的力量，然后女主为了救被抓走的东环而战斗，在一次次的杀戮轮回后女主终于得知了事件的真相，并击溃了阿基特的首脑结束这场战争
    大概剧情就这样，不过个人有一点纠结的就是最终BOSS到底是不是就是未来的女主，欢迎各路剧情控来探讨[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198144950723', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1495538703}
review:
推荐这款游戏的几个理由
1.语言
对于国区玩家来说，刨除其他因素而言，语言绝对是一个游戏很重要的门槛。而在这点上，GIGA WRECKER提供了流畅的简体中文语言，比起其他没有提供简体中文或者使用不经润色的机翻中文来说，这是个相当良心的服务。
2.游戏性
2D的横版动作游戏，容易上手，各种奇特的能力组成了解谜、战斗、跑酷三合一的游戏类型。而某些解谜点并非仅有唯一解决方法也大大扩充了玩家的思路。本身主线流程中等，但是自带了关卡编辑器可以自行编辑或者去创意工坊下载其他玩家的地图，大大延长了游戏可玩性。
3.剧情
稍稍卖了些关子的剧情，虽然谈不上跌宕起伏，但也却一波三折，真相往往比你想象中的要简单却真实。
4.画面
独特而又色彩分明的动画系，给人眼前一亮的感觉。
5.价格
68元的价格并不算贵，如果加上打折可以说是相当值得入手的一款游戏。
[spoiler]6.教育性[/spoiler]
[spoiler] 先不谈那充满哲学和人性的剧情和主题，打完这个游戏之后我满脑子都是简单的几何学和简单的物理学，相信玩过这个游戏之后一定会对你的理科成绩有所提升。[/spoiler]
综上所述，这是一款非常值得入手的一款2D解谜战斗游戏。
[spoiler] 另外说个小技巧，下蹲回血的快速回复技能和增加标枪数量的多重标枪技能是战斗和解谜的关键技能。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198160320827', 'num_games_owned': 4085, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1498240388}
review:
[h1]彼女の左腕に宿ったのは――
瓦礫を操る万能の力だった[/h1]

全実績解除したのでレビュー

パズル：アクション
6：4ぐらい？

一番初めのボスの倒し方が分からず
[b]何度か死んだところで攻略のヒントを貰えました[/b]
この辺りは日本製のやさしさですね

道中のパズル要素は手順をきちんと踏めばそれなりに
スキルの構成によっては、[b]分からなくてもゴリ押しで攻略可能[/b]な場所も

ボスは[b]攻撃のパターンが決まっている[/b]ので
それを覚えてしまえば楽に倒せるし
（覚えるまでに何回か死ぬ）

これまたスキルの構成によっては、
[b]ダメージよりも自分の回復力が上回ったり[/b]しちゃう。

[spoiler]結局はスキルがものを言うゲームだってこと[/spoiler]

実績もそれほど難しいものはありませんし
セールをしている今のうちに買っても損はないと思います

なにより、[b]簡単にやり直せる[/b]のが一番の利点
少し運要素が絡んでしまう部分もあるけれど、
ひたすら繰り返せばなんとかなる。はず

状況の記録や実績解除のお知らせが、
[b]主に『扉をくぐるとき』[/b]なので

いいところまでパズル攻略が進んでいて、
そこから再挑戦できるようにしたいなら
[b]一旦引き返して扉をくぐるべし[/b]

これで少しは攻略が楽になるかも

author: {'steamid': '76561198010607057', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1495354584}
review:
뭔가 물리적이고 퍼즐적이여서 사봤는 데 좀 실망했음

포탈이랑 비교한다고 하면

포탈은 쭉쭉쭉쭉 가는 길을 계속 가는데

이 게임은 앞으로 가다가 갑자기 막힌길 나옴 문여는 열쇠하나주고

문은 또 이제까지왔던길 역주행해서 반대로 가야되네

순간이동 할 수 있긴한데

차라리 그냥 순간이동도 없에고 뒤로도 안오면 안됨?

왔던 맵을 다시 찾아야할 이유가 있긴 한걸까 라는 생각이 들었음

길찾기는 하프2만큼이나 어려움

자세히 보고 가면 뭐 찾을 수 있다지만

길 못찾아서 30분동안 헤매다가 유튜브 공략봤음

퍼즐 보다 더어려웠음 솔직히 머리 제일 많이 쓴듯

보스는 또 왜케 어려운지 공략법도 없이 그냥 가서 일단 죽음

아니 어떤 멍청이가 상대방 능력도 모르고 아무것도 모르는데

1대1 맞다이 뜹니까

죽는 것도 경험이다 라는 배터리온라인 생각나게하네 또

한 3번 정도 알지도 모르고 어버버하고 죽으면

이제 공략 알려주는데

솔직히 3번 죽다가 알아낸거 말해줌

약올리세요?

그래서 한 5트라이 하다보면 또 딸피 신 패턴 나오는데

그거에 또 강간당함

그럼 또 풀피로 시작 앙 기모띠 오졌띠

트라이 계속하다보면 내가 퍼즐겜을 하는지 액션을 하는지 모르게됨

누가 도대체 모르는 패턴에 강간당하는 걸 좋아한다고 생각하는 겁니까

언제 무적패턴이고 또 언제는 반격가능하고 규칙도 없고 자기 맘대로에

저는 비추천인데

author: {'steamid': '76561197963963585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1495330289}
review:
<1 Hour Later>

- The localization is painful, the words can read but it takes some used to
- Some of the hitboxes/colliders don't react predictably, sometimes registering a "hit" with the player for no apparent reason and others missing it entirely 
- The soundtrack is really mellow, which if the combat element didn't feature so prominently would be much more fitting
- The physics component is well done for the most part, although I've already experienced issues where the direction I'm facing influences the speed of certain objects making precise positioning needlessly difficult
- The exposition dump is really condensed and jumps straight into terms and structure unique to the game world rather than slowly introducing you to one element at a time and building it up. It reads likea list of bullet points being read to you by someone offscreen

It feels like an attempt at a mix of Kill La Kill, Megaman and a physics based platformer, and so far it's reasonably successful. However the game mechanics and script don't seem to mesh as cleanly as they should for me.

<1.1 Hours Later>

Just ALT-F4'd.
There's no reason that the camera cannot follow the character and keep a functional distance at all times. After realizing that I had neglected to go to a save point (which considering the open world feel and that this game does not appear to be attempting to be a rogue-like makes NO sense) I died because the camera got up close to the character and didn't show me that there was an enemy directly below me. I dropped down and got juggled to death. There are "zones" or areas of the map that will cause the camera to draw closer or farther away from the character, and since the camera isn't locked to the character's horizontal movement this actually becomes nauseating. 

This basic design flaw both questions and answers so much about Game Freak.

review:
ストーリー、デザインは悪くない
ボス戦のアクション性も楽しい

ただ、道中のアクションパズル要素が中途半端でいただけない
ちゃんとした解き方を要求している作りの割には物理演算が邪魔をする
小さな欠片が足場の上に降り積もってブロックを置けなかったり、バウンドさせるボールが悪さをしたりがそこかしこで発生
また、ワンジャンプの最中にブレードを振ってワイヤーを切断するようなタイミング重視の解き方も目立つ
操作に慣れていてもこれは辛いし、謎解きに集中したいのに敵の配置が鬱陶しい箇所も多い
また、針山で簡単に死んでリトライを繰り返すデザインの割に道中の会話パートを何度も何度も読まなきゃならないなど
細かい部分で不親切さが目立つ

ゲームフリーク社内の制度で若手が作ったようなことを聞いたが、そのあたりから来るものだろう
雰囲気は大変良く、発想も良い　何度もボス戦で倒れていると攻略のヒントが聞けたりするなど救済措置はある
それゆえにパズル面で粗が目立つのが惜しい　こちらはいくら悩んでもヒントの開示は無い
２時間でクリアした方もいらっしゃるようだが、私は３時間遊んでボス２体クリアがやっとである
これからもじっくり楽しむとしよう･･･

review:
Ugh, This game looked so fun. And when it got a good sale, I was pretty excited to get it. But my excitement deflated pretty quickly. 

The core idea here is interesting, but it's not handled well.  Very simple puzzles are ruined by the chaos of the physics engine. I had to do puzzles several times, in the tutorial section no less, because objects didn't fall right. I loathe to think of how frustrating the future puzzles would be.

It's surprising how much the characters talk, and yet how little they actually say. The music was... passable, I suppose. And, the art is nice. That's about the one thing they got right. If they got a better writer, this would be a cool anime, maybe. Pretty boring game, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972364092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1499106966}
review:
Giga Wrecker is a 2D action puzzle platformer. You play as a young girl called Reika, who has been transformed into a cyborg and now battles the robots that have successfully defeated mankind. The puzzles consist of box physics, lasers and the ususal spikes and pits. You can destroy or cut parts of the level to solve the puzzles. The action comes from the robots that you encounter in the levels and the bosses you must defeat. Bosses each have their own pattern and stages and take a few tries to learn. The story is told through dialog text during the level and every once in a while there is a still art cut scene.

Graphics and sound are good and I personally quite like the art style. Controls are okay, but can also be remapped if necessary. If you have a different aspect ratio than 16:9 you may get some display artefacts. 1920x1200 has black bars that aren't cleared and show whatever part of the Steam overlay was last drawn over them.

The game offers three save slots and you need to expicitly save at save points dotted around the map. After death the game will however restore you at the last door, teleporter or warp point, so you really never need to reload during play.

I do have a few gripes with the gameplay. The biggest problem is the floaty or slippery platforming. This will get you killed often as Reika will slide off platforms you squarly hit and drop into spikes or into a pit. Wobbly blocks sometimes make this worse. Add to that the knockback and the very short invulnerability after being hit and boss fights quickly turn frustrating. I feel that tighter platforming would have made this game a lot better.

Despite its flaws I do recommend Giga Wrecker. If you can deal with grinding the bosses until you get the pattern (and get better at the game in the process) then you will find a satisfying little platformer that rewards the persistent player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062404482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1491864443}
review:
This game definetly deserves more love from the community.

Giga Wrecker is a PC exclusive indie game from GameFreak (you know, the dudes that Nintendo enslaved 20 years ago to do Pokèmon) and god damn is it good.

It's basically a metroid-vania 2D platformer except it's not retro style and has very curious mechanics. To me, it feels like playing a sidescrolling version of Portal since you have to solve puzzles with abilities and such.
The plot is very interesting, sometimes weird and makes you question your motives throughout the game, while you're being carried around by a sweet soundtrack that is very fitting.

The art style is lovely, a bit "edgy" but considering the whole mecha theme it fits perfectly. It's a pity some aspects have been forgotten, like mono-dimensional sprites, but those are just minor things that could've made the game a bit more polished.

It's not a hard game, the mechanics are a bit unforgiving tho.
The platforms are a bit wanky when not 100% horizontal, you get easily punished if you abuse your abilities, sometimes when you get hit you lose track of the character because the backgrounds are very colourful, the knockback is outrageous and 90% of the time makes you fall to your death to bottomless pits or spikes and the absurd amount of debris that comes out from broken objects is a double-edged sword. It can help you solve puzzles in a non conventional way or can completely screw you up (fortunately every puzzle has a reset pad). 

In the end you're always happy after completion and you never feel frustrated after completing a sector. And if you haven't completed it 100% you can go back at whatever point to find unlockables or get achievements.

I highly recommend it if you love the genre and a fluent platformer with a bit of challenge

author: {'steamid': '76561198008962715', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1488686592}
review:
Giga Wrecker is a [i][b]very pretty[/b][/i] but very run-of-the-mill puzzle platformer with most everything being forgetable besides the artstyle and boss fights.  7/10 Average for its type, with several nice things.


[u]Graphics:[/u]
I'm going to get the gush out of the way first.  I am severly biased here, as the game's artist, ASGR (aka Asagiri), is one of my top favorite artists in the world and has been for several years. Its no exaggeration to say his art speaks to me. I was downtroden, as over the last year I thought he had dropped off the face of the earth. Low and behold this past February I learned that he had spent that time working on this game.  And hoh boy was it worth it.  I can say I bought this game full price solely for the beautiful artstyle, nothing else included.

So yes, I am very biased in that case, but I tried to look at everything else with a keen eye.

Game looks fantastic at 1080p, everything is drawn very very crisp and there are no upscaling problems; in fact some textures are so high resolution that you get some downscaling pixelation, especially on the player character's sprite when the camera zooms out a lot.  The artstyle is pretty damn strong, and the game screenshots speak for themselves.  The animation is also very fluid and never breaks that artstyle even with its fluidity.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=858914194

Camera is automatically adjusted to provide the best cinematic and puzzle solving experience.  When a puzzle calls for you needing to see the entire area, the camera pans out to do that.  When the game wants you to focus on a specific aspect of the puzzle when you walk into that area, the game does that.  When the game wants to show you some fantastic bit of background to build ambiance, the game does that too!  Its great in those situations, but annoying in others. Sometimes the camera moves unnaturally and too quickly; the panning and zooming when you walk between areas can cause motion sickness, so be wary if you're sensitive to that stuff.

One interesting and unexpected addon to the game are cosmetics for the abilities you gain throughout the game.  Some look awesome, some are nostalgic, and others are just plain funny.  Its a fun addition to the game and definitely helps build some love for it.


[u]Sound:[/u]
Soundtrack is good, but its really repetitive so it might get on your nerves after a while. Given a lot of puzzles take you some time to complete, it won't take you long to realize how short the music loops are.

Sound effects themselves are spot on and really bring the game to life more than you'd think.  I think its the second strongest feature of the game behind the artstyle and presentation itself.

Voice acting is a nice feature and gives personality to various foes you fight, but you'll notice that they resampled quite a few a few voices on the bosses.


[u]Gameplay:[/u]
The game looks amazing, but take away the art and there really isn't much you haven't seen before.

I used an xbox360 controller when playing this game and for the most part it controls fine. Area doors are annoying though, because the same button to attack up is the same button to open a door.

The gameplay boils down to something kind of like a metroidvania and physics puzzle platformer combined, whereas you gain new abilities as you progress through the game and unlock new puzzles with those abilities. Complete more puzzles to progress, and every once in a while there is a boss fight. Unlike a metroidvania the game has next to no optional backtracking, although there are optional areas and puzzles.  There are some RPG elements thrown in that let you upgrade your existing abilities and add on to their capabilities.  An unusual mix of gameplay elements, but again nothing you haven't seen before.

So yeah, ironically the boss fights in this game are better than the core puzzle gameplay. That's my personal opinion, but I felt much less frustration and had a lot more fun on them rather than the puzzles themselves, I explain below.

The Boss fights are the funnest, best designed parts of this game. The major downside to some is that all the boss fights are entirely scripted rather than reactive, so most of the difficulty revolves around timing and memorizing the patterns.  Also, at first many of the boss earlier fight mechanics are never revealed to you until you die several times, at which point the game will give you a necessary hint.  Later boss fights also never tell you that they randomly borrow from the mechanics learned in other boss fights and other parts of the game, so keep an eye out and react instinctually.

More than often not you'll find yourself fighting the physics of the game rather than elegantly using it to your advantage. A lot of puzzles are very frustrating and there were a handful I felt like I had to "cheat" my way through rather than take the intended path (note by cheat I mean complete the puzzle in a way that the developers obviously didn't intend). Another handful of puzzles felt like I only completed them from sheer luck. That hints at some bad puzzle design. You can't stop all the exploits, but when its so unclear how to solve them such that the player resorts to unintentional methods or game exploits to progress, that is a problem.  That said, there were some very fun puzzles as well.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=870228994


[u]Plot / Story / World:[/u]
This is the weakest part of the game.  There are times when you'll feel a twinge for the players as you read their dialogue, but its super super freaking cliche and is on the whole unbelievable, even when you consider it from within its own  ridiculous bubble.  If you have encountered much eastern scifi or post-apocalyptic stuff before ([spoiler]or any time travel[/spoiler]), then you'll see everything coming from a mile off.  The game doesn't try to be anything but simple in nature, but its annoyingly simple and very tropey (and not in a good way).  There is little to no satisfaction (comparably to the other features of the game) in progressing to see the plot unfold, since there is barely any there to sustain the player and what is there is so utterly cliche, predictable, and tropey.

That's not to say the characters aren't interesting; many of the bosses are so cool looking.  All I'm saying is that more than likely most of your love from the characters will come from the character designs and actions taken in battle, rather than the dialogue or plot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047436117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1488506875}
review:
Giga Wrecker is a puzzle/plateformer game with an anime art style that take place in a post apocolyptic planet. The character you play as has the ability to manipulate debris from enemies she kills and from rock formations she can destroy. The debris you collect is used as your main weapon and it has increased utility the more you collect. 

To begin with the combat in the game is very simplistic yet satisfying. Your attacks can be used to solve puzzles and destroy enemies. While satisfying the game does have a lack of enemy variety as there are only a handful of enemy types with single move sets. This however is not the main aspect of the game as the puzzles are what make up the core parts of the game. The only area where the combat truly excels is the boss fights. The bosses have multiple movesets and attacks which make them alot of fun to face even if you're not to great at platformers.

The puzzles in the game are quite easy to solve but are unique in their nature do to the debris ability the game gives you. Most of your time in game will be solving these puzzles and trying to find the unfortunately limited amount of collectable items. The puzzles can either be fun to solve or become a nightmare do to the sometimes wonky physics engine. You may very well know the solution to a puzzle but executing it properly is finicky sometimes. 

The game has a leveling system which is very 1-dimensional as the upgrades you get for them are uninspired. These upgrades  range from more health to extra weapon damage and range.

Finally, the game's story is nothing special as it is filled with common tropes and bland characters. I'm not going to go into the specifics as to not spoil anything. The story is atleast entertaining as for most of the game there is an element of mystery. The overall story is soft-hearted with some dark elements thrown in. If I could describe the story's appeal in 1 word, it would be "cute". The character designs also reflect that description. 

Overall I think Giga Wrecker is a fun casual game that you will enjoy if you like cute characters and satisfying puzzle/platformer gameplay. It was enough to entertain me for around 18 hours with screwing around with the level creator and gameplay elements.

review:
Reminds me so much of the Megaman series, except the puzzles are like 300% harder. Longest i have ever taken was 1 hour and it was the worst and best 1 hour. Would 5/10 do another hard af puzzle.

Of course, this game is nearly perfect, if it wasnt for the fact that the entire game feels like an ice stage. The character sliders across the screen when im trying to balance myself on a pillar.

Boss designs? Absolutely badass. Wish i took a screenshot of the first one but got too engrossed on trying to figure out her patterns... Come to think of it i also forgot to do it with the second one. If any of you kind peeps could get one for me..? Or is there a gallery somewhere?

Soundtrack? Really catchy and endearing. 10/10 would buy the OST once i get the money to do so.

Other complaints other than ice level level movement? Maybe sometimes the screen zooms out way too much but i guess its for visibility so i can't really call that a valid complaint.

Would i recommend it? Yeah sure, go for it! As expected of GAME FREAK, this game is really fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107841643', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1491730281}
review:
I'd never expect the developers responsible for Pokemon to create a platformer this good. You would have expected that when developers like this hit big they would bask in their glory and spend their days relaxing and enjoying their fame and millions but noooo, Gamefreak HAD to make their own original game, just so that we could shut our mouths up for thinking that they were licking Nintendo's balls the whole time. And I'm glad they did, since this game turned out absolutely awesome.

Pros:
- Cute and awesome artwork
- Adorable voice effects and music
- Interesting and fun game mechanics
- Challenging; you won't drop this one in a while
- Level editor
- Robot waifus

Cons:
- The art is a bit too sharp for the game; takes some time getting used to
- Default keyboard configurations are messed up, a controller is recommended
- Somewhat awkward english

I believe that this game is 100% worth the money. It is enjoyable for both casual players and hardcore completionists. Good job Gamefreak for not disappointing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130657097', 'num_games_owned': 1850, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1487757202}
review:
[h1]GIGA WRECKER[/h1]

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]

GIGA WRECKER is a 2D action adventure from [b]Gamefreak[/b] who made the Pokemon games which puts you in the shoes of [b]Reika[/b], a girl who is held prisoner in a world that was suddenly overtook by robots in a similar fashion like a zombie outbreak. The story is told through static cutscenes with dialogues and is very clichéd. Right from the nature of a post apocalyptic world to the way the story progresses slowly, it is a typical anime styled story which might be enjoyed by the fans of the genre.

 Reika finds herself being freed by a strange girl who in turn wants to kill her to save humanity and in the process rips off her arm. Reika is then saved by a professor who proceeds to replace her arm with a mechanical arm which is called the [b]ARCHE[/b] which helps her to collect scraps of metal around her and then mold them into a giant ball to wreck other stuff. There are typos in the English translation and that might take out some immersion from the story. Now, onto the gameplay:

GIGA WRECKER strikes a perfect balance between Puzzle and action and looks cool while doing so. The game features some really neat physics based puzzles that vary in their difficulty. While the puzzles are good, they are not overdone to death and always have a couple of exciting battle scenarios between them to beat the monotonous puzzle solving. You can say the same for the battle parts which are broken by a couple of puzzles between them. That makes you keep invested in the game and it never feels too repetitive in that regard. 

In GIGA WRECKER you have the ability to wreck stuff and mold the remaining scraps to form one giant metal ball which can help you in your future endeavours. This ball can grow to more than over twice your size and it is always fun to hit a robot with a giant metal ball which is made out of the remains of its own brethren. Aside from this, you also get other weapons and a skill tree where you can upgrade various skills of Reika by collecting nano machines which are found in various wreckages through the journey. 

The game is quite heavy on destruction given its title and there are times where you can solve a puzzle by just wrecking random stuff. There is also a neat mechanic in place which lets you rectify your mistakes in case you made some mistake and wrecked something you shouldn’t have. While the destruction is not as organic as say, [b]Broforce[/b], it is still really fun to just wreck through various platforms and kill some robots. 

There are some problems present with the physics based puzzles in the game and the hit detection which sometimes failed to register my hits on the opponent. For more replayability, there is also a Level Editor available which is pretty easy to learn and use. There are minor nitpicks but overall it is quite a fun platformer. 

[h1]Visuals[/h1]

Visually GIGA WRECKER is stunning. The backdrops to the battles are gorgeous and have an almost organic feel to them. The levels, enemies and bosses are all very well detailed and the game is very vibrant in nature. Overall GIGA WRECKER has a solid visual quality. 

[h1]Sound[/h1]

It’s Gamefreak. You should expect something above average at least and the game delivers on those. The game has a relaxed soundtrack throughout most of the levels which helps you keep your head on the puzzles while it increases the tempo up a notch while fighting bosses which is enough to make you keep trying against some really difficult bosses.

[h1]Overall[/h1]

If you like 2D action platformers with puzzle elements mixed in them, you can’t go wrong with GIGA WRECKER. It does not feature a deep story but it has enough to keep you invested and the gameplay is solid and fun to say the least. If you are craving for a solid action puzzle platformer, give GIGA WRECKER a try and you won’t regret it. 

[h1]Rating : 80/100 [/h1]

This review was brought to you by [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ReviewExperts/]Review Experts[/url] through the generous contribution of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/danielbink/]Daniël - REX ♥ Gaming[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198131507005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1517897574}
review:
The Pros:
The overall concept is unique, abilities are fun to play around with, the physics based puzzled are challenging and progress in a smooth diffculty curve.  The controls are responsive and the soundtrack is wonderful.  Some very unique ideas in terms of how abilties and resources interact and overall, the mechanics are wonderfully executed.  The animation is smooth and the visual effects are appreciable eye candy.  The Level buIlding and publishing features are a nice add for extra challenge proven by some very devious minds out there.

The Cons:
Artwork is hit or miss, either you'll like the style or you won't.  The dialogue atleast in English is a bit poorly translated and doesn't come across naturally, could use some work.  The story can be a bit weak at times, but does eventually muddle itself along to begin to grow on you.   Combat is somewhat lacking and lackluster, the enemy designs hold more potential then was actually given to them.  Obvious corner cutting in sprites, for instance left vs right facing is the same sprite flipped.  The writing seems to be the developers greatest weakness and is the main detractor for this title.

Overall:
The gameplay and challenge themselves are well worth the money, so long as you don't mind the weak aesthetics.  Honestly, if the developer hires a new writing team, this is a sequal worthy title.  If you're looking for a unique challenge that tries both your brain and your reflexes then I do reccommend getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053099637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1487597963}
review: I cannot recommend this game.  The hit detection is far from polished, and a lot of damage i took felt cheap.  I would jump over an enemy clearly above his character model, and i would proceed to hit an invisible hit box taking damage which lead to a frustrating demise.  The puzzles were simple in principle yet executing them is another matter entirely.  all too often i found that the physics objects i needed to remain individual components would form together into one collective mass causing me to have to reset the puzzle.  This inconsistency caused me great frustration as it felt like instead of being able to solve the simple puzzles and moving on to something more fun i was held back do to the finicky mechanics.  The art style, music, and story however were appealing to me from what i played.  The implementation of tutorial mechanics within the story text was cumbersome and some what redundant.  I would have like to seen the instructions be placed outside of the story telling so i did not feel like i would miss something if i decided to skip a section of instruction i already figured out.  Simply unpolished, and frustrating in summary.  will be refunding.

固锁刀刃标枪冲钻  一个比一个有趣  各种关卡莫名其妙莽过去也是因为它们
BOSS战集解密和动作一体  非常棒  比道中各种解密有趣多了
难度还是比较适宜  然而因为某个技能点出来之后  我就有些不知道我和对方谁是BOSS了
对  提到技能  别的随便点  我就讲三个全游戏我觉得不得不点的技能
第一个是下蹲稳定固锁  这技能必点  站着放固锁扔出去瞎杰宝跑很难受
第二个是下蹲回血  怎么又是下蹲  这技能各种方面相当实用  平常道中磕磕碰碰掉血要回起来要很久  说实在的作为一个解密游戏等回血花去大半时间我是拒绝的  有了下蹲回血之后速度飞快
然而这不是这技能的核心特点  核心在于配合部分小的回血技能  这玩意甚至能达到下蹲接近半秒回一血的疯狂速度  
其效果就是蹲着看BOSS放技能  十万个技能砸完自己还是满血
第三个就是三连标枪  实用性还不错  算是锦上添花
有些地方的高墙似乎只有用多重标枪才能爬上去（我之所以用似乎是因为不用多重标枪也是可以的具体方法就不告诉你们）
然而更无可代替的部分还是能够头尾相接连续戳标枪  
（然而我基本是打到快完才发现这技能有这作用  也就是说全程我也基本没用到这玩意 具体实用度多少我也不知道）
再就是想聊聊根源能力
嗯根源啊  FZ里时臣要将七个servent献祭给圣杯才达到的那个根源啊
月世界魔术师追求的魔术的终点啊
我拿到第一个根源能力的时候满心欢喜在想这是怎样牛逼哄哄的东西啊
然后你™告诉我这就是个武器皮肤？
（好了好了你的不满我们收到了下一个）
咳咳画风很有趣  说真的很有趣  阿基特是好文明[spoiler]（说起来主角啊黑化女二啊BOSS都挺好看  道中小怪怎么一个个丑得要死）[/spoiler]
最后说剧情的话  [spoiler]时间悖论什么的就让我们一句el psy congroo忽悠过去好了
回溯时间化敌为友没啥问题  问题是主角打完一套军体拳嘴炮都不来一发对面就乖乖从良了是什么鬼
从良就算了还要卖自己老上司  你们这群人说翻脸就翻脸啊  阿基特是坏文明
以及照道中化敌为友的逻辑  最后那大BOSS似乎完全没有跟她对掐的意义吧
有什么好说的  当然是选择原谅她啊
然后我们的女主就一套军体拳劈头盖脸打死了……
玩哪出  还是说我没有打出别的结局吗[/spoiler]
总体就是这么多  总而言之是非常有趣非常好看的游戏  我度过了非常开心的16小时  非常感谢制作方

author: {'steamid': '76561198004204928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1499419347}
review:
물리엔진이 적용된 퍼즐게임에는 장단점이 있습니다.
장점은 어찌저찌 머리를 굴리면 꼭 개발자가 정해놓은 답이 아니어도 퍼즐을 풀 수 있다는 거고
단점은 대개 그놈의 물리엔진이 암세포를 암에 걸리게 만들어 준다는 것입니다.


본론으로 들어가자면 기가 레커는 액션보다는 퍼즐이 주가 되는 게임입니다.

넓은 맵에서 새로운 능력을 얻고 퍼즐을 풀어서 진행하면서 숨겨진 아이템도 겸사겸사 모은다는 점에서는 메트로바니아로 봐 줄 수도 있겠군요.
수집요소라 해봤자 일종의 스킨인 설계도나 노가다를 대폭 줄여주는 스킬포인트 정도라 애매하지만.

기가 레커라는 제목값을 하듯이 잔해들을 부숴서 길을 만들거나 적을 처치하며 막히면 그 구간만 다시 되돌려서 계속 시도할 수도 있습니다.
암 걸리는 부분이 없잖아 있긴 그런대로 봐줄만한 난이도입니다.

특히나 퍼즐 시스템을 보스전에 잘 녹여낸 건 정말 높은 평가를 주고 싶습니다.

액션만 잡는답시고 닥치고 공격만 하다보면 어느새 클리어라던가
퍼즐만 잡는답시고 퍼즐 몇 개 풀어주면 보스전 클리어라던가

퍼즐 액션을 표방하는 게임의 보스전은 대개 저 둘 중 하나로 치우치게 마련인데
난이도도 너무 쉽지도 않고 어렵지도 않지만 일단 죽으면서 패턴을 파악하다 보면 깰 수 있다.
그야말로 플랫포머 액션 게임의 꽃 아니겠습니까.

몇 번 죽으면 그제서야 힌트를 주고 그 상태에서 몇 번 더 죽으면 이번엔 기다렸다는 듯이 타박을 주는 걸 보면서 기분이 요상했지만.

약간 엉성해 보이는 모션이라던가 화면의 효과 때문에 지저분해보인다던가 위에 적은 물리엔진 같은 게 마음에 안 들긴 하지만
매력적인 게임임에는 틀림 없습니다.

무엇보다도 개성적인 디자인. 특히 보스들 디자인이 심금을 울리는군요.
강한 로봇... 왜곡된 여성...
정말 바람직한 디자인이자 최대의 장점입니다.

review:
终于通关了，某些关卡不是一般的充满怨念。。很喜欢这个游戏的画风，可惜一路上除了科学家大叔就没别的男主角了。

缺点：结尾比较仓促，BOSS才说了10句左右就结尾了！。。然后就是百合的美好未来了（有没有搞错这么没存在感的BOSS），结局算是治愈型的
还是比较推荐入的，68元还算值吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198265384903', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1584287310}
review:
从微博看到后，发售那天直接就买了
游戏是挺好玩的，故事也不错，目前玩到开启三大区块大门，准备暴揍大boss。
不得不令人吐槽的是解谜板块，解谜是挺有趣的，但是有的太古怪，太恶心人了，硬是想了大半天才解出来。
boss战就有点无趣，因为全是规律性的攻击，多死几次就完全掌握套路了。
总的来说算是个好游戏，就是解谜有点摧残大脑，物理性解谜是真的烦。

review: 整个游戏充满了探索，解密，以及格斗的乐趣。是一款剧情很丰富的横版。画风也比较清新，是我喜欢的类型。有时候一个机关能让你纠结好久，最后思考出解决办法的成就感是不言而喻的。昨天心血来潮想着买一款横版过关的格斗游戏来回味，结果发现自己沉迷这个游戏的解密无法自拔，一口气从1点玩到了5点，总得来说这个游戏从画面到剧情解密上都很值得这个价钱。推荐用手柄玩，能获得更好的游戏体验。

author: {'steamid': '76561198272820661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1487061783}
review:
GIGA WRECKER是一款2D橫向的解迷遊戲
遊戲中須要使用不同武器來破壞岩石等的地型 物品來幫助自己過關
而遊戲中也包含戰鬥 升技能 等元素

優點：
1.雖然只有簡體 但都是中文化
2.關卡設計難度適中
3.解迷的方式不會限死一種
4.可以自制關卡

缺點：
1.Boss攻擊方式幾本上是有次序
令Boss戰非常沉悶

2.拿方塊最後的外觀時
必須把標槍技能升至同時存在+2
如果跟我一樣不想升技的
基本上想把遊戲100%完成是不可能

評分：8/10

只要改改Boss 和最後方塊必須升技
在我心中必定是神作
現在只在佳作程度

author: {'steamid': '76561198314325692', 'num_games_owned': 1606, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1098, 'last_played': 1496570543}
review:
先说一下买游戏的理由吧 很简单 就是因为这个画风很喜欢 喜欢的不得了就入了
第一游玩的感觉不太好 是动作类解密游戏 我感觉真的很烧脑细胞 的确不熟悉操作 让人十分挫败
但是偶然在朋友一同游玩下 感受到了这个游戏的魅力所在 这个游戏的难度基本一小关在你感觉过不去的时候就能找到过去的方法 虽然这个说法很奇怪 但是这就是我的游戏体验
一开始感觉无解的boss 只要观察就会变得非常简单 有点像洛克人的boss战在过不去还有提示 
的确是有难度的 但是等级的系统很好的给予像我这个手残很大空间的容错率 过不去的话 建议先刷级
玩到现在已经感觉的通关了 所以我也不建议大家看什么攻略视频 个人感觉这个游戏只有第一次通关的乐趣所在 看了是极大的消耗这个乐趣吧
难度需要你去适应这个游戏 所以前面会很难度 后面在有了等级之后 基本就是靠解密了 我感觉难是难 但是没有难到没有办法玩 通关会有成就感 不过过不去的时候 的确会有点冒火
认为自己手残可以入 不过可能需要刷级 认为自己没有耐心就不要入了 因为还是有点消耗脑力的
个人玩到后面 为玩这个游戏感到爽快都有点不忍心玩通关了流程应该不算很长 游戏的地图编辑器已经放出 玩家可以自制地图上传到创意工坊 这个我还没有体验过 打算等到全成就之后在考虑
PS：通关之后居然没有画廊 好伤心啊 流程真的不长

author: {'steamid': '76561198063349227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1486823987}
review:
Giga Wrecker, l’ultimo lavoro auto-pubblicato di Game Freak, stupisce sicuramente in positivo. Il team giapponese ha creato dal nulla una nuova IP dal grandissimo potenziale (e non priva di storture), un puzzle platform dal design sia estetico sia meccanico quasi ineccepibile che strizza l’occhio nello stesso tempo agli amanti del ragionamento e dei combattimenti impegnativi. Affinché lo si possa gustare appieno, però, serve una pazienza non indifferente. Non si tratta di un prodotto dedicato ai giocatori della domenica o ai deboli di cuore. Giga Wrecker è una vera sfida senza se e senza ma. Se vi piacciono i giochi che si completano da soli vi consigliamo di girare al largo. In caso contrario, fatevi sotto.

Link alla recensione completa: http://www.nrsgamers.it/recensione-giga-wrecker/

author: {'steamid': '76561198117305421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1554997098}
review:
完走した感想です
BGM、キャラデザ、ストーリー、申し分ないがアクションに難あり。
一部のパズルが異様に難しく(個人の頭の出来もあるだろうが)それらのパズルがクリアできたのはまぐれか、正攻法ではない方法で無理やり進めたことがほとんど。
ボス戦は死に覚えの程よい難易度と無理ゲーの中間といったところで、一部のボスはコントローラーを投げたくなるほど難しかった。
アルケー能力という、集めたガレキからブロックや剣などを作り出すギミックがあるが、これがボス戦で全く活かされないのは如何なものか。
全体を通しての感想は、パズルとバトルというアクションが分離していて、どうにもうまく混ざれていないように思えた、オススメはできるけど結構ハードコアなゲームだ

author: {'steamid': '76561198340985068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1486911006}
review:
相當不錯的2D橫向動作解謎遊戲
我的全破時間：22小時(僅供參考)

遊戲中主角可以操控奈米碎片當成純粹的武器攻擊，也可以將碎片形成劍(blade)、標槍(javelin)、方塊(lock)、鑽頭(drill)，各自有不同的功用。

遊戲中雖然有敵人、BOSS要打，但是大多數的關卡都是在解謎，除了必須利用上述的武器之外，多數機關都需要應用物理、力學原理來破解。死亡或是發現自己把必要的場地道具打爛了也不用擔心XD Giga wrecker可以重複接關。

剛看到遊戲畫面時可能很多人都會被花花綠綠的遊戲色調嚇到，但實際玩過之後我眼睛不怎麼痠，背景顏色也不會影響遊戲體驗，但這種事情見仁見智，想買的人還是自已評估。

Boss戰我個人認為在2D橫向動作遊戲中算簡單的，一個Boss我打半小時大概都能破。

遊戲也提供玩家自己設計、上傳關卡的功能，並可以在遊戲中下載其他人製作的關卡，如果未來形成了強大的玩家社群，這款遊戲的耐玩性可望獲得進一步提升。

遊戲劇情不錯，這邊就不劇透了

遊戲整體難度適中，不熟悉2D橫向動作遊戲的新手玩家可以放心入手。

另外，我建議使用遊戲搖桿，這遊戲用鍵盤有點難操控

author: {'steamid': '76561198214418671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1065, 'last_played': 1575726660}
review:
ストーリーをクリアしたので感想を。

とっても面白かった。続編出てほしい。100％買う。

ストーリーはター○ネー○ー他SF作品のごった煮って感じだけど、
わりと綺麗にまとまっている。
時間遡行というストーリーの重大な要素に対してゲームシステムもきちんと
かみ合ってるのもポイント高い。
よくあるボス撃破→拠点へワープ…の一本調子ではなく、ボス撃破後に毎回きちんと違う
展開が挿入されるのにはマジで感心。力入ってるなあ。
まあ流石に後半以降はあっさりめだったけどね。

ゲーム内容はゼルダを横スクロールアクションにした感じ…かな？
（リンクの冒険は未プレイなので実際は知らないが…）
部屋ごとのギミックと主人公の能力を用いてパズルを解いていく。
解けた時の爽快感はもちろん、だんだん思考に要する時間が減っていき、
プレイングの成長が実感できるのが良い。
ただ物理演算がシビアで、答えが分かっているのに上手くいかず
何度もやり直すということも…。そこは少しストレスだった。
最初はおっかなびっくりで動いていたのに気が付けば高い壁なんかも
ひょいひょい登れるようになってるのは、とても気持ちいい。
あと、明らかに模範解答じゃないと思われる力技で何とかなってしまう場面も多い。
賛否分かれるところだと思うけど、自分は攻略に自由度が生まれていて良いと思う。

アクションはややもっさり気味だけど、速さを求められる場面もそれほどないし
あまり気にならなかった。ただ慣性がちょっと強めで、思わぬミスをしでかすことも。

ボス戦は一体ずつ個別に曲があり、いちいちノリノリでかっこいい。
派手な演出も多くてなかなか盛り上がる。
しかしボスの行動はほぼ全てパターンなので、慣れると作業感出てくるかも。

音楽、イラスト等は個人的には満点。サントラ買ってよかった。

まだ自作ステージモードとかあるみたいだけど、ここまででも2000円の価値は十二分にあった。
ゲーフリさんありがとう。続編お願いします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198165724436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1486819690}
review:
該怎麼說呢.... GIGA WREKER稱不上是無懈可擊的神作，但也稱得上是風格獨特的佳作。

總而言之這是一款[解謎大於動作]的2D動作射擊遊戲，跟其他的動作射擊遊戲不太一樣，[回收]是這遊戲的核心玩法，也是用來解謎的關鍵要素，玩家必須把遊戲場景中的[奈米殘骸]回收起來，這些殘骸不僅可以用來打敗更強大的敵人(包括BOSS)，也可以製成方塊來墊腳，當成刀刃來揮砍、化成標槍射向遠處等等。這些殘骸多樣化的功用配合遊戲充滿挑戰(玩到後期根本難到發瘋)的關卡，正是本作的特色。

劇情:我不太敢暴雷，但我敢說劇情相當引人入勝，玩到結局甚至有點小感動。遊戲雖然沒有繁中，但還有簡中，而且翻得相當棒，絲毫沒有機翻嫌疑。

關卡設計:五分靠腦力、四分靠操作、一分靠運氣，正是我對這款遊戲的關卡設計的評價。

畫面:沒什麼好說的，就色彩鮮明的美術風格，不過畫風倒是挺特別的。

BOSS戰:嚴格來說不算太難，由於必須收集殘骸才能對BOSS造成傷害，因此想打敗BOSS，必須先掌握收集殘骸的方法。

音樂:音樂聽起來相當舒服又非常融入遊戲(這邊抱怨一下DLC原聲帶竟然是MP3格式而不是無損格式...)。

缺點:
1.我方和敵方的攻擊判定有點奇怪，明明看起來沒打中卻算打中、看起來打中了卻算沒打中。
2.跳躍判定也是很有問題，有時明明跳上平台了為什麼還會掉下去...
3.不知道是不是我電腦的問題，偶爾會有掉幀的情況，一定程度上影響了遊戲體驗。
4.存檔系統並不是很人性，你只能在固定的場景下進行手動存檔。

還有... 這該說是解謎難度高呢? 還是說[試錯性]相當高呢? 除非你有愛因斯坦的頭腦及神人般的操作，不然很多關卡你都會死個很多次才過得去(包括BOSS戰)，但是不用怕~ 這遊戲可以無限續關，死不用錢的~ 但是千萬千萬別忘了存檔喔!

author: {'steamid': '76561198253814583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1513084683}
review:
First of all, Thanks GAMEFREAK for bringing this game to PC, the game is AMAZING. 

The early stages of the game is quite easy, but in the late game, it is getting harder and harder, even the puzzles are too hard for me at first attemp, they always give me headache when i encounter the puzzles of the late game, especially the lazer puzzle, i love lazer but now i hate it :)). 

The art style of the is UNIQUE, from the environment to characters is very detail, and the screen is like getting dusty or something, i love it :3.

Restart over and over again to get pass hidden area or when fighting bosses. TIMING is YOUR BEST FRIEND IN THIS GAME. I MEAN IT :)).

For the story, 2 words, GREAT and AMAZING, full explanation without making confuse or anything because i always bad at some games related to time stuff.

For the music, i can feel the mood when i listen to these music, BGM for each area, BGM when fighting bosses so GOOD.

Recommend for those are seeking for the challenges. A metroidvania game that is worth to try and experience.

And it seems like the game runs pretty slow on some low-spec pcs although adjusted to the lowest in-game setting, but i can ignore it. 

Final words: get headache everytime solving puzzles is a great experience for the first time playing this game. AMAZING and AWESOME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234881360', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1487346070}
review:
打了两个晚上，终于通关啦！

GIGA WRECKER这个游戏不但烧脑，还能治手残，还能在某种程度上逼死强迫症
游戏以未来科幻为题材，但是舞台是在「现在」这个节点[spoiler]时空悖论？那是什么，能吃吗？[/spoiler]，这种故事背景的游戏虽然到处都是，但是管它套路不套路，我就喜欢它的画风和故事背景，更重要的是两个女主角之间的友[strike]百[/strike]谊[strike]合[/strike]真是可[strike]喜[/strike]歌[strike]闻[/strike]可[strike]乐[/strike]泣[strike]见[/strike]了，[spoiler]只可惜没有相爱相杀的情节[/spoiler]
虽说烧脑，但游戏烧脑难度一般，但是操作上就需要点技巧了，专治手残系列。
以下说一下我各种手残下总结的主角麒麟臂【大雾】能使用四种主要能力的小小使用技巧：
A方块、F刀、↑+F标枪、↓+F钻头【S还原、D普攻】
方块：按A变成一个方块
1、站在墙边对着墙按的话能很稳地贴着墙边出现，不会滚动；
2、配合标枪使用能跳上只生成大方块不够高跳上去的地方；
3、当你想微调一个大东西的位置时【例如激光反射时用到的木块或者石块】，可以不停地ASAS地切换，同时配合一点一点地按方向键，能慢慢推动大东西来调整位置和激光反射的角度，而不会像刀/普攻那样切割/损坏物体；
4、能挡子弹，能反射激光，[spoiler]还能变成小饼干和一条方鱼[/spoiler]。

刀：按F出刀 
1、下刀处切口平整，物体的大小不会损失，能对物体有位移效果，但是位移幅度大，不好控制；
2、刀的技能后期有一个冲击波和回血效果，冲击波能无视物体阻挡，而且攻击距离比普攻长，攻击力和你收集的碎块大小一样，十分实用【冲击波不会对物体有效果，但对怪有伤害，刀本身长度的范围内才会对物体有切割的效果】；回血就不说了，虽然打boss时好像没什么卵用，但是平时过图的时候残血用刀来打小怪很快就回满了。

标枪：按↑+F能投出一把枪
1、配合方块使用上跳上更高的地方，先往墙壁插一把枪，然后跳上枪上面，贴着墙生成一个方块，有些地方就能上去了；
2、标枪后期最多能同时生成3把【我建议先升标枪和刀方向的技能】，而且当你收集的碎块最大的时候，生成3把枪后还能生成一个小方块，是徒手上高处时的好方法，省了很多麻烦；
3、枪能插在之前的枪的尾巴上，就象这样：→→→│
4、枪插在木块或者石头上面时能增加插着那边的重量，过跷跷板时很好用：标一枪，跷跷板下来，过去对面之后按S回收，你站着的那边就比较重了；
5、标枪能变相延长物体的长度，能卡住原有物体不够长的位置，同理，如果你跳得不够远，可以试试在对面插把枪再跳过去，有不少图都需要这个技巧的；
6、在空中可以使用。

钻头：按↓+F射出钻头
1、空中可以使用；
2、刷技能点神技能，有些图一钻头过去就1/2满了，在重置点重置一下【后期可以直接按T】，射一发，再重置，再射能快速刷技能点；
3、和标枪一样能当作远程攻击手段，而且这个能力回收碎块很方便，射出去之后立马按S基本上就能无损失地回收，而标枪是一去没回头的，有种榴弹炮的感觉，但你回收的是弹壳，弹头是不用回收的。

另外发现的一些小技巧：
1、碰到尖刺会即死，但是如果尖刺上面有小怪的残骸或者木块的残骸，就不会有事；
2、吊在空中的长条如果你想他摆动幅度变大，可以移动跳A扔个方块去砸它；当你在长条上时，可以左右来回跑动实现摆动幅度增大；如果想幅度变小，就逆着长条摆动方向跑，或者逆着摆动方向按D普攻【普攻减速效果很大，不适合微调】；
3、重置点可以作为当前地图的存档点，在重置点重置时，你打开了开关会一直打开，但是如果你没有在重置点重置过，死了会回到门口，你开过的所有开关都会变成你刚刚进门时的状态【有些图很恶心，千辛万苦开完机关，一个不小心死了又要重来一次】;
4、游戏初期有些地方有塌方挡路去不了，后期请记住有一个功能：按T重置地图【别找了，核心装置全在塌方后面的图里】；
5、boss出招很单调，就4-5种，但是有二段变化，在原来的基础上数量增多+额外攻击，但是出招的形式基本没变，摸清楚之后只要研究对应的走位的攻击时机就好了，但是手残就没办法了23333[spoiler]虽然脑子里喊着这样做不行，但是身体很老实地走过去吃招了啊，我能有什么办法，我也很绝望啊，我手不受我控制啊！[/spoiler]

剧情方面我就不剧透了，还不错，总之，[spoiler]心疼反派，百合大法好！[/spoiler]

游戏在晨光中Fin，我在晨光中Fin了游戏【NOOOO我的肝撑住啊！】


今天把成就也做齐了~成就挺好刷的，就是找武器皮肤时花的时间比较长，[spoiler]现在地图上都有标注了，但是这里不能发图啊2333[/spoiler]
基本上在矿山就能做齐，有点特殊的是10米砸怪、20米射怪和同时打死8只这三个成就地点有点难找。

1、10米砸怪在矿山，有个地方【好像就是矿山最长的有传送点的那个地方】是要按s飞上去然后一发上勾拳把一个铁块打飞瞬间秒杀3只小怪的地方。那里飞上去之后先不要对铁块上勾拳，绕后把他们三只怪推下去，然后找些碎块按A往下砸就行了。
2、20米射怪在矿山也能做，只要你走到在屏幕里看不见那只怪的位置，一发标枪过去就ok了。
3、同时打死8只怪在一开始橙色区域那里，有个传送点的地点往右下走，你会发现一路上刚好有8只
能用一个小碎块就能秒掉的怪，把他们引到下面的凹槽里，然后继续往右走会有一块小碎块，回收起来之后回去，找好位置一发入八魂w。

author: {'steamid': '76561198149579157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1487362004}
review:
由于Steam说我的原评测超字数，我就简短地说说我的看法。
      优点：
      1. 画风锐利，和故事背景比较契合，但还是保留了萌的感觉。
      2. 关卡设计有潜力。
      3. 原声还可以。 
      4. 杂兵设计和关卡紧密结合，处理起来比较动脑。
      缺点：
      1. BOSS战缺乏变化，只有一种流水线式的打法，极其无聊，同时有许多极其不合理，反常识的设计（第一个高举大刀的BOSS要从头上跳过去；第二个BOSS要直接攻击本体才能取消她的其中一项攻击，即便游戏在第一个BOSS战里让你感觉攻击BOSS本体是没有意义的）。游戏同时也不给你任何研究BOSS打法的机会，大多数玩家可能要连死三次然后才会由游戏借博士之口告诉你打法——而这个过程你每死几次就会重复。
      放简单点讲，就是这个游戏的BOSS战把你当白痴耍。
     2. 故事的节奏很有问题。有许多部分根本没有将感情传递给玩家，而主线剧情本身则明显的不能再明显。
     3. 教学关之外的关卡设计不够直观。

     总之，不是我会推荐给朋友的游戏就是了。

——————————————————————————————————————————

     今天再玩了一会儿。从研究所开始变得有意思了起来，像激光相关的谜题就做的都很不错，很可惜这关新获得的能力标枪没有什么展示的机会就是了。
      
      研究所的BOSS和之前的挑战感觉天差地别，具体地来讲就是多了不少操作空间，像第一与第二个BOSS那样的反常识设计也基本没有了。打到目前为止感受最好的BOSS。
      
      剧情上还是向着预想的方向前进。拥有回到过去能力的女主角一方面消灭了阿基特，另一方面有保持了自己操纵纳米机械的能力……她不会就是阿基特的创造者吧？
       
      阿基特武器说明做的不错，比较好的侧面描写了各个BOSS的性格。可惜第一个BOSS依然是游戏体验给人感觉最差的……

      应该说总算是感觉比较来劲了。现在至少是有能去结束这个游戏的理由了吧？
      
      如果后面体验良好，那就改成推荐吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198100877408', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1487421828}
review:
本来我以为我能忍受，结果发现我不能
愚蠢的掉渣设定导致一些本来很简单的解谜变得巨难无比
蹩脚的操作和物理效果，还有毫无意义的吸附设定都进一步让人火冒三丈
BOSS战解密非常简单，但是操作要求高，一个重复的动作至少做两次，拜托，你没有洛克人那么好的手感好吗
而且容易出现一些莫名奇妙的原因让你吸不够量
我是为什么要在一个一个已经解开的谜题上花无数时间去重来？

author: {'steamid': '76561198062955409', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1498206922}
review:
通关+接近全收集了，从一个普通玩家的视角写一篇评测吧。
《Giga Wrecker》的流程大概可以分为道中的解谜和boss战两部分。我会从这两个方面分别谈谈我自己的看法。接下来的内容可能涉及剧透，请自行斟酌。

解谜：设计精巧。想出最优解需要花一番功夫，但有些时候用野路子解决别有风味。解谜元素多样，各色技能的功用也并不局限于条条框框内（比如标枪不仅能够垫脚，有时候还能用来调节配重）。唯一的缺点大概是物理引擎比较奇怪，在弹力凝胶和石块互动的时候尤其魔性。此外主角竟然无法推动地图中的物体，只能一下一下地用箱子砸...

战斗：道中的战斗其实带有很大的解谜成分，故接下来只谈boss战。
几个boss画风不错，打起来也紧张刺激。我（普通手残玩家）击破每个boss平均花了半个小时左右，难度应该算是刚刚好，能获得不少成就感，又不至于虐到你退坑。

一些缺点：boss的攻击方式以循环为主，随机出招的boss只有两个。如果把毗娜达做成随机招式的话，似乎可以让这场boss战的精彩程度再上一个台阶？
最终boss相当不用心，无论是bgm还是攻击方式...
建议删除蹲下回血，或者至少在boss战中让这个技能无效。在boss输出的间隙抱头蹲防会让这个游戏简单十倍。
后期的剧情和boss战有赶工痕迹。第二次出场的boss们甚至没有p2...

以上碎碎念并不代表游戏的素质不佳，只是对它感到有些遗憾。在平台游戏式微的现在，《Giga Wrecker》依然是一款不错的作品。考虑到制作时（在任天堂压榨下）可能并不充裕的成本和时间，游戏本身已经足够给我惊喜，也能对得起这个中规中矩的价格。

（另：有没有大佬告诉我神戈系列的箱子的设计图在哪里...外观全收集就差它了）

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198111213805', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1486751468}
review:
[spoiler] IJI的松鼠大战版。[/spoiler]

很不错的平台动作解谜游戏。谜题很精巧，难度适中。一些地方对操作有要求，不过总的来说还不算反人类。p.s. 因为物理引擎的缘故很多谜题解法不唯一，有时也要靠点运气。

收集要素没什么难度，基本上该拿的东西都在路边不大会错过。可收集道具只有武器模型有点不爽，游戏内妹子自己都吐槽了，你哪怕弄几套衣服呢。

画风可爱。主角和boss都很戳萌点。动作语音好顶赞。毗娜达姐姐我爱你。

故事背景有点像IJI。不过要是跟IJI比的话这个游戏的剧情就没什么亮点了，不过反正妹子萌就行。

BOSS战很精彩，就是有点少。[spoiler]而且几个BOSS重复利用有凑数之嫌。所有BOSS里我感觉最难的是毗娜达（不论哪条时间线），可剧情反而是最先打她。其它BOSS难度远不如她。[/spoiler]

下蹲回血是个非常非常糟糕的设计。[spoiler]下蹲并不会妨碍你的行动，因此boss战时你可以时刻保持高速回血状态，使得很多boss战（例如最终boss）变得极其简单。[/spoiler]

11日补充：

又打了一遍，感觉这游戏思路有点问题。解谜、战斗和角色成长这三者的关系没有处理好。

战斗前面说过了。等级上去了后期boss就是平推。所以要是实在卡战斗的话可以找地方刷会儿级……就是很蛋疼。

一般来说，解谜部分应该只挑战玩家的水平，和角色等级没有关系。也就是说，谜题不会因为角色升级而变得更容易。这里就得说一下三连射——极个别地方没它过不去（印象里只有一处，进天空城之前拿图纸的地方），而点出三连后有些谜题可以直接暴力破解，解谜变成了平台。我觉得要么取消三连射，要么一开始就给玩家这个技能比较好。不过好在绝大部分谜题没这个问题。

因此说到升级，除了加血之外，最有用的两个技能就是下蹲回血和三连射（再加一个稳定方块，能省不少事），其它技能都很鸡肋，不为拿成就的话不升也罢。而假如早早点满这两个能力的话……请享受easy模式的游戏吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198021479703', 'num_games_owned': 2822, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1572308415}
review:
ロックマンみたいなゲームかと思ってたらパズルアクションだった。
パズル自体の難易度は高くないと思うけどアクションがちょっとしんどい。
基本的に主人公の装備と地形破壊とギミックを駆使してパズルを解くことになる。
この破壊した地形の破片まで当たり判定を持っているのが非常に厄介で、
その破片のせいで滑って落ちたりジャンプがうまく出来なかったりすることが多々あり、これがかなりのストレスになる。
ボス戦は全てギミック戦闘で大したアクションも必要無いので凄く簡単、道中の方がよっぽど死ぬ。
それとシナリオの都合上同じボスと2回戦う事になるんだけど、2回ともギミックがほぼ同じなのはちょっとどうかと。

キャラはとてもかわいいし敵ボスのデザインは凄く好みで音楽と絵には文句のつけようが無いくらい。
強いて言うとしたらデザインが好みなだけにもっとたくさんボスキャラがいてほしかったかな。

ストーリーはいい感じだけど個人的に最後はちょっともやっとした。
ただシンフォギアGXを見てオートスコアラーを気に入った影響で
同じくロボ子の出るこのゲームを衝動買いした身としては概ね満足な内容ではあった。
かわいい敵キャラが死んじゃうのって辛いよね。

ちなみに実績はレベルエディタで専用のステージ作っちゃえばサクッと解除出来るよ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198109167893', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1487493111}
review:
好话：亮眼的画风，精致的人设，无与伦比的boss战，很有脑洞的怪物设定，bgm在游戏的很多地方相当应景，竟然有中文？？？



坏话：基本感觉不到cv的存在，过分注重解谜，击杀怪物的方式单一，重复性有点高，地图实在是容易迷路，卡关现象严重






写测评的时候玩的时间不是很长，才7个小时左右，如果有偏颇，我会尽量在全成就之后补上。


       游戏的立意非常棒，在剧情上交错的时空，智械（误），以及主人公听起来很复杂其实很简单的攻击方式，在游戏刚开始的时候色彩鲜明的配色一度我担心会不会到了游戏后期让我看不清我在哪，但是后来发现根本不会，虽然有些眼花缭乱，但是给人的仅仅是爽快感。游戏在优化上有些小问题，容易掉帧什么的影响不是很大，基本可以忽略（听说原来对inter6代优化有问题）。游戏在手柄模式下表现非常好，完美的震动设定给人很强的反馈。以上使游戏的硬实力非常强，让人在上手的一瞬间感觉到一种神秘的力量从手柄和键盘中冒出。

       在游戏的解谜要素非常多，基本上没有硬刚这条路，必须要解谜，但是这点并没有让人感觉到枯燥，因为每次解谜所用的方法都不同，除了有几处大同小异之外基本上都很有想法，有些解谜上要花些心思，有些则需要动动手，但是有些既要花心思又要动手的……虽然解谜设置的非常好，但是在重复探索地图的时候，也要重复解谜，这就尴尬了，经常出现一个谜题要不停的进行游玩，这些平时来说觉得无所谓，但是一旦卡关这很有可能就是卸游戏的导火索。

       游戏地图看起来不是很大，其实还是需要很长时间跑一跑的，每一张小地图里面都有相当多的要素，这然游戏充满了乐趣，因为你不知道你什么时候会进入下一张地图，需要必须不停探索，探索好地图的每一个角落。但是这时候会暴露一个游戏本身不小的缺陷，有一些地方因为色彩太花哨而看不到路，这就会使刚开始的玩家经常找不到路。游戏对于玩家进行地图探索也基本没有引导，虽然增加了探索感，但是一旦找错路很有可能就是长时间找不到正确的路，这一点icey做的绝对好（可怜的旁白）

       个人认为游戏的精髓在boss战，每个boss都有不一样的技能，每一个boss都有很多个阶段。boss战真的相当的不容易，可贵的是boss的难度真的刚刚好，让你感觉能过却又不是很简单能过的，不过boss战基本没有解谜要素，这很让人遗憾，但是也可以接受，每个boss都有提示，还算贴心。不过boss战太过突出总有些不是很舒服，因为这样一来探索其他地方就变得不是那么有意思，其他时间的探索就好像仅仅是为了打个boss，这给人一种枯燥感。

      这部游戏需要探索的地方相当的多，但是可探索的要素种类却比较少，相对来说也不是那么有意思，甚至有一些收集要素并没有系统的提示，收集要素无聊就没有很大的动力进行二周目，这对于一个做了这多要素的在制作组来说不是个好信号。游戏的物理引擎似乎也有一些问题，有些细节会出现匪夷所思的事情，这点不用细说，也说不清楚，不过上手一个小时之内应该就能感觉出来。

       相比于同样是2d解谜游戏的《勇敢的心》来说，总体素质有一些差距，从bgm到旁白，从主题到互动，但是不意味着这部游戏不是一个好游戏，明快的画风，爽快的boss战足以让你从心里面被这部游戏圈粉，这部游戏绝对不辱pm开发组的名头。


       希望大家会喜欢这部作品。






























        并且不要和我抢老婆。

author: {'steamid': '76561198096194594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1498463999}
review:
Купил я эту игру за полную стоимость и ни чуть не жалею. Лично для меня, она стала воплощением тех эмоций, которые я испытывал в детстве, когда играл в платформеры на денди, не того хардкора, а именно эмоций. Но обо всем по порядку.

Геймплей, собственно, делится на две части - путь до босса (условно головоломки) и сам босс. Могу сказать, что обе эти состовляющие показались мне такими, какими они должны быть, т.е. головоломки недостаточно сложные, чтобы бросить, и недостаточно легкие, чтобы надоесть. Боссы недостаточно сложные, чтоб потеть над ними весь день, и недостаточно легкие, чтоб убить с 1 раза и не заметить. К слову все боссы мне понравились, а еще меня особо впечатлили картинки перед боссами, они интересны в плане стилистики и выглядят довольно эпично :)

Об остальном могу сказать, что звуковое сопрождение красиво, графика приятна, сюжет - типичные манипуляции со временем, но со своими неожиданными решениями и поворотами. Также присутсвует мастерская и редактор уровней, что, в перспективе, может дать много хорошего контента.

Минус я заметил только один - слишком долгое вхождение во весь потенциал игры. Лично я немного подустал от игры, пока шел до 1 босса, но потом мне начали давать новые умения, а головоломки стали более интересными, и эта усталость развеялась.

Вывод: обязательна к прохождению всем любителям 2D платформеров и желающим вспомнить старые приставки без напряженного прохождения. Всем остальным могу сказать, что перед вами приятная игра с которой можно провести не один вечер.
